story:
This is it!

A couple of weeks ago we were invited by a wedding house "Eden" (www.salaweselna.org) from Petryki (central Poland) to come and stay there for a couple of days. We've said a big YES and organised a couple of concerts in that area (including the capitol of region - Poznań).

In the meantime, an opportunity appeared to use the space that "Eden" has to offer and record our music there! With that recording we would be able to release our very first album!

Saying that, we would like to ask You to support us! We need to cover our travel and a part of the recording expenses. In return we will shower You with gifts!


Where the money goes

We are 5 people with a bunch of instruments:
electric harmonium, clarinets, alto saxophone, bass drum, contrabass and a couple of smaller instruments.
We need to cover our travel costs from The Netherlands to Poland and back. The cost of such a trip is around 750€.

The rest of the money would go to the recording company that we are going to work with (www.recart.pl). The cost of a recording session is around 1500€. We have already some support from the wedding house "Eden" that will cover a part of recording expenses. We are also negotiating with another company about the same matter.

In the case that we would get more than we need, all the money would go to the Omega Impact Jar. We would use that money for future projects.


Make some noise!

Please, help us to spread our message of love and hope into the Polish hearts in Poland! Tell about our campaign to your familly and friends. Let the world hear about us!

Don't be indifferent! Support OMEGA IMPACT!

www.youtube.com/omegaimpactmusic
www.facebook.com/omegaimpactmusic

story:
Short Summary

A few weeks ago I premiered an original song of mine called, "Disappear," (click HERE to listen) and the response has been nothing short of amazing. Now it's time for me to reach another milestone and create my first ever music video! 

This video will be the creative brainchild of me and director Todd Burr (who is an INCREDIBLE director and has shot  videos for Chicago rapper Towkio.  Check THIS out). It will also feature some of the best dancers I know: IMANI NIA, Ariel Monét, and Claude "CJ" Johnson. 

In order to make this dream of ours come true, we need YOUR help. 

These are all young, brilliant, Chicago artists and I want to make sure they are fairly compensated. We also need help paying for equipment, supplies, and making the final, finishing touches on the video. Below is a full breakdown of everything we need to make this video a reality. 

Anything you can give is appreciated! Those who are major contributors will get some perks and rewards. But beyond that, knowing that you are a part of a community that is supporting great art is truly invaluable and greatly appreciated.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support! 

-Akenya.


What We Need

Here's the breakdown of everything and the overall cost:

Camera (2 batt.)........…….$185

Assistant...........................$120

2 Lenses............................$50

Generator………………….....$60 - 100

Movi + Tripod…………….....$125

Lights + Stand……………….$80

Flex Fil.................................$10 - $15

Props..................................$100

Shooting………………….......$600

Editing……………………........$200

Color………………………........$200

Dancers..............................$400

Rehearsal Space...............$350

Total...................................$2,500


The Impact

You'll be helping me make a huge milestone in my music career, helping to create work for up and coming artists, and contributing to a beautiful, meaningful piece of art!


Risks & Challenges

If we are not able to raise enough money to meet our goal, then our artistic vision will have to be compromised. In order to make a quality product, every bit of our ultimate goal is essential. 

The biggest challenge overall is that we only have 3 weeks to raise these funds. However, I believe that with determination and the impact of sharing this campaign and spreading the word with others, we can make this dream come true!


Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing this project and getting the word out is the biggest way you can help outside of donating. 

If you want to be involved in the video shoot itself, we'll definitely need extra hands on set to help move, set up and breakdown equipment.

If volunteering is something that interests you and you would like to get involved, please send an email to disappearthevideo@gmail.com!

story:
Thank you for taking a moment to check out this campaign.  My name is Trevor Graves.  I am a singer-songwriter from Scottsville, Kentucky.

For a few years now, I have been feeling the call to give more time to music ministry and evangelism, but transitioning from school teacher to traveling musician seemed financially impossible.   After much prayer and some counsel from my lovely wife, I finally came to the conclusion that I just needed to take a leap of faith and see God move.   It has truly been amazing to see how God has opened one door after another to help us begin this journey. 

Over the past several months, I have been working diligently co-writing, re-writing, and recording the beginning of my first EP.  I am now ready to finish the project and release a single to Christian radio stations around the country.  This opportunity will be a huge step for my family and me as we pursue this avenue of ministry.

We greatly appreciate any support that you are willing to give.  Your pledge will help cover the costs of recording, production, graphic design, cd duplication, marketing, radio promotion, and any other expenses related to the project.  Please share this campaign with someone and pray for us that we will  effectively fulfill all that God calls us to do.

story:
Incredible News … I have a ‘New Goal’. 


Initially, my campaign was to raise money, for my trip to Nashville (Music City USA) to record a new 4-song EP. By the grace of God, as the campaign progressed and the recording in Nashville drew closer, I was blessed by some very special people, with a loan, for the funding required. I have now been to Nashville and my EP is finished and I couldn’t be more grateful. 

My ‘NEW GOAL’ with this campaign is to raise enough money to pay back those incredible people who stepped up to the plate and made my recording sessions in Nashville possible. Click the following link to hear samples of the mastered cuts from Nashville. http://lanceisrael.biz/nashville/

 

Financial Goals

For this campaign I am aiming to raise and pay back $12,000, to my major contributors.  

$ 8700 of which was spent on, the studio, producer, engineer, musicians and video. 

$ 1700 was spent on travelling expenses, food & hotel accommodations 

$ 600 Album Artwork: 

$ 1000 duplication

Total: $ 12,000

Some of the folks from My Nashville Team

Mr. James Rea from The Producer’s Chair in Nashville, who introduced me to my producer Mr. Randy Barr and essentially opened the door to Nashville.    


Thank you Randy Barr for surrounding me with some of the most talented folks in Nashville, including of course yourself!! From the initial stages of selecting the right songs, the right studio, the right musicians, scheduling the studio time, pre-production time, crafting the musical arrangements  through tracking sessions, overdubs, laying down lead vocals, harmonies and mixing to mastering, you were amazing and a joy to work with. Thank you sooo much!! And big thanks to all of the following talented people who made this project possible.


 

Nashville recording artist Lizzie Paul, who sang all of the back-ground vocals, 



Robb Lane, who engineered my project

 

Some of The Musicians, whom I had the honor of working with.

 

Greg Marrow - Drums

Credits: Dolly Parton, Alison Krauss, Alabama, Johnny Mathis, Steve Wariner, Amy Grant, Sheryl Crow, Toby Keith, Joe Cocker, Steve Earle, Bad Company, Lynard Skinner, Luke Bryon, John Fogerty, Darius Rucker, Blake Shelton, Eric Clapton, Ashley Monroe, John Oats (Hall & Oats), Tricia Yearwood

Eli Beaird - Bass

Credits: Merl Haggard, James Bay, Luke Bryon, News Boys, Kix Brooks, Joey & Rory, Tristen, Robin Mead, Sherry Lynn, Gary Nichelson, Cledus T. Judd,  

Jeff King - Guitar

Credits: Gaither Vocal Band, Point of Grace, Bret Eldredge, Locash Cowboys, Craig Morgan, Dave Mathews, Johnny Cash, Luke Bryon, Reba McEntire, Kenny Loggins, The Statler Bros, Oakridge Boys, Art Garfunkel, Lori Morgan, Pam Tillis, Randy Travis, Juice Newton, Lee Brice, Jay Leno, Dave Letterman

Beaird Recording Studio


MUSIC FOR HEALING AND MEDITATION

I was given my first bamboo flute 21 years ago in Maui, Hawaii and have since magnetized an ecclectic collection of wooden and bamboo flutes, whose origins span several continents and cultures.

Included in my rewards are 4 albums of original music, which I recorded with my collection of wooden and bamboo flutes from around the world.

Click on this link to hear samples or purchase songs from my previously recorded instrumental albums. http://lanceisrael.biz/music/



SPIRIT LED COUNSELING
I use the soothing sounds of the flutes during sessions to help clear the mind, open the heart and create a safe place of heightened receptivity. As we come more clearly into the moment whatever is relevant will arise.


How Awesome this Will Be!

For a long time, I've sensed that I've been given a message and I've felt compelled to share my music with as many people as possible. It's a message of hope and peace. It's a message of life and renewed strength and connection. It's a message of love in all and for all. For me this message expresses itself in the lyrics and melodies of the songs that have been gifted to me, as well as the vibrations of the ancient flutes, I've been working with. If you can help to make my dreams and vision a reality, I intend wholeheartedly, to pay it forward and help as many others as I can.

story:
¿Quiénes somos?

Somos el Medio es un espacio informativo enfocado en derechos humanos, educación, comunidades indígenas, movimientos sociales, exclusión, cultura, migración, territorio, sustentabilidad, política y medios.

Nos sumamos a la corriente digital que busca la democratización de los medios de información. Más de cuatro años de trabajo nos acompañan y han dado como resultado un periodismo independiente, profesional y autogestivo.

Somos el Medio mantiene una perspectiva crítica. Nos comprometemos con la circulación libre de ideas, con la firme convicción de que informar permite a la sociedad participar, opinar, aprender y decidir.

El reto

Somos el Medio se sumado a las iniciativas globales de comunicación que han renunciado a convertir la información en mera mercancía, por lo que plantea recuperar la esencia socializadora y humana del periodismo. Por consiguiente este espacio no es pagado por  patrocinadores con fines comerciales o políticos y tampoco cobra ni cobrará por su lectura.

Nuestro objetivo es seguir siendo un espacio de comunicación libre y preocupado por difundir temas de interés social que hasta ahora no tocan los medios convencionales; esa es nuestra meta principal. Por esto te invitamos a formar parte de esta tarea siendo garante de nuestra labor periodística. Ayúdanos a financiar Somos el Medio para lograr mantenerlo libre e independiente.

Para lograr esto necesitamos $12,000 USD que nos ayudará a  llevar a cabo un plan de trabajo  que esta proyectado para tener una duración de cuatro meses.  

El plan  está dividido en tres partes:

  • Rediseño de la página web Somoselmedio.org como nuestra plataforma principal.
  • Financiamiento de coberturas
  • Impresión de un periódico mensual que contenga los mejores reportajes de cada mes. Esto con el objetivo de alcanzar nuevas audiencias.

¿Quiénes conformamos Somos el medio? 

Isabel Argüello

Licenciada en Comunicación y Cultura por la Universidad Autónoma de la Ciudad de México (UACM).  Ha colaborado en prensa, radio y televisión. Formó parte del Comité Editorial de Babel, una publicación con apoyo del Fondo Nacional para la Cultura y las Artes; y de Mediorama, una revista electrónica de la UACM; también fue reportera de Fortuna y Contralínea, enfocadas a temas económicos, políticos y sociales; guionista y reportera de “A tiempo 21”, los noticiarios de Capital 21, Sistema de Radio y Televisión del Gobierno del Distrito Federal. Es editora en Somos el medio. Además, está afiliada a la Asociación Mexicana de Derecho a la Información. 

Isabel Sanginés

Politóloga, maestra en Estudios Latinoamericanos y fotógrafa. Se desempeña como docente en la UNAM y en la UACM y como fotógrafa para medios independientes. 

Julio César Ibañez Rangel

Comunicador de internet, desarrollador multimedia.

Mario Marlo

Comunicólogo por la  UACM. Ha investigado y cubierto la migración centroamericana en la frontera sur de México,  el Movimiento por la Paz con Justicia y Dignidad, la Caravana de Madres Centroamericanas, el caso Ayotzinapa entre otros. 

Actualmente es director de  Somoselmedio y  editor de  El Ciudadano.cl medio de comunicación chileno.

story:
Short Summary

Renee Hayes is a singer, songwriter, certified counselor, career/life coach, arts administrator and all around creative spirit.  After decades of singing with an acapella group, The Irrationals, as well as background vocals on other people’s releases, Renee is producing her first solo release, Renewable Soul, due out Spring 2014. 

Renewable Soul is a collection of heart and soul songs about the art and craft of living in the musical style described as “eclectic acoustic soul”.  This ‘musical community garden’ is a creative collaboration of fellow artists, friends and family who provided original songs, and are working very hard to support the recording, production and promotion of this inspiring project.  Renewable Soul is more than a passive listening experience (although listening to the songs is great!).  The lyrics for each song include an activity and question to consider that provides an opportunity for the listener to gain some insight about life, creativity, and one’s place in this astounding and sometimes absurd world.

Renee believes that music can be a powerful source for growth and renewal and that ‘life is just a chance to grow a soul’. This campaign is to raise $7,500; a third of the expenses needed to record, produce and distribute the release. Contributing to this project will help Renee achieve the goal of nurturing and renewing others through the music of her talented, diverse and wise creative community.

What We Need & What You Get

The total cost of this CD project is a little more than $20,000, of which we are looking to raise $7,500 during this online campaign.  $3,500 will go towards a portion of recording studio time and another $2,500 toward manufacturing of the CD and the development of an interactive website, $1,000 will help with the costs for the liner notes and inserts and the remaining $500 in online campaign fees.

Here’s What You Get with your contribution.  No amount is too small.  Your contribution will make a profound difference and allow for the completion of the project.  This CD is more than a collection of songs—it’s a musical community garden.


Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for taking the time to look into our campaign to release Renewable Soul.  In addition to contributing, there are other ways you can support this project.  We know that there are many ways that people can contribute to a project other than financial support (although it’s great to get a contribution, too)!  Let’s help grow this community garden of music!

  • Please pass the word.  Send the link to this campaign to your own community of friends, colleagues and like-minded creative, artsy, and other musical types. The more interest we can generate for Renewable Soul, the more likely we will be able to reach our campaign goal.
  • Like us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/renee.hayes.963
  • Visit the Renewable Soul website at http://reneehayesmusic.com/homeand sign up for updates on the upcoming release.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools as a way to spread the word.

studio time and another $2,500 toward manufacturing of the CD and the
development of an interactive website, $1,000 will help with the costs for the liner
notes and inserts and the remaining $500 in online campaign fees.
Here’s What You Get with your contribution. 
No amount is too small.  Your
contribution will make a profound difference and allow for the completion of
the project.  This CD is more than a
collection of songs—it’s a musical community garden.
Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for taking the time to look into our campaign to release Renewable Soul.  In addition to contributing, there are other
ways you can support this project.  We
know that there are many ways that people can contribute to a project other
than financial support (although it’s great to get a contribution, too)!  Let’s help grow this
     community garden of music!



Please pass the word.  Send the link to this campaign to your
     own community of friends, colleagues and like-minded creative, artsy, and
     other musical types. The more interest we can generate for Renewable Soul, the more likely we
     will be able to reach our campaign goal.
Like us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/renee.hayes.963

Visit the Renewable Soul
     website at http://reneehayesmusic.com/homeand sign up for updates on the
     upcoming release.
Use the Indiegogo share tools
     as a way to spread the word.

story:
Hi, we are D-Cent Jerks from Puerto Rico. Thank you for checking out our campaign. 

     Being a band based on an island can make touring overseas a little difficult, especially when you're looking at airline tickets for 6 band members, van rental and gear rental. We've been able to raise enough funds a few times to tour the east coast US thanks to everyone who supports us by going to shows, buying our music and merchandise. This time we have a west coast US tour booked for August 2014 and most of our savings are going into making our new record to be released in August as well. We created this fund raising campaign in hopes that all our friends, fans and family could help us reach our goal and make this tour a success.  

     We hope to raise $5,500. Contributions will be used to help us cover travel expenses mentioned above. This includes 6 round trip airline tickets, van rental for 10 days and gear rental. You can pledge any amount you wish and depending on what you pledge, we are offering some awesome exclusive rewards. Check them out! By donating, you're basically buying our new record and/or merchandise in advance and in addition getting some pretty cool exclusive stuff while helping us reach our goal. 

If our goal is not met, we are still going to do everything in our power to make this tour possible but it will be a struggle. We know we can count on your support to make this tour a success. Please help us reach our goal! Thank you friends, fans and family!

Other Ways You Can Help:

We understand that not everyone can contribute, but you can still help us by getting the word out about our campaign. Please check out and use the Indiegogo share tools. Thanks!!

story:
Short Summary

Those of you who have seen us performing before always comment that we don't get a cool slot that helps us to be heard or seen more. 

This time is different! 

we have a chance to perform in one of the coolest metal festivals in Italy, sharing the main stage with Moonspell, Behemoth, Kreator and more.

7:30PM on the main stage.. how cool is that?

we cannot afford the trip expenses.. this is why we need your help.

What We Need

we need the airline tickets + visa cost + internal transportation since the festival is 4 hours away from Rome, this means mini van for the band + gas money

The Impact

we believe that if we managed to get some spot on our music, this is will actually open more doors for us to perform in more countries and eventually share our music with everywhere.

story:
‘Music doesn't lie. If there is something to be changed in this world, then it can only happen through music.”

-Jimi Hendrix

...

Have you ever had a story you HAD TO TELL?

Remember how you felt the first time you fell in love?  Could you, even if you wanted to,  forget the pain of breaking up?

Sappy enough for you? Lol

So you know about San Diego, right? Wrong. I grew up on the rough side (yeah, there is one), in a split parent home where a lot of the time, as much as I love my mom and dad, I was forced to grow up quickly and raise myself and my brother. I didn’t have it all and still don’t, but I always found a way. It was never easy. As smart as I am/was, I made some dumb decisions. I lived my life as if there were no consequences and paid them, sometimes dearly. Through it all, I always loved to make people feel good, and I happened to be able to do so through my voice.

In between trying to find my place in the world and trying to get myself out of whatever crazy situation I had gotten myself into, I discovered a love for music and entertaining. I loved to perform renditions of classics (my mom introduced me to everyone from Billie Holiday to Dionne Warwick), and I love to make people feel good, bad, sad etc, but above all, FEEL something. I knew I wanted to do this on a larger scale, but was too young to realize that music could be that.

With the encouragement of people like my cousin Becky (who once made me perform in an airport!), Tell me how you felt…I decided that I needed more, and I moved to LA. Like a lot of people, I quickly realized that making it in Hollywood wasn’t going to be easy. Paint the picture…400 square foot apt in MexicanvilleI knew where I wanted to be, but wandered a long for a while trying to find out how to get there. At one point, I got tired of waiting, and told myself I couldn’t anymore and began writing a set of EP’s that I wanted to give to the world. These EP’s covered everything from my saddest times, to my cat Stoli (kindve), to that one night me and my friends (***CRAZY story*****) Perfect soap opera technique – leave them wanting more!

So here it is, I need to raise some money to give the best version of my story; Not a lot, but some to cover recording, production costs, and some marketing. My EP’s will play like a story, with an accompanying video for each song (So basically, we’ll be doing it better than Beyonce). I have everything in line production wise (musicians/producers, videographers, website designers, etc)

My goal is to raise $10,000, and here is EXACTLY what donations will go to

$2250- Recording: 10 songs ($225 for tracking/mixing)  at Strz Enterprises

$750- for instrumentals (4 in house tracks (free), 5 outsourced tracked @ $150/track)

$1000- Interactive Website 

$500- graphics for website and EP artwork 

$3000- Videography for videos (click here to see her work, she's AWESOME)

$500 – Social network promotional ads

$2000- EP release party venue (More we raise, the better the venue)

I love where music is going and how artists are finally getting the freedom to create for their fans off of what they truly feel inside. I want to be one of those artists. I want to leave people with a feeling the way Etta James and Marvin Gaye used to make my mom feel. AS much as I respect today’s artist, I think there’s a void to fill, and I think I can do that with my stories, my passion, and my commitment to make anyone who listens to my music know that they’re not the only ones going through something.

ANYTHING you can contribute will be greatly appreciated. For everyone who donates, you will receive an advanced/signed copy of the EP and a ticket to our industry listening party. 

It means so much to me that you even have considered helping me to accomplish my dreams. I don't intend to make you anything but proud! Stay tuned, you will NOT be disappointed!

-Alysse

story:
Short Summary

After performing and seeing the darker side of the music industry, we've finally decided to take matters into our own hands and want to raise money for our brand new 6 song EP (which is already in production), and a 4 month North American Tour. In the last few years, we have released several singles and demo's and we thought it was about time to take our music to the masses. We are not just asking for you to pay for our entire album and tour, we are spending more than $8,000.00 of our own money to make this happen.

We are finally free from all obligations and want to be in control of our “careers”. In general, the record industry is backwards and we'd be stupid to renegotiate with anyone at this time. Crowd funding seems to be something that's working. Whether or not this is the next thing for the music industry, it's a way that supporters of a band can know exactly where their hard earned dollars are going. 

What We Need & What You Get

Over the last couple months, we kept our ears to the ground, watched other people use this method and actually succeed. There have been many different approaches and fans of music are starting to understand this format, but we are going one step further and letting you how the money gets spent.

Making an album and touring is an expensive en devour. We know that success requires many sacrifices, which we are willing to make. We want you all to be part of this journey and your sponsorship will go a long way to helping us achieve our goal. Please remember that every dollar counts and every one of you is an important part of our team.

We will account to you to show you how every penny is spent and prove that making a top notch record comes at a price. Who knows, if we exceed our goal we will be able to do things we may have only dreamed about. Essentially, the success of this campaign will determine how amazing this record will become. We are set up for Flex Funding which means if we don't reach our goal, we are still getting the money that is raised. Regardless, we are ready to deliver this thing however our campaign plays out.

Remember, many of the perks offered here are a one time deal and may never be offered again!

The Impact

By taking part in this experiment you yourself are taking charge and helping to change how we make music. You are putting faith in us to come through and show you that we've learned a couple things over the last few years.

With your support, we will not settle for “good enough” - we wont take any shortcuts, and above all – the money we raise in this thing will be reflected in the final product.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't know what to think about this idea and aren't sure you can commit – there are other ways you can help out. Spread the word! Tell your family and friends and let them know what's going on. We don't expect everyone who's listened to and enjoyed our music to jump on board, just let people know this is happening. With all the social networking and ways we now connect with one another, by posting links to this page you are reaching places we would never be able to reach.


Budget

Here's a projected budget we've prepared to give you an idea as to how we've planned to allocate the funds. (Budget is based on reaching our goal).

Budget for 'Who's Laughing Now'

Studio Amount

Our investment                                                      $8,000

Fundraising                                                          $40,000

Indigogo Fees                                                       -$2,800

Show Income                                                         $13,500

                               Total income                          $58,700


EP Expenses  Amount

Studio Time                                                              $6,000

Wages                                                                      $1,500

Tech Work, Session Fees                                         $1,100

Mastering                                                                   $600

Art Work                                                                     $475

Duplication                                                              $2,150

Merchandise                                                            $8,950

Promotion                                                                $2,600

                                      Total                                $23,375

Tour Expenses Amount

Transportation                                                       $14,000

Wages                                                                    $10,200

Accomodations                                                        $4,700

Food                                                                        $4,200

Rentals                                                                       $900

Misc                                                                         $1,200

                                      Total                                $35,200

Total fixed and variable expenses                          $58,575

Difference between income and expenses                   $125

Summer Tour

As we mentioned earlier, this funding will also help us to bring the music to the masses and we are hard at work booking our Summer Tour Schedule. The following are the locations we will be visiting between May 31, 2014 and August 30 2014. (We are always happy to add more locations!)

Canada

Kitchener, Toronto, Oshawa, Belleville, Kingston, Ottawa, Gatineau, Montreal, Quebec, St. John, Moncton, Charlottetown, Dartmouth, Halifax, Yarmouth, Calgary, Winlaw, Kamloops, Surrey, Vancouver

USA

Portland, Boston, New York, Buffalo, Seattle, Portland, San Francisco, Los Angeles, San Diego

story:
Short Summary

Concordia Santa Fe is a 501 (c) (3) non-profit organization that operates three professional concert series in Northern New Mexico, along with the High Desert Winds, an educational/community outreach program supplementing the public and private secondary music education programs in the area.

Our funding needs are as diverse as the programs that we operate, but our most immediate expenses will be associated with the wind orchestra concert scheduled for March 23, 2014.  Our 40-member ensemble will perform under the baton of Dr. James Smart, Director of Bands and Trumpet at the University of Montana.  Click here for more information on the concert.

What We Need

Your assistance in funding our organization will allow us to add the following proposed projects to our existing programs:

  • Private lesson scholarship fund for deserving students
  • Additional performances in neighboring communities and schools by our professional ensembles and the High Desert Winds
  • Commissioned compositions and guest soloists
  • Stipends for our professional musicians, who currently donate 45 to 90 hours annually in rehearsals and performances, plus countless hours in personal preparation

These proposed additions are above and beyond our current operating expenses, which include:

  • Rehearsal and performance venue rental
  • Sheet music purchase and rental
  • Guest conductors' honoraria, plus travel and lodging expenses
  • Advertising and promotional expenses

The Impact

Our professional ensembles have greatly enriched the performing arts offerings of Santa Fe and the surrounding area.  Audience members have responded enthusiastically to the diverse repertoire that we present, and we have garnered a broader audience profile than many traditional orchestras and chamber societies.  Our guest conductors praise the efforts of these ensembles as a logical extension of the flourishing wind ensemble programs present in today's colleges and universities.

The High Desert Winds has provided engaging and challenging musical experiences for high-school students enrolled in area public and private school band programs.  The experience of rehearsing and performing alongside professional adult musicians has led several of our student participants to pursue music majors in college.  The ensemble helps to bridge the gap between school band programs and private lessons.

We are fortunate to be the 4-time recipient of annual grant funding from New Mexico Arts, a state-run arts advocacy organization, and have also received funding from the New Mexico Department of Tourism to assist our advertising and promotion efforts.  We are currently in the process of seeking additional grant funding from:

  • City of Santa Fe Arts Commission
  • The McCune Foundation
  • National Endowment for the Arts
  • Santa Fe Community Foundation

Despite these public and private funding efforts, the vast majority of our budget is supported by individual donors like you!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you can't make a financial contribution at this time, but please also consider helping us out in any of the following ways:

  • Share this project page with your friends, family, and colleagues
  • Like us on Facebook (and share us, too!)
  • Volunteer your time
  • Come to our eleven annual performances at the St. Francis Auditorium in Santa Fe!

Additional performances in neighboring communities and schools by our professional ensembles and the High Desert Winds

Commissioned compositions and guest soloists

Stipends for our professional musicians, who currently donate 45 to 90 hours annually in rehearsals and performances, plus countless hours in personal preparation
These proposed additions are above and beyond our current operating expenses, which include:
Rehearsal and performance venue rental
Sheet music purchase and rental
Guest conductors' honoraria, plus travel and lodging expenses
Advertising and promotional expenses

The ImpactOur professional ensembles have greatly enriched the performing arts offerings of Santa Fe and the surrounding area.  Audience members have responded enthusiastically to the diverse repertoire that we present, and we have garnered a broader audience profile than many traditional orchestras and chamber societies.  Our guest conductors praise the efforts of these ensembles as a logical extension of the flourishing wind ensemble programs present in today's colleges and universities.The High Desert Winds has provided engaging and challenging musical experiences for high-school students enrolled in area public and private school band programs.  The experience of rehearsing and performing alongside professional adult musicians has led several of our student participants to pursue music majors in college.  The ensemble helps to bridge the gap between school band programs and private lessons.We are fortunate to be the 4-time recipient of annual grant funding from New Mexico Arts, a state-run arts advocacy organization, and have also received funding from the New Mexico Department of Tourism to assist our advertising and promotion efforts.  We are currently in the process of seeking additional grant funding from:
City of Santa Fe Arts Commission

The McCune Foundation
National Endowment for the Arts

Santa Fe Community Foundation
Despite these public and private funding efforts, the vast majority of our budget is supported by individual donors like you!Other Ways You Can HelpWe understand if you can't make a financial contribution at this time, but please also consider helping us out in any of the following ways:
Share this project page with your friends, family, and colleagues


Like us on Facebook (and share us, too!)

Volunteer your time
Come to our eleven annual performances at the St. Francis Auditorium in Santa Fe!

story:
54•40 Building Future History

Your favourite Canadian band is making a new record!  54-40 is back in writing mode and this time we would like you to be involved.  It’s your opportunity to build future history with 54•40.  We’re inviting you to help the band make this album.  This time you’re the record company!  We’re getting back to basics! Dave is honing his licks…Neil is channeling lyrics…  Matt and Brad are pumping the rhythm… Now it's up to you!   


What We Need & What You Get

Pledge 54•40 on this new journey of creation and future discovery.  You’ll be the first to hear the new songs and receive the results of the band’s creative process.  Be sure to stay tuned for updates as we all work to Build Future History.  Thanks for all your support…we love you!  - 54•40

The Impact

54•40 have been the iconic flag bearers of Canadian classic rock for over 30 years. The Vancouver based quartet who penned such chart-topping anthems as “I Go Blind’ “One Day In Your Life”, “Love You All” and the unforgettable “Ocean Pearl”, are now returning to the studio to create their next classic album – Future History.

Always ones to embrace the ever-changing landscape of the music industry, 54•40 have long been innovators and explorers when it comes to the technology of creating, distributing, and marketing their music.  This time around is no exception, and the group has decided to take a different approach to the album making process - by inviting fans across the nation to become a part of Building Future History. 

Other Ways You Can Help

As part of celebrating the history of 54•40, the group also documented memories from the making of albums past, and will release a series of never before seen videos in support of the Building Future History campaign.  We hope all fans of 54•40 will support the group in anyway they can even if it's just spreading the word through the links provided here!

story:
You can get my Conversations album (listen here), featuring the song Sweet Friend of Mine, here. You'll receive extra songs (see the list below), bonus features and better quality audio. If you use PayPal, you can have a download or CD very quickly. 

I'm thrilled with this album and want to make sure it gets heard. I've learned the hard way that if you don't promote an album well, very few people even learn that it is available. But it takes money to promote an album well. It costs thousands of dollars to do publicity or send songs to just one radio format, for instance. There's a great team excited about helping me make sure this album gets noticed but I've had to turn many of them down because I can't afford them. 

That's where you come in. You could look for the album in stores but you'll get fewer songs, none of the extras and you won't get the higher quality audio files that are included in the downloads here. Why should you get the album directly from me now? 

When you join this campaign you're not just buying music. You're investing in the impact that you believe we can have together and in the lasting value of the songs that will come from our musical journey together. Sharing goals and experiences like this means you're not just a "fan" of my music. You're a Sweet Friend Of Mine. Here's why this model works better and is essential to my getting to interact with you more and to my ability to continue to record.

I’ve got some great rewards for individuals, groups and charities -- something for everyone. Each one has a different delivery date so you'll know when you should receive it. Check them out over there. -->

You can also invite me to your town - for a Conversation or a concert. You’ll find the details–yep, you guessed it–right over there. -->

Click a "Claim This Perk" button to see more information about ordering it, delivery dates, etc. If you pay by credit card, Indiegogo doesn't complete the transaction until several days after the campaign ends, so your delivery date is after that. If you use PayPal, the delivery date will be earlier than the one posted. 

I've already started working on a new live album (audio version and video version) to follow up Conversations. It will take several months to complete the live audio and video albums but they'll be great when they're done. Here's a video with all the details!

Thanks again for your interest in my music.  Please share this page with your friends... choose the cool stuff you want... and check out some of the songs on my Conversations album.

Christopher Redner created a Facebook group, which you can join, to help you learn how to increase your social media impact. He'll be sharing examples of how to be more effective on the social media campaign for Conversations.

I look forward to connecting with you and learning what you think about these songs on social media like Indiegogo, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube and ReverbNation.

There are videos of songs further down the page, right after the FAQ.

P.S. I am also a founding member of the Sweet Comfort Band. We have a new album called The Waiting Is Over and you can get a copy, which I'll autograph, here too.

FAQ

What is included in the Conversations Deluxe Download?

Sweet Friend Of Mine
You Make Me Love You
Know It
I Can’t Imagine
One Missing Piece
Got Ya Where You Want Me
Little Bit At A Time
Lovin’ You
I See You
No Words
Nothing To Prove
Every Father Is A Son
Say What You Mean
God Wins
Silent Night
This Christmas
Peace
Have Yourself A Merry Little Christmas
Christmas Time Is Here
What a Wonderful World
I See You (Radio Version) 

I Can't Imagine (Radio Version)

Bonus Audio
Ringtones
Album Graphics & Poster

Which songs are on the Conversations CD?

Sweet Friend Of Mine
You Make Me Love You
Know It
I Can’t Imagine
One Missing Piece
Got Ya Where You Want Me
Little Bit At A Time
Lovin’ You
I See You
No Words
Nothing To Prove
Every Father Is A Son
Say What You Mean
God Wins
Silent Night
This Christmas
Peace
Have Yourself A Merry Little Christmas
Christmas Time Is Here

Why have you set your goal so low?

Indiegogo charges higher fees if I don't reach my goal. So, I set a low goal in hopes of exceeding it and paying lower fees.

Can I participate even if I don't live in the United States?

Absolutely! I’ve had such great experiences with my international audience and I want you involved. Plus, the guy who helped me put this campaign together is a Canadian and he’s helped me figure out how to make it easier for you be a part.

You can choose any of the perks that are delivered by e-mail (Reports From The Soul Furnace, Digital Album Download, Let's Talk, etc.) without any extra cost. 

There are some extra shipping costs, compared to mailing the same items to an address in the United States, if you choose a perk that is rewarded by mailing you something -- CDs, shirts, etc. So, you can simply add a bit to your pledge to cover those costs. I’ll trust you to be fair when estimating that amount. Here are some typical extra costs for shipping one CD to these countries:

Canada & Australia: $1.50-2.00 extra for one CD

United Kingdom: $4-4.50 extra for one CD

Netherlands: $3 extra for one CD

Japan: $3 extra for one CD

If you choose a reward package that involves travel you’ll be responsible for the travel costs.

Can I give the album or other perks to my friends?

You betcha! Indiegogo allows you specify who you want the perk sent to and indicate that it is a gift. You can even include a note for the recipient of your gift.

What do you need for concert rewards?

It's pretty basic: You provide a sound system suitable for the size of audience and venue, along with a keyboard, an acoustic/electric guitar and two direct in boxes/connections.

My accommodation needs are simple too: One hotel room (two for Christmas concerts), meals and transportation to/from the airport. Additional travel costs will apply if you do not live within 90 minutes of a major U.S. hub airport that offers direct flights from Los Angeles.

Can you tell me more about the estimated delivery dates?

If I can send your rewards earlier than estimated cost-effectively, I will. I'll work hard to get your perks to you as quickly as possible after I receive payment from Indiegogo. PayPal payments happen fairly quickly but credit card payments aren't processed until several business days after the campaign closes. Some perks, especially those that involve travel, will require a bit more time to schedule but we’ll work that out together.

What happens if you don't reach your goal?

You'll still get whatever perk you've selected. I'll have to pay higher fees to Indiegogo if I don't reach the goal but you'll still get everything.

How can I help with this campaign?

There's lots you can do in addition to backing this campaign and sharing this page. Any comments you post help raise the profile of this page. Christopher Redner created a Facebook group, which you can join, to help you learn how to increase your social media impact. He'll be sharing examples of how to be more effective on the social media campaign for Conversations. You can also send Christopher a message here if you'd like to be added to my Indiegogo campaign team (see the group below).

What if I have a question that isn't answered here or want a perk that isn't offered?

Send me a message. There is a big "Send User A Message" button on my Indiegogo profile page. 

Here's I See You.

Here's Little Bit At A Time.

Here's Got Ya Where You Want Me.

story:
Hello There!

My name is Achim Harding. I am a young up and coming photographer in the New York City area. I recently moved here from Palm Beach, FL where I acquired a passion for photography. When I moved to the New York City area, I was blessed to land an internship at a modeling agency, where I learned to photograph high fashion models. With the help of various volunteers in the fashion industry, I was able to create a fashion portfolio which can be seen at HERE .

While this was a great start, I just do not want to create images. I would like to create masterpieces that speak volumes.  I know that to create the kind of images that would take my photography to the next level, I will need to create my own small studio here in Brooklyn, NYC.  Here is where you guys come in. With each and everyone of your help, this can be achieved! Take a look at the following video. This video was made with the help of various photographers make up artists and models around the city who donated they equipment and time for a fashion shoot I performed earlier this year. With their borrowed equipment I was able to turn my friend's small Queens apartment into a makeshift studio. I would like to create a permanent studio like this to shoot more exciting projects! CLICK HERE TO SEE VIDEO

What We Need & What You Get

To get the ball rolling on this project, I would need about $5,000 goal! This would help get the materials that would need for building a small studio. 

Lights

Stands

Backdrops

Props

Camera accessories etc

Part of this money will also help secure a location in Brooklyn, NYC that people can come to and feel at ease while being photographed. 

There are various perks to contributing to my campaign. Those who donate $5 will get a personal shootout from me via social media expressing my thanks and gratitude for your generosity. I also have special photography session deals for those who donate $100 - $300. (Side Note: you do not have to pick a perk. You can donate ANY amount. every dollar can make a difference).


The Impact

I believe that with this studio I can reach out to a far larger variety of people, spreading my talent to all the corners of the New York City area! I believe that this project can affect way more people's lives than just me. Photography is just as important as any other art form. If I have the privilege to share my talents and story with others, there is no telling what can inspire them to do.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially to my project at this moment, there are other ways you can help! One thing is SPREADING THE WORD! In 2013 social media is on the rise. You can email my campaign to your friends, parents, family, co-workers, church members; anyone who you feel would want to hear about this opportunity! Simply sharing this link to some one could help in ways you wouldn't imagine. Use the Indie Go Go tools to share with your Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr and Instagram friends!

Short Summary

Brian Bentley

I am a young Canadian  hip hop/rap artist trying to make it big in the hip hop industry. unfortunately i don't have the money or professional equipment to fulfill my dream. therefore, i decided to search for a person who would want to support and help me finance my music. I am very hard working and will use this opportunity to bring the best results possible if i have been given chance to go into a professional studio and make an album which i will be given out for FREE, to all the people who sponsored me. I added a song which you can check out in order to get an idea, of what kind of rapper i am. In addition you can also check out my you tube channel to listen to my any other songs. thank you for your time!

Also i will be giving Free concerts to the people who sponsored me and all the money that will be left will be donated to people with disabilities

Thank you very much to take the time to read this, and i appreaciate any help i can possibly get!

story:
Well hello, and welcome to my IndieGoGo!

I'm James Bradford. Chances are if you made it here you already knew that.

I'm a musician, actor and singer. I love all three things with a deep passion, but if you asked me to choose the one that's nearest to my heart, music would win out in a heartbeat! My whole life has been musical. From chuch choir to the back seat of the car on family road trips (which naturally they LOVED,) my life has been a big loud symphony of song.

I was lucy enough to sign a record deal when I was 19, and cut my first record. It went nowhere. Since then I've self-released a bunch of albums and singles, toured the country with some of the most talented musicians around, and even had my songs featured in movies and tv shows!

The reality, though, is that it doesn't even begin to pay the rent, let alone rack up enough money to keep recording. That's where you come in!

This fundraising campaign is to raise money to produce my next record! How many times have you complained about how terrible popular music on the radio is? What have you done about it? The answer is simple: support indie artists whose music you love!

I'm keeping the fundraiser super simple. Here is the reward system:

EVERYBODY GETS EVERYTHING

Whether you choose to donate $1, $5, $20 or $1,000,000, everybody gets the same reward. This follows the idea of the "pay what you can/will" model. I want you to donate what YOU think is the "right amount". More on that below.
I hope you'll consider helping me continue to do what I love, and what I do best! Let's work together to keep the music playing. <3

What We Need & What You Get

The money raised in the campaign will go to the basics of recording an album. That includes rental of a studio, compensation for musicians who play on the album and who create the album artwork, and a small amount for the costs of digitally released it to iTunes (etc...)

What EVERYBODY gets for their contribution is pretty neat if I do say so myself. You'll get a link to a digital download of EVERY SONG I'VE EVER RECORDED. That's SIXTY EIGHT tracks! I'm also going to throw in a few surprises in your download.

You'll also get a custom made thank you video uploaded to YouTube for your enjoyication, and you'll be listed as a producer on the digital artwork featured on my website

    What happens if we don't reach the goal?

    If we don't reach enough money to produce a full album, I will use the funds raised to produce a smaller project; most likely a 4-5 track E.P. Should we dramatically surpass the goal...well, we'll cross that bridge when I'm thrown from it.
    Thanks so much in advance for your generosity. I know with your help I can put out the record I'm dreaming of!

I'm a musician, actor and singer. I love all three things with a deep passion, but if you asked me to choose the one that's nearest to my heart, music would win out in a heartbeat! My whole life has been musical. From chuch choir to the back seat of the car on family road trips (which naturally they LOVED,) my life has been a big loud symphony of song.
I was lucy enough to sign a record deal when I was 19, and cut my first record. It went nowhere. Since then I've self-released a bunch of albums and singles, toured the country with some of the most talented musicians around, and even had my songs featured in movies and tv shows!
The reality, though, is that it doesn't even begin to pay the rent, let alone rack up enough money to keep recording. That's where you come in!
This fundraising campaign is to raise money to produce my next record! How many times have you complained about how terrible popular music on the radio is? What have you done about it? The answer is simple: support indie artists whose music you love!
I'm keeping the fundraiser super simple. Here is the reward system:
EVERYBODY GETS EVERYTHING
Whether you choose to donate $1, $5, $20 or $1,000,000, everybody gets the same reward. This follows the idea of the "pay what you can/will" model. I want you to donate what YOU think is the "right amount". More on that below.
I hope you'll consider helping me continue to do what I love, and what I do best! Let's work together to keep the music playing. <3   What We Need & What You Get The money raised in the campaign will go to the basics of recording an album. That includes rental of a studio, compensation for musicians who play on the album and who create the album artwork, and a small amount for the costs of digitally released it to iTunes (etc...)
What EVERYBODY gets for their contribution is pretty neat if I do say so myself. You'll get a link to a digital download of EVERY SONG I'VE EVER RECORDED. That's SIXTY EIGHT tracks! I'm also going to throw in a few surprises in your download.
You'll also get a custom made thank you video uploaded to YouTube for your enjoyication, and you'll be listed as a producer on the digital artwork featured on my website

  What happens if we don't reach the goal?
If we don't reach enough money to produce a full album, I will use the funds raised to produce a smaller project; most likely a 4-5 track E.P. Should we dramatically surpass the goal...well, we'll cross that bridge when I'm thrown from it.Thanks so much in advance for your generosity. I know with your help I can put out the record I'm dreaming of!

story:
Taylorʼs latest audio video "Thas Xim" consists her fans holding signs with inspirational quotes and words. Taylor loves working close with her listeners and viewers. Her focus is to enrich many families and communities through her music.
Over the years, I have dedicated my life to music, family and community. My passion for writing Hmong music started at a young age when my family and I struggled through various life challenges. As a result, music has always been a healing mechanism in my life. Creating and sharing my music with others, I’ve come to recognize the positive impact that my music can have on families, friends and fans. I am committed to finishing this project and will need your support to get me there. 


My album proceeds will be use to create a community recording studio that will support struggling musicians, singers and artists.



Taylor first single “Me Ab Lullaby” and audio release “Zoo Siab Tshaj” was recorded, written, and composed in her very own bedroom behind a small desk, using the only equipments she had. Taylor never attended film school or had any previous experience in filming and photography, yet she filmed, photographed, edited, and directed all her music videos and photos. 

 “Music is my passion but a very expensive one. Iʼve struggled many times with the costs, resorted to whatever equipments I had and made the most out of them. Before my first two music videos I didnʼt know anyone on the professional side of film, so I shot both videos with my Cannon T4i. It was exhausting. The results were good, but of course, not what I hoped for. Filming these two music videos was definitely a great experience with many lessons learned.” 

Taylor has been seeking fundings for her first album. Her parents were part of the first wave of immigrants from Southeast Asia to arrive in the states; she is part of the first Hmong generation born here. She sees her community rising, gradually evolving, changing and developing day by day. Still, her fellow Hmong musicians/artists are struggling because they donʼt have many music business to keep their music industry alive and moving strong. Many music related finances comes from the artistʼs own savings and incomes. As a struggling artist Taylor faces challenges everyday. Her passion and love for music is her fuel. 



Look to your right and see which reward suits you. If you can't pledge money you can always support my album by twittering, facebooking or sharing this link with family and friends. I would greatly appreciate any help. Thank you.


ESTIMATES

story:
Scroll down for English translation

                                    


Alberto Mattea, nato a Ciriè (To), è un giovane musicista specializzato in musica antica. Suona strumenti a fiato rinascimentali e barocchi e collabora con varie realtà corali e strumentali. E' membro del Gruppo Vocale Eufonè, oboista del gruppo Augusta Barocca, membro fondatore dell'ensemble Aurea Armonia e della formazione Suavis Concentus, ed è membro dell'Orchestra barocca Gli Invaghiti. Ha frequentato una masterclass di Oboe barocco con Alfredo Bernardini e con Josep Domenech. Ha collaborato come oboista su strumento moderno a varie realtà della Diocesi di Torino, suonando con organisti quali Massimo Nosetti e Marco Limone. Collabora abitualmente alle incisioni vocali per la rivista di musica liturgica Armonia di Voci del M° Alessandro Ruo Rui. Si occupa inoltre di rievocazione e scherma storica, di progetti cinematografici storici e pittura ad olio.


                                  


Giorgio Enrico Cavallo, nato a Torino nel 1989, è giornalista pubblicista e scrittore, con la passione per la poesia. Ha pubblicato recentemente "L'ultima foglia" (Genesi Editrice), raccolta di liriche in gran parte composte secondo lo stile della poesia tradizionale, rispettando quindi la metrica e le rime. La stessa scelta artistica è stata adottata per il libretto della Passione e Risurrezione secondo San Giovanni; nonostante ciò, si tratta di un testo moderno, che tocca anche molti temi critici della nostra società.


Il progetto

In occasione dell'Ostensione della Sindone 2015, la Confraternita del Santo Sudario di Torino ha commissionato ad Alberto Mattea, giovane musicista specializzato in musica antica, la composizione di un oratorio in stile Barocco che ripercorresse la Passione e Resurrezione di Cristo secondo il Vangelo di Giovanni.

L'opera, su libretto del giovane scrittore, poeta e giornalista Giorgio Enrico Cavallo, segue la struttura dell'oratorio barocco, con recitativi secchi, arie cantate dai solisti e meditazioni su corale. 

Perché la scelta dello modello Barocco? La risposta è... perché no? Vivere nel XXI secolo non significa che le forme del passato siano da dimenticare per il puro amore del progresso e dell'innovazione. In un mondo in cui l'arte e il bello contano sempre meno, è ancora possibile il recupero dell'arte guardando al passato. Sentimentalismo anacronistico? Non necessariamente! Non si tratta della riesumazione di uno stile morto: il Barocco ci ha lasciato un grande bagaglio musicale dal forte impatto espressivo, e le sue risorse non sono esaurite. Si tratta di uno stile che ben si presta a raffigurare la magnificenza e la solennità richieste dal tema trattato, ed è per tale motivo che la composizione è stata commissionata in tale stile: la forma si presta al concetto, e richiama le auliche sonorità delle grandi composizioni sacre del passato. Inoltre il Barocco è anche il periodo delle grandi composizioni su libretto, e nel caso della nostra Passione secondo Giovanni, il libretto è stato scritto con molto gusto seguendo uno stile vicino alla sensibilità barocca, riproponendo al giorno d'oggi l'antico sodalizio.


L'obiettivo

L'esecuzione di tale composizione della durata di ben oltre un'ora, in calendario per aprile 2015, richiede un organico di circa 40 persone: tra essi ci saranno un coro, cantanti solisti e un'orchestra.

L'orchestra suonerà su strumenti barocchi, vale a dire originali o copie di strumenti musicali del primo '700. Tali strumenti non sono reperibili ovunque, ed é necessario riunire un qualificato ensemble di musicisti che li suonino. Alcuni di questi musicisti sono nomi di spicco nel settore della musica antica. Questo ci permette di offrire un'irripetibile esecuzione con le sonorità dell'epoca, e comporta un grande lavoro di orchestrazione e prove. Inoltre non è da sottovalutare l'imponenza del lavoro compositivo!


Gli sbocchi della composizione

Una prima esecuzione di qualità permetterà alla composizione di essere conosciuta ed apprezzata da un ampio pubblico. Se sorpasseremo la cifra necessaria per eseguire l'Oratorio, saremo in grado di organizzare delle repliche in luoghi di rilievo.


Passaparola!

È importante far conoscere il progetto a quante più persone possibili! Per raggiungere, e magari superare, il traguardo minimo indispensabile per la prima esecuzione assoluta, c'è bisogno dell'aiuto di tutti! Se anche non avete modo di contribuire direttamente, fate conoscere il progetto ai vostri amici, agli amanti della musica e dell'arte, a chi Crede che si possa onorare un evento quale l'Ostensione Sindonica con una grande creazione artistica che rappresenti l'impegno, la Fede e le lo sforzo di molte persone con un unico, grande intento!


Grazie per la Vostra generosità!


English

Alberto Mattea was born in Ciriè (TO), Italy, and is a young musician specialized in Early Music. He plays Renaissance and Baroque wind instruments and performs both choral and instrumental music. He is a member of the Eufonè Vocal Ensemble, oboist of the group Augusta Barocca, founding member of the Ensemble Aurea Armonia and Suavis Concentus, and is a member of the Baroque orchestra Gli Invaghiti. He attended a masterclass for Baroque oboe with Alfredo Bernardini and Josep Domenech. He has collaborated on the modern oboe with various events organized by the Diocese of Turin, performing with organists such as Massimo Nosetti and Marco Limone. He regularly participates in vocal recordings for the liturgical music magazine Armonia di Voci edited by Alessandro Ruo Rui. In addition, he participates in historical reenactments, period fencing, filmmaking and oil painting.

Giorgio Enrico Cavallo, born in Turin, Italy in 1989, is a freelance journalist and writer, with a passion for poetry. He recently published "L'ultimo foglia", a collection of lyric poetry, mostly following the style of traditional poetry, respecting its meter and rhyme. He made the same choice for the libretto of the Passion and Ressurection according to St. John. Even so, the text is modern and touches on many critical aspects of our society.


The Project

On the occasion of the Presentation of the Shroud in 2015, the Confraternity of the Sacred Shroud of Turin has commissioned Alberto Mattea, a young musician specializing in Early Music, to compose a Baroque-style oratorio that retells the events of the Passion and Resurrection of Christ according to the Gospel of John.

The Passion, based on a libretto by the young writer, poet and journalist Giorgio Enrico Cavallo, follows the structure of a Baroque oratorio, with recitativi, solo arias and choral meditations.

Why use a Baroque model? The answer is...why not? Living in the 21st century doesn’t mean that the forms of the past have to be forgotten out of a pure love of progress and innovation. In a world in which art and beauty count for less and less, it’s still possible to renew art by looking into the past. Anacronistic sentimentalism? Not necessarily!  Renewing the Baroque doesn’t have to mean taking up a dead style again: The Baroque has left us a great musical inheritance of strong and expressive impact, whose resources are not yet exhausted. The Baroque style lends itself well to the magnificence and solemnity of a Passion, and that’s why the composition was commissioned in this style: The form lends itself well to the concept, and recalls the noble resonance of the great sacred compositions of the past. 

In addition, the Baroque is also a period of great librettos, and in the case of our Passion According to St. John, the libretto was written in a style that closely follows the Baroque sensibility, thus recalling the old cooperation between composer and librettist.

Our Goal

The performance of The Passion, which is scheduled for April 2015, will last well over an hour and will require an ensemble of about 40 people, including a chorus, soloists, and an orchestra.

The orchestra will play on Baroque instruments--either originals or faithful copies--from the early 1700s. Such instruments aren’t available just anywhere, so it’s necessary to gather a qualified ensemble, including renowned professionals in the field of Early Music. Such an ensemble will allow us to reproduce the unique sound of the period. This project implies a huge effort of orchestration and rehearsing, and the composition process itself is not to be underestimated!

Prospects of the Composition

A first-quality performance will allow the composition to be seen and appreciated by a wide audience. If we receive more funds than necessary to put on the premiere of the oratorio, we will be able to put on additional concerts in select locations.

Pass it on!

Please tell as many people as you can about this project!  We need everyone’s help to reach even our minimal goals for the premiere of the Passion. Even if you can’t contribute anything yourself, you can tell your friends about it; you can tell the music and art-lovers you know about it; you can tell people of faith about it; you can tell anyone about it who might be interested in honoring the Presentation of the Shroud with  a musical premiere which represents the effort, faith, and strengh of many people working together for a good cause!


Thank you for your generosity!

story:
Short Summary:

 

Hello to all of my friends, family, community, and the entirety of my support system.

I've recently been accepted into Tim Davis' Studio Singer Intensive Program that is taking place on August 13th and 14th. The intensive is taking place at the Sony Pictures Studio Lot and will be within the Barbara Streisand Scoring Stage, where 85 years of legendary films' such as The Wizard of Oz and The Pirates of the Caribbean sessions of recording have taken place - how cool?! 

Based off of the Studio Singer Intensive website, it offers vocalists an unprecedented opportunity to gain recording experience in a realistic work environment, while gaining invaluable exposure to industry leaders. Whether you are an experienced professional or just starting out, this two-day intensive will sharpen your sight singing skills, stylistic flexibility, musical intuition, and vocal mastery - as well as what it takes to thrive in the competitive world of studio singing.

Now I'm Making It Personal

For those of you who know me, I have been singing since I was a little girl, through elementary, middle, high school, and college. Music and vocal performance have always been such an important part of my life, and undoubtedly the art form in which I am most passionate about. As of recently, I am really looking to expose myself more as a singer/songwriter and vocal performer, and attending this intensive will give me the perfect sendoff. 

The program costs $1000, but if I can raise $1200, I can also get private coaching lessons from the instructor himself. A $500 deposit must be put down to save my spot, then I will pay the next $700 if I can raise it in time. 

If anyone could spare a donation, I would be eternally grateful, and I promise you, you would be making an investment in the bright future I wish to obtain. 

Here are several pictures and links to some of my covers if you'd like to check them out!

 

 

Thank you so much for your time! 

 

Best,

 

Mary Strause

The intensive is taking place at the Sony Pictures Studio Lot and will be within the Barbara Streisand Scoring Stage, where 85 years of legendary films' such as The Wizard of Oz and The Pirates of the Caribbean sessions of recording have taken place - how cool?! Based off of the Studio Singer Intensive website, it offers vocalists an unprecedented opportunity to gain recording experience in a realistic work environment, while gaining invaluable exposure to industry leaders. Whether you are an experienced professional or just starting out, this two-day intensive will sharpen your sight singing skills, stylistic flexibility, musical intuition, and vocal mastery - as well as what it takes to thrive in the competitive world of studio singing.Now I'm Making It PersonalFor those of you who know me, I have been singing since I was a little girl, through elementary, middle, high school, and college. Music and vocal performance have always been such an important part of my life, and undoubtedly the art form in which I am most passionate about. As of recently, I am really looking to expose myself more as a singer/songwriter and vocal performer, and attending this intensive will give me the perfect sendoff. The program costs $1000, but if I can raise $1200, I can also get private coaching lessons from the instructor himself. A $500 deposit must be put down to save my spot, then I will pay the next $700 if I can raise it in time. If anyone could spare a donation, I would be eternally grateful, and I promise you, you would be making an investment in the bright future I wish to obtain. Here are several pictures and links to some of my covers if you'd like to check them out!  Thank you so much for your time!  Best, Mary Strause

story:
SUSHI MAMBO IS HEADING TO CALISTOGA!

My name is Andrea Cazares and I am the proud daughter of the owners of Sushi Mambo! I was only four years old when my parents opened their doors for the first time back in 1997. Since then, it has been an honor to watch it grow as a business.

We have had many setbacks within the past few weeks. Running one business is hard enough. Opening a second is even more challenging. But both of these seem like a cake walk when compared to an earthquake hits you in the middle of this transitional phase. We are in a tricky position of losing everything we have. This includes our restaurant in Napa, and our soon-to-be restaurant in Calistoga. There have been many ups and downs, but we know in our hearts and minds that we will succeed. Business is not always easy, nor are earthquakes. But we hold our heads high as we look up and see the astonishing amount of support from our loyal customers! 

To our loyal customers,

The perks we give to you cannot express our gratitude enough. We will continue put our hearts and souls into our work. We hope you will find that our food reflects this when my family and I are back on our feet!

What we need & What you get!! Exciting!

In order for us to fix all of the requirements needed to open Sushi Mambo North in Calistoga, we need a minimum of $10,000. This will cover everything that the Health Department demands us to fix as well as making our restaurant look stunning! We want our customers and employees to feel as comfortable as possible in our new location. It is time to bring out the FULL potential of this place!!

And believe me, I have studied do-it-yourself decor and construction for years. A dollar with us goes a LONG way!

What $10,000 will go into:

  • Fixing every door and window in the building: We bought out a struggling restaurant. The building was in poor condition when we bought it. All of the doors are still completely crooked and look like they will fall off at any second!
  • Tuning up the kitchen: There are a few really expensive freezers and refrigerators that can barely chill our food. The previous owners never got enough customers to use them and as a result, they need to be repaired. 
  • Fixing counters and walls: Some of the kitchen surfaces are not up to date with the Health Department regulations. We need to install certain wall covers and counters that can be easily maintained and cleaned.
  • Renovating a food server station: We would like to renovate our current food server station to to make it easier for our servers to get supplies for our customers.
  • Exterior design costs: It is important for us to fine tune and stain our outdoor seating area. We need outdoor lighting and landscaping.
  • Interior design costs: Our interior lighting throughout the building needs an update. The indoor walls definitely need to be painted. We would also like decorative artwork designed specifically for our restaurant to set the atmosphere.
What perks you will receive for contributing:
*all gift certificates can be used for up to 6 people on a single occasion.
  • Donate $5: We give you a very grateful thank you when we see you!
  • Donate $10: Sake on the house to celebrate!
------------- Donations $20 and above will be placed on our wall of fame!!----------------
  • Donate $20: We will make a beautifully designed plaque of your name and place it on our wall of fame for everyone to recognize! 
  • Donate $40:  In addition to your name being placed on our wall of fame, you will be served a very delicious Oreo Cookie Mountain for our gratitude!
  • Donate $50: A free roll of your choice and a 10% off gift certificate!
  • Donate $100: Two free sushi rolls and two 10% off gift certificates! Also, a bigger plaque on our hall of fame.
  • Donate $150: Two free rolls and two 20% off gift certificates!
  • Donate $250:  Two $25  gift certificates as well as a very decorative plaque on our hall of fame!
  • Donate $500: As an artist and professional portrait maker, I will draw a detailed portrait of you or your loved one (size 5 in. x 7 in. ). Here is some of my prior portraiture---> andreacazaresart.foliohd.com . You will also receive two $25 gift certificate and two 20% off gift certificates!
  • Donate $700: Much like the $500 donation, your portrait size increases to a scale of 8 in. x 10 in. You will also receive two $25 gift certificates and five 10% off gift certificates!
  • Donate $1000: We might kiss you at this point. You will receive four 20% off gift cards as well as a portrait size of your choice! Also you will get the largest plaque on our wall of fame!!

Our Past Challenges

This is not the first setback that we have had since we have been in business. We went through another earthquake back in 2000, as well as a fire (caused from the repairs to our building post-earthquake), a flood in 2005, and the recession of 2008. We are strong but it has always come down to our loyal customers for supporting us for all these years!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you are like many others who are unable to donate, that is perfectly fine! There are still many other ways you can help us!

    Keep up with our facebook page, https://www.facebook.com/pages/Sushi-Mambo/116636261693501 . I will be posting dates on when volunteers can help paint, or contribute time to get our Calistoga location open as fast as possible!

    Our facebook page is also a great place to contact us if you want to donate plants for landscaping!!

    And that's all there is to it!

    Thank you so much for all of your support! You guys are the best!

    I love you all,

    Andrea Cazares

story:
Who is The Apollo Affair?

The Apollo Affair is a Kenosha, WI based acoustic duo consisting of guitarist Chris Shanafelt and vocalist Megan Mehl. Chris and Megan have spent years developing their musical abilities, having studied both classical and jazz music at Carthage College before beginning their personal music endeavor in the spring of 2013. They have since written and recorded two EP's and performed shows across Wisconsin, Illinois, and Michigan under the name "The Apollo Affair".

Chris and Megan began their relationship in the winter of 2010 while both were still finishing their Bachelor's degrees and while Chris was writing and performing music as a solo act. It became clear over time that the two were destined to make music together, and as a result of this joint endeavor Chris finally proposed in the spring of 2014. "FEVER" was written amidst wedding planning, moving apartments, and adjusting to a life beyond a college campus.


What is "FEVER"?

"FEVER" is the long-awaited musical labor of love that follows in the wake of The Apollo Affair's debut "3P". In the span of 6 songs, it explores, blends, and transforms genres from blues and jazz to pop and rock while still retaining the lyrically driven and vocally dramatic stylings that have become a cornerstone of The Apollo Affair's sound. 

"FEVER" is an emotional state. It burns within each of us through our highs and lows, through new and old loves. It consumes. It thrills. "FEVER" enflames our innermost passions. Through it, we come to realize what truly lies in our hearts. Embracing it means entering into the most honest relationship with yourself, and never apologizing. "FEVER" is the blood and sweat that fuels the machinations of our dreams.

The official track listing for "FEVER" will include:

  1. Fever
  2. Coming Home
  3. Save Yourself
  4. Mine
  5. Hurt
  6. Nashville

    What We Need & How You Can Help!

    Your donations will help offset the production and recording costs associated with the release of "FEVER". These costs break down to approximately the following:

    • $800 - recording, mixing, and mastering of "FEVER"
    • $1,200 - production/distribution of "FEVER" including digital distribution through numerous online retailers
    In the event that the $2,000 goal is surpassed, all additional funding will go directly towards future recordings of The Apollo Affair's original music.

    For contributors who live in the southeastern Wisconsin/northeastern Illinois area, there are multiple opportunities available to see The Apollo Affair perform live. Visit www.theapolloaffair.com for a complete list of upcoming shows in anticipation of the release of "FEVER".
