story:
#UPDATE 100%
Un immense merci à tous pour votre soutien ! Grâce à vous nous avons d’ores et déjà atteint notre objectif de collecte !

La campagne n’est pas terminée pour autant et vous pouvez toujours précommander l’album ou choisir l’une des nombreuses contreparties proposées (jusqu'au 6 juillet !). Plus votre soutien est important, plus vous nous aider à avancer sereinement dans la production de ce disque :


(english version below)

"A Life Worth Memoirs" :

"A life worth memoirs" est le nom de notre prochain album, sur lequel nous travaillons depuis maintenant presque deux ans. La composition est finie, les pré-productions sont faites et nous avons déjà hâte de vous faire écouter ça !


Nous avons travaillé très dur et sommes déjà fiers du résultat : à la fois plus violent et plus ambiancé que ce que nous avons fait auparavant, plus consistant également (près d'une heure d'album).

Le groupe entrera au studio Sainte-Marthe à la mi-juillet pour mettre les 12 titres en boite. L'album sortira à l'automne 2014.

Pour vous donner envie d'en savoir plus sur cet album, vous recevrez dès votre contribution la version pré-prod de "Meat Locker" par e-mail.

Un aperçu du nouvel album avec cette vidéo live de "Just Make Me A F***ing Sandwich" :


A quoi servira la collecte ?

Comme nous l'avons fait depuis nos débuts pour l'ensemble de nos productions, il nous parait évident d'assurer nous-même la majeure partie du financement de ce nouvel album.

Mais votre aide nous sera plus que précieuse, et servira a financer une partie des frais de production du nouvel album, à savoir :

  • L'enregistrement, le mixage et le mastering // 6000€
  • Le pressage des cd (digisleeve 3 faces avec livret)  // 1500€
  • La promotion, les frais d'envois, frais divers... // 1000€

NB = Nous avons opté pour un financement flexible. Le projet sera donc validé, même si la collecte n'est pas complète.


Le groupe



Holding Sand a été créé en 2007 à Tours.

Depuis le groupe a acquis une solide expérience de la scène ( auprès de Mass Hysteria, Fishbone, AqME, Bukowski, entre autres...) et compte a son actif 1 album et 2 EP :

  • Some things are better left unsaid (2012)
  • On Sleepless Nights (EP 5 titres - 2010)
  • Ebb & Flow (EP 3 titres - 2009)

F.A.Q :

  • Les conteparties comprennent les frais de port
  • Si tout va bien l'album devrait sortir en octobre ou novembre 2014. Les contributeurs recevrons bien sûr leurs lots en avant-première, au moins 1 semaine avant la sortie officielle.
  • Vous avez une question ? Contactez nous sur holdingsand@gmail.com

MERCI POUR VOTRE SOUTIEN !

____
(english version)

#UPDATE 100%
Thank you so much everyone for your support! Thanks to you we have already reached our fundraising goal!

The campaign is not over though, there are still 6 days to go, so you can still pre-order the album or choose one of the many perks we have to offer. The greater your support, the more you help us move forward serenely in the production process of this disc:


"A Life Worth Memoirs" :

It's been over 2 years since we have started working on our new album " A life worth memoirs”. The pre-production demos are recorded, and we’ll hit the “Sainte Marthe” studio in Paris in mid-July to record the real thing. It should be released in the Fall 2014.

The budget

As we have done from the start for all of productions, it seems obvious to us to finance the biggest part of our new album.

But we’ve just been through a rough patch, so your help will be more than welcome and will help us finance part of the production costs, including:

  • The recording, mixing and mastering // €6000
  • CD Press (digisleeve 3 faces with booklet)  // €1500€
  • Promoting, shipping costs, miscellaneous expenses... // €1000

NB = We have opted for a flexible funding. The project will be validated even if the goal is not achieved.

About Holding Sand

Holding Sand was created in 2007 in Tours (France).

Since then, the band has played a lot of shows and has released 1 album and 2 EP's :

  • Some things are better left unsaid (2012)
  • On Sleepless Nights (5 tracks EP - 2010)
  • Ebb & Flow (3 tracks EP - 2009)

F.A.Q :

  • Shipping costs are included
  • If all goes as planned, we'll be able to release this album in October or November, 2014. Perks will be sent at least one week before the official release.
  • Feel free to ask your questions here : holdingsand@gmail.com

THANKS A LOT FOR THE SUPPORT !

story:
Who are we?

We are Ai Robot! 

We are two friends who after originally meeting in Melbourne (Australia) we by chance found ourselves both living in the same small, rural city in Japan.  As a means to satisfy our creative urges we began making music. With no real boundaries and absolute creative freedom we found a perfectly balanced partnership, what started as two friends having a beer after work had ended up as a full album worth of electronica-rap-pop songs. 

Here's our first song... The Next Day


So what do we want?

We want to print up physical copies of our debut album and share it with people all over the world.

We want to get our music out there, so that we can continue to create music and art as passionate young artists.

We want to inspire other people to not give in to their dreams, and not give up on their passion.

But why should you help us?

We had a lot of fun making this album. And we think you'll have a lot of fun listening to the album. The writing process was such a contradicting yet completely organic  process, somehow we made an album where a relationship break-up made complete sense in the context of a song about alien abduction. 

What are we offering in return? Well here are some of the rewards or perks for backing us on this....

What are the Risks & Challenges?

As the album itself already is recorded, mixed and mastered (by the fantastic Daniel Reeves), we are seeking the funds to actually press up and distribute the album to our current and future supporters. 

How else can you help us?

Please share, like, post. We will be doing a "30 Days of Ai Robot" campaign while we are running this. We'll be posting comedy videos, artwork & concept artwork, music & lyric videos and, most importantly, the music.

story:
Short Summary

Be part of this superb social experiment. My base ideas are:

  • People tend to fund crazy ideas rather than noble causes.
  • It is cool to be part of a crazy idea.
  • I always wanted a Harley.

As this is a social experiment, if the campaign reaches it's goal I will create and publish a study: "Why do people back crazy projects?".

About the Project 

I would like a Harley Davidson special built chopper, 103cu Screaming Eagle engine, in special paint and bespoke frame, bars, running gear. It would cost me exactly £29,995. I would use this bike to: 

  • Look cool.
  • Impress girls.
  • Have fun.

Risks & Challenges

The project isn't completely risk-free. In case I won't reach my goal, instead of a Harley I might need to buy:

  • a scooter
  • a moped
  • or a bicycle (!)
As you can see your contribution can make a real difference.

How You Can Help

You can help me with either:

  • Backing my project with the amount of your choice.
  • Getting the word out and making some noise about this campaign.
  • Using the Indiegogo share tools.

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Short Summary Be part of this superb social experiment. My base ideas are:  People tend to fund crazy ideas rather than noble causes. It is cool to be part of a crazy idea. I always wanted a Harley.  As this is a social experiment, if the campaign reaches it's goal I will create and publish a study: "Why do people back crazy projects?".
   About the Project  I would like a Harley Davidson special built chopper, 103cu Screaming Eagle engine, in special paint and bespoke frame, bars, running gear. It would cost me exactly £29,995. I would use this bike to:   Look cool. Impress girls. Have fun.


Risks & Challenges  The project isn't completely risk-free. In case I won't reach my goal, instead of a Harley I might need to buy:  a scooter
a moped or a bicycle (!) 
As you can see your contribution can make a real difference.
   How You Can Help You can help me with either:  Backing my project with the amount of your choice.
Getting the word out and making some noise about this campaign. Using the Indiegogo share tools.
   And that's all there is to it.

story:
(Video by Josh Hester at The Storyteller Studios)

The Music

"Some Big Mystery" includes 11 songs from the past 8 years as I migrated from Carbondale to Chicago, and finally landing right in the middle of Illinois at the state capitol, Springfield. The recordings were made in rental homes, bedrooms, and basements using everything from cassettes to computers. At the time, I didn't have a specific direction and would follow my muse, finishing the songs I liked and scrapping the ones I didn't. This record is the result of that long-tailed process of self-correction, grabbing the good stuff from the past and adding new songs that I'm even more proud of. Listen to the first 3 tracks below to see if you're into it.


The Money

The $1,500 we raise will be used to pay for the production costs of CD duplication and vinyl pressings. I'm keeping the price low by doing very limited runs and lots of DIY design, packaging and assembly. If we don't make the funding goal I'll kick in what's needed to make sure that those who've contributed get what's been promised. The songs have been recorded, mastered (Thanks David Allen!) and are ready to go. Now it's up to you to make it real.

The Mystery

I've been writing music and playing in bands (Cleanray, Young Loves) for almost 20 years. And although it's taken me almost half that time to put together a solo release, the momentum from doing so has had such a powerful effect on my writing that a follow up record is already in the works (Good news for you Lifetime Investors!). Please give what you can and help spread the word.

Thanks in advance for being awesome,
- Arlin

story:
Who am I?

I'm Levi. I'm a saxophonist, composer, overall music enthusiast. Though I work primarily in the jazz field, I draw on an eclectic array of musical influences when I write and perform. I've worked on a number of albums for artists in various genres all over the US, but I've never had the opportunity to release an album under my own name...until now! On March 4, I'll be going into the studio to record an album with my octet and I need your help to make sure everything's done the right way, pre-, in-, and post-production. Below, I've outlined what I will be using the funds for; and to the right, you'll see what you can receive for donating to this campaign.

Goal

Since I've worked out a deal with the studio, all the funds will go toward the following:

  • Production = $500
  • CD printing/duplication = $1500
  • Musicians' expenses = $1500
Total = $3500

"Stretch"

Though it would be possible to make the album with the budget above, there are always more expenses to cover once the album is completed. Any additional funds raised will go toward miscellaneous fees, promotion, publicity, etc.

Perks!

Check out the wonderful perks to the right. CDs can be shipped anywhere in the world, but please consider donating a few extra dollars if you live outside of the US. All perks will be delivered/fulfilled as soon as possible after the album is finished. I am aiming for a release date in May-June 2015.

Spread the word

Any and all support is greatly appreciated, even the non-monetary kind! So tell your friends, family, anyone you think would be interested in being a part of creating new music.

More about Levi

Levi Saelua attended the Eastman School of Music in Rochester, NY where he studied jazz composition. He currently resides in Sacramento, CA where he teaches saxophone and clarinet, and performs often with a variety of groups, both as a leader and a sideman.

"Levi has a rare comprehension of the many common elements that all great music shares, regardless of superficial categories." -Bill Dobbins, author of Jazz Composing and Arranging: A Linear Approach

"He creates music that is both imaginative and engaging to listener and performer. He is also a very fine saxophonist and improviser." -Jeff Campbell, Director of Jazz Studies and Contemporary Media at Eastman School of Music

You can hear some of Levi's other work on his SoundCloud.

Questions?

Have questions about this campaign, perks, payments, or about "crowd-funding" in general? You can contact me at levi.saelua@gmail.com, or visit the IndieGoGo FAQ page.

It is a  extremely limited number of vinyl in total that will be available for this release. Fans of Big Pun will appreciate the project as a whole in essence of keeping Big Pun's legacy in music standing strong.

story:
Pourquoi appuyer le PAQG cette année ?

Le PAQG a grandement besoin d’un coup de pouce de ses membres et sympathisant-e-s afin d’assurer une continuité dans la qualité de ses activités d’éducation.

Cette année, nous nous sommes donnés comme mission de faire connaître une des stratégies actuelles les plus utilisées afin de faire taire les défenseur-e-s des droits humains et du territoire au Guatemala : la criminalisation. Celle-ci peut prendre plusieurs formes : l’utilisation indue et abusive des lois criminelles et anti-terroristes, la détention illégale et arbitraire des activistes, les déclarations d’autorités gouvernementales accusant sans fondement les activistes d’actes criminelles, entre autres. Le projet du PAQG s’articulera en trois volets :

  1.  La rédaction et la diffusion médiatique d’une déclaration s’opposant à la criminalisation et demandant l’action des gouvernements guatémaltèque et canadien;
  2. La réalisation d’une tournée à travers le Québec avec deux défenseur-e-s des droits humains guatémaltèques ayant vécu les répercussions négatives de la criminalisation;
  3. La rédaction d’un rapport sur la criminalisation remis devant le Sous-Comité pour les droits internationaux de la personne du Parlement du Canada et diffusé dans les médias.

Comment votre argent sera investi?

L’argent recueilli nous permettra entre autres de renforcer notre budget permettant de payer les dépenses liées à l’accueil des invité-e-s guatémaltèques, soient leurs billets d’avion, leur hébergement, leur transport et leur nourriture. Nous avons déjà réussi à avoir un important appui financier du ministère des Relations internationales et de la Francophonie (MRIF) par l'entremise du Fonds d'éducation et d'engagement du public en solidarité internationale (FEEPSI), mais nous aurons besoin d'argent supplémentaire pour garantir la pleine réalisation de toutes les activités prévues.

Qui sommes-nous?

Depuis 1992, le Projet Accompagnement Québec-Guatemala (PAQG) pose des gestes solidaires avec les populations du Guatemala qui défendent leurs droits civils, politiques, économiques, sociaux et culturels. En 2015, le Guatemala a été le théâtre de presque 500 attaques et menaces envers les défenseur-e-s des droits humains. Au Guatemala, le PAQG participe à l’initiative d’accompagnement international, un appui civil d’observation de la paix offert aux gens œuvrant pour les droits humains, lorsque ceux-ci croient qu’une présence internationale neutre et dissuasive pourrait diminuer leur situation d’insécurité.

story: I moved to Tennessee with the hope of surrounding myself with people with the same level of love for music as I have. I hope the words I have to say can reach those in need of an honest truth that they can relate to. With this EP, I will pour my heart out for better or worse and finally speak out to those who may not know I have a voice.

story:
True Press Nationwide Tour with Fortunate Youth.

We are about to head out on the It's All a Jam Tour with the band Fortunate Youth. The tour is across the country with 49 concert dates within 66 days:

  • True Press is a reggae band based in Los Angeles. Formed in 2009.
  • After playing many shows with many different bands we are about to go on our first nationwide tour. The exposure gained on this tour will be priceless.
  • With your help we can tour this country, which is a dream come true for us..

What We Need.

Our Major needs are:

  • The mileage alone is around 12,000 miles which with our van comes out to approximately $4,000 in gas. We also will need 4 oil changes while being on the road.
  • We also need to stock up on more merchandise and CDs.
  • We need to have spare tires for our van and trailer.

The Impact

This tour is going to help us get to new fans that may never be able to see us perform live otherwise:

  • Having this tour under our belt we will be recognized as a band that is able to go on a nationwide tour and help us get consideration for future tours.
  • Fortunate Youth has toured to many of these venues before and will expose us to likeminded fans.
  • This tour will help us progress and grow more as a band.

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are tough for a lot of us financially, we are right there with you:

  • If you cannot donate you can help us raise awareness for our fundraiser by sharing this page with your friends and family.

Thank you for your time and hope to see you at a show this spring! 
One Love

story:
The Skinny


Zodiac Empire is Ransom Wydner, Camden Chamberlain, Stephanie Webb, and Eric Stoye..  We're a new band comprised of professional musicians working hard to make an exceptional record--a record that can stand the test of time and have a real impact.  With almost 50 years of combined experience, and a number of notable accomplishments under our belts individually, we know exactly what we want and how to get it! Like The Beatles, we get by with a little help from our friends and with our powers combined YOU and Zodiac Empire can make something incredible!

We've found the perfect producer to round out this dream team, Los Angeles-based, Grammy Nominee Alex Elena.  Alex has worked with everyone from Debbie Gibson to Lilly Allen and chooses his projects very carefully, so we're thrilled at this chance to team up with him and make a record that we can ALL be proud of!

The Quid Pro Quo

Your generous donations will be used to pay Alex Elena for his time as our engineer and producer as well as to help defray some of the costs of travel.  Alex is a world class producer and would normally charge a LOT more than he's charging us, but he believes in this project and what we can accomplish together.  This means that you're getting a lot of bang for your buck.  If we exceed our funding goal, the balance will go to the red tape and paperwork associated with establishing our own record label to release the album, and to cover marketing, promotional and production costs.  Every penny will go to making this a record that we can all be proud to be part of!  How cool would it be to be one of the few people behind a successful album??

But pride in a job well done isn't all you get, of course.  We're giving away personal treasures, CDs, art, adventures, and even your face tattooed on Camden! We'll also be updating you with our progress and giving away bonus prizes. 

Because we have set up this campaign with a "flexible" funding goal, your donation will be put to work even if we don't raise 100% of that goal.   If we don't reach our goal, we won't be able to make an entire record with Alex but we'll track as many songs as we can.

The Impact

The music industry is changing.  Traditional record labels only want to invest in what's safe and predictable. Could The Flaming Lips or Radiohead or Queen get the attention of a major label executive today?  How do we innovate if the only thing that gets a chance is what's already selling? Does the future of popular American music belong to reality singing competitions and covers of  great songs recorded a generation ago?  Call us hopeless romantics, but we believe that the future of music can be better than its past.  Crowd funding, like this Indiegogo campaign, is gaining traction and independently recorded and released music is on the rise but still marginalized by an industry that doesn't understand why it's collapsing.  Last year Macklemore became the first artist in 20 years to top the Billboard charts without a major label.  We can't promise a number one hit, but we're aiming high with this.   

Zodiac Empire is making a record with you, by you and for you--something that can go toe to toe with the multi-million dollar frankensteins churned out by boardrooms of consultants with portfolios of market research about what's "hip".  We may be a ragtag team from Utah, but we are geared up and laser focused.  If you invest in us, we will make you proud.  

This record is going to be fantastic, but we don't expect you to just take our word for it!  Listen to what we've done so far.  Ask us questions.  Follow our updates and get engaged.  You're helping us, and that makes us a team.  We want you to be involved in this process, we want to make this TOGETHER.  We know what we're doing, what we have to do and how to do it but we NEED your help to really get things going. 

But what if I'm broke?

We know about being broke--we're musicians.  If you can't throw down hard cash, you can post a link to our Indiegogo on your Facebook or Twitter. Do this, let us know, and you'll receive an mp3 of one of the demos for our new album.

Thank you all so much for your support!

story:
Death or Glory Records is a Redditch based project that works with young people ages 18-25, specifically those not in education, employment or training.

My name is Steve, I am the owner and director of Death or Glory Records. With a long work history in the social and care sector and a long standing passion for music, this project was inspired by the two of the most important aspects of my life.
First and foremost Death or Glory is a record store. Like all music lovers we respect the hard work musicians put into their records. The hours in a studio, the artwork, the album title, and the blood, sweat and tears that go into it. So own it, hold it, smell it, play it and love every bloody second of it. Most importantly buy it from your local independent record store.
I wanted to be different from the rest and do what is close to my heart; help and support people. I aim to do this in many ways; some will be apparent from the record store, others will be more subtle but are just as important. In the shop there is work displayed from both local music photographers, showcasing their immense talent for all to see and also have a substantial gallery of artwork from local artists. We are very passionate about supporting local talent whether that be photography, art or music. 
The aim of the project is to run an independent record shop selling new and used vinyl as well as other music formats and merchandise. As a community interest company all profits will be used to help train and support young people, not only into work or education, but also with any life issues. It will also provide them with unique opportunities within the music industry. 
Death or Glory Records believes everyone deserves a chance. It is with that in mind that we work to support young people with employment opportunities. I work closely with the job centre to give employment and work experience to young people who are not getting that chance elsewhere, those who desperately want to work but aren't getting the chance, for people who are keen to learn new skills and develop.
The other exciting part of the project is the Record Label that signs and supports up and coming talent from with the region. The label offers a package to help kick start a bands career and support them through it. Then offers an unprecedented approach to supporting bands, by allowing them to have all the profits from sales and gigs.
As a community interest company, any profits that the shop makes does not go to the directors or management, they go back into the community. Profits are used to help young unemployed people, to help local photographers and artists and to help local bands. We are very proud of the bands and musicians that have and are currently associated with Redditch and the region. I want to encourage and nurture the next generation. This will take many forms, from helping provide equipment, putting on gigs and releasing Singles, EPs and Albums through our own label.
We are the only record store in the country that combines all these different components, and strives to make a real difference for my community, in my community. This makes us the most important record store in the country.
If you are inspired by my story and want to help, support and be part of the Death or Glory Record vision, then please donate here.
Your money will help to:
Offer young people valuable work experience.
Allow bands the opportunity to sell their work and merchandise in the shop.
Give bands a platform to launch their careers.
Give artists the opportunity to display their work for the public to see.
Organise events that benefit the community.
Help bands, artists, producers, promoters, musicians, teachers the chance to network.
Offer a diverse range of support that meets the needs of those that use the shop and are part of the community.
Release music through the label that show cases local bands talents.
Run bespoke workshops for young people.
Give local people a sense of belonging to something incredibly unique, special and supporting our young people, now and into the future.
Your selfless contribution will have a real impact on what we achieve now and help to realise our hopes and dreams for the future, and for that we wholeheartedly thank you. 
If your are unable to contribute financial, that's ok too, you can help spread the word. Like and share our campaign on facebook and twitter, and use the Indiegogo share tools.

Remember you are helping to support the most important record store in the country.

With a long work history in the social and care sector and a long standing passion for music, this project was inspired by the two of the most important aspects of my life.First and foremost Death or Glory is a record store. Like all music lovers we respect the hard work musicians put into their records. The hours in a studio, the artwork, the album title, and the blood, sweat and tears that go into it. So own it, hold it, smell it, play it and love every bloody second of it. Most importantly buy it from your local independent record store.I wanted to be different from the rest and do what is close to my heart; help and support people. I aim to do this in many ways; some will be apparent from the record store, others will be more subtle but are just as important. In the shop there is work displayed from both local music photographers, showcasing their immense talent for all to see and also have a substantial gallery of artwork from local artists. We are very passionate about supporting local talent whether that be photography, art or music. The aim of the project is to run an independent record shop selling new and used vinyl as well as other music formats and merchandise. As a community interest company all profits will be used to help train and support young people, not only into work or education, but also with any life issues. It will also provide them with unique opportunities within the music industry. Death or Glory Records believes everyone deserves a chance. It is with that in mind that we work to support young people with employment opportunities. I work closely with the job centre to give employment and work experience to young people who are not getting that chance elsewhere, those who desperately want to work but aren't getting the chance, for people who are keen to learn new skills and develop.The other exciting part of the project is the Record Label that signs and supports up and coming talent from with the region. The label offers a package to help kick start a bands career and support them through it. Then offers an unprecedented approach to supporting bands, by allowing them to have all the profits from sales and gigs.As a community interest company, any profits that the shop makes does not go to the directors or management, they go back into the community. Profits are used to help young unemployed people, to help local photographers and artists and to help local bands. We are very proud of the bands and musicians that have and are currently associated with Redditch and the region. I want to encourage and nurture the next generation. This will take many forms, from helping provide equipment, putting on gigs and releasing Singles, EPs and Albums through our own label.We are the only record store in the country that combines all these different components, and strives to make a real difference for my community, in my community. This makes us the most important record store in the country.If you are inspired by my story and want to help, support and be part of the Death or Glory Record vision, then please donate here.Your money will help to:Offer young people valuable work experience.Allow bands the opportunity to sell their work and merchandise in the shop.Give bands a platform to launch their careers.Give artists the opportunity to display their work for the public to see.Organise events that benefit the community.Help bands, artists, producers, promoters, musicians, teachers the chance to network.Offer a diverse range of support that meets the needs of those that use the shop and are part of the community.Release music through the label that show cases local bands talents.Run bespoke workshops for young people.Give local people a sense of belonging to something incredibly unique, special and supporting our young people, now and into the future.Your selfless contribution will have a real impact on what we achieve now and help to realise our hopes and dreams for the future, and for that we wholeheartedly thank you. 
If your are unable to contribute financial, that's ok too, you can help spread the word. Like and share our campaign on facebook and twitter, and use the Indiegogo share tools.Remember you are helping to support the most important record store in the country.

story:
*Note* The recordings in the video were recorded at my school, which I no longer have access to. 

My name is Hunter Gifford. I am 19, and I've been teaching myself piano for 6 years, and I love to write music. My passion is my music, and I wish to share it with anyone who will listen. Your contribution will help me fulfill my dream!  

What I Need:

(In order of necessity)

-Protools  (music recording software) - $700

-Protools "Structure" (for better quality instruments) -  $150

-Audio interface (to hook a keyboard to my computer) -  $100

-Various Cables and connectors: $50

-Instrument mic (for recording live instruments): $100


These items are the first step in a long journey. My long term plans include starting my own recording studio/performance hall that is affordable for small time musicians, starting a touring group of musicians and dancers, and supporting good music among other things. 

Your assistance, whether by donation or by spreading the word, is greatly appreciated. Live long and prosper!

story:
Friends...!

Thank you, we reached our goal! However, you can still be part of the making of #Vessel and contribute, the campaign is not over yet. Every penny above the goal will go towards touring and promotions to support the album.

I am feeling DEEP gratitude to each of you literally put your money where your mouth is and delivered the best Xmas present in the Spring I could ever get. I promise to you that I will continue pouring all my love and resources into the completing of this beloved album.

Also......

Everyone who contributes before the end of the campaign (today!) will be invited to a Secret Beach Party in the Bay Area. Great music and cool people...Let's celebrate this success together! YEAH!!!

≈∆≈


Pledge to Pre-Order my new album Vessel

Vessel is my third studio album; its songs are an exploration of water and our connection to it. After living close to the mountain and the water for three years, the natural sounds from this region have really impacted the way I write, sing and record music.

Vessel is a song-story about the Heroine's Journey. My personal story and a universal story.

"All of the great mythologies and much of the mythic story-telling of the world are from the male point of view. When I was writing The Hero with a Thousand Faces and wanted to bring female heroes in, I had to go to the fairy tales. These were told by women to children, and you get a different perspective. It was the men who got involved in spinning most of the great myths. The women were too busy; they had too damn much to do to sit around thinking about stories" – Joseph Campbell

I hope the music in Vessel will submerge you in magic, reflection and beauty, and that these songs will inspire you to cross over to uncharted worlds.

www.lilikoimusic.com

www.lucia.bandcamp.com

(photo by Josh Halpern)

          ∆≈MY STORY≈∆

In 2009 I successfully raised $50,000 to fund my second album "Tame the Night" through the platform Sellaband. Back then crowdfunding wasn't heard of, and my friends and family thought I was crazy to embark into this unknown. Needless to say, it was an interesting journey with its ups and downs, but thanks to 903 contributors or "believers" I was able to reach my goal ($50K was the predesigned goal for Sellaband users) and get to work with a Grammy winning producer in NY.

This is my first self-produced record; definitely a labor of love. Seeing the songs from their conception to their completion is an unexplainable process of love and devotion for the music that comes through me. I hope you'll enjoy it as much as I have enjoyed working on it so far. I've put all my resources to be able to spend studio time, pay a symbolic amount to musicians, creating this video, some photos, partial mixing, etc. Now I need your help to finish proper production and have a finished product that I can send into the world.

I've myself funded these so far:

*Partial payment to musicians

*Partial Studio Time and Engineering Costs

*Travel expenses & food.

*Equipment rental and purchase

*Production costs

*Countless hours of writing, demos, recording, comping, etc.


≈WHERE THE FUNDS WILL GO:≈

The making of an album is a labor of love. Albums are less and less common in favor of the single, but Albums still matter. Soundscapes and storylines that entice the listener to experience the world from 'inside the music' are, like water, something we usually take for granted, until it's gone.

In order to finish the production  of Vessel, we still need help with these costs:

*Studio Sessions (additional Instrumentation)

*Musicians (who've already played on the album)

*Engineering

*Vocal Production

*Mixing

*Mastering

*Album Art Design

*Album Duplication/ Shipping


Any funds above $20,000 from the campaign will go towards:

*Touring! To support the album Live

*Music Video

*Photographs

*Marketing & Promotion

To Thank You for your contribution and belief in the fruition of this album I have created some perks. You can get one, or a few, or you can gift them to a friend and loved one.

≈PERKS≈

*Album in digital format (wav, aif, mp3) before the official launch. You get Vessel before anyone else.

*Album as a CD

*Album as a Vinyl

*Deluxe version of the album

*A day in the studio :

 


From L to R: Sean Beresford (engineer), Sean Nelson (drums), Lucia (me), Jason Carr (upright & electric bass), Rob Easson (engineer). At the beautiful Woodacre Studio.

* A Special House Concert for you and your friends:

* An invitation to one of our live shows, and VIP passes for you and a friend to hang with the band:


*Voice or Piano Lessons from Lucia ( 1 or package of 4 via Skype or in person)

* A Singing Circle Workshop for you and your friends (up to 12 people) led by Lucia:


*Original Art Prints by Lucia, signed and delivered, they're yours :)


*A Song for your <3 Sweetheart <3

A custom made song from you, written and recorded by Lucia, sent directly to your True Love's Heart.


*Life Navigation Chart

A Natal Chart or Personal Transits Chart by Becca Tarnas, framed by Lucia's art mandalas. Becca offers astrological consultations that explore the natal chart as well as personal transits. Read about her amazing work at ArchetypalPrism.com





You'll need to send Becca your date, time and place of birth. Pick frame #1,#2,#3, #4 or #5 for your chart.

* An amazing boat ride through the Bay, with the band serenading you!

* Executive Producer Title on the Album + Deluxe Package Perks!!

We are so grateful for your donations. You're making this happen! Please share the perks with your friends on Facebook, Twitter and your Social Networks.

                      ≈TEAM≈

Julie Wolf (co-producer) Julie Wolf is a music producer, composer, multi-instrumentalist, music director and teacher. She has appeared on stages around the world and on numerous critically acclaimed recordings. She has collaborated with Carly Simon, Indigo Girls, Ani DiFranco, Maceo Parker, Bruce Cockburn, Amy Ray, and Wayne Horvitz among many others. Some recent personal highlights include recording a duet with Carly Simon for the release of Chimes of Freedom: The Songs of Bob Dylan - Honoring 50 Years of Amnesty International and producing Bruce Cockburn in early 2015. She has music directed with Berkeley Repertory Theatre (including consulting on Tony Kushner’s The Intelligent Homosexual’s Guide to Capitalism and Socialism with a Key to the Scriptures), California Shakespeare Theater, Actors Theatre of Louisville, and in Summer 2015 will be in Los Angeles at the Kirk Douglas Theatre music directing Girlfriend, a musical written by Todd Almond and directed by Les Waters,featuring music by Matthew Sweet. Her original music for the 2009 documentary Sweet Crude was nominated for Best Original Score at the Maverick Movie Awards and received special mention in Variety. Julie lives in Oakland and is a part of a vibrant creative community that includes musicians, dancers, choreographers, poets, filmmakers, actors, directors, writers, teachers, healers and activists. She runs Julie Wolf
Music, specializing in music production, composing for film and dance, sound design, and music editing. Julie Wolf Music is located in the Zaentz Media Center in Berkeley, CA. Also housed there is the legendary Fantasy Studios where Julie is an in-house music producer. Recent producing credits include Gina Breedlove’s Language of Light, Marca Cassity’s Songs From The Well, Rachel Friedman’s My Marching Band, The Lost American JazzBook and Bekah Barnett’s Rise. Upcoming projects include producing recordings with multiple artists in 2015 and continued work on a commissioned original score and sound design for the Sarah Bush Dance
Project’s Rocked By Women. Julie also teaches music clinics, workshops and private students.

Joey Maramba (bass) is a bass player, songwriter from Los Angeles most known for his work with John Cale of the Velvet Underground and Rickie Lee Jones and has appeared on Letterman, Jay Leno, Conan O'Brien, and Fallon. He has opened for Mike Watt and Nels Cline with an instrumental avant garde group called Ninja Academy. Currently he is working with Lucia on her upcoming album "Vessel" and performing with her in various dates starting in March 19th in Santa Cruz.
Game of Thrones Maramba:http://youtu.be/sRA8fruzX6s
LIVE at the TARDIS Studios: Joey Maramba performs "LOVE MY WAY":http://youtu.be/Bd15grXNezE

Maya (co-production) is a singer, songwriter, teacher and producer whose musical journey has been "a beautifully intense winding road." Some signposts along the way have included studying at Berklee College of Music, vocal and song placements in film and television, relearning how to read, sing and play music after a life altering car accident, studying with master teacher, Rhiannon, in Hawaii, and most recently co-producing music for Lucia's upcoming album, Vessel. Through it all, music has remained the constant, her compass and guide.Maya released her self-produced debut album, Ayam Music, in 2008. She is currently writing her second album entitled Stargazer. http://www.scatherjoy.com/music

Sean Nelson (drums) began his music career at age 10 when Santa delivered a snare drum so he could play duet with his guitarist older brother.
After studying the records of said older brother and taking lessons throughout his teens and performing around Cape Cod MA, he attended Berklee College of Music, graduating in 1993. After a term at the Rotterdam Conservatory in Holland, he moved to San Francisco in 95 to teach and play jazz.
Over the past 20 years he has recorded for many artists/producers and performed with a large array of musicians in a variety of professional and stylistic settings. He lives in San Rafael, CA where he continues to teach, create music and learn about listening.  Sean also plays drums for the San Francisco Band Go By Ocean.

Ashley Adams (Upright Bass) received her Bachelor's in double bass performance at the University of Arizona School of Music. After moving to the Bay Area, The Ashley Adams Trio put out, "Flowers for Ms. Dalloway", music based on the Virginia Wolfe novel on the Evander Label. She’s performed in with Ted Savarese, Keith McMillen, Phillip Greenlief, Ralph Carney, Lucia Lilikoi, Eugene Chadborne, the Women's Philharmonic, Bay Area Balalaika Ensemble, Trio Garufa (Tango), The Hulagains (Hawaiian Trio), BottomFeeders (electric cello/bass duo), Trio Metric, the Bay Area Bass Band, Drizzoletto, Octomutt, Winechuggers and Zmrzlina. Ashley has taught privately, for the SF symphony's youth outreach program, and as a clinician at the Golden Gate Bass Camp. In addition to her composition and bass playing, Ashley has immersed herself in music programming and audio processing.

Jason (upright & electric bass) is a Marin County native and has been playing music in the bay area for well over a decade. Earning a distinguished BA degree in music at Sonoma State University, he studied jazz bass under the private instruction of Mel Graves. As a bassist and multi-instrumentalist he has since worked with many local artists including Arann Harris and the Farm Band, Sean Hayes, Michael LaMacchia, Gerry Grosz, Drew Gasparini, and Elaine Lucia. In addition to performing regularly, Jason also teaches private lessons and group classes at Crossroads Music School in Marin. Jason currently resides in San Francisco, CA.

Peter David Walden (cello) is a Los Angeles Based cellist and multi-instrumentalist who began studying the cello at age four, and has shared the stage with such diverse acts as the LatinJazz great Chuchito Valdez, superstar Macy Gray, members of the Parliament Funkadelic and the famed rapper DJ Quick.  Peter’s recording credits include numerous independent films, albums, and recording sessions for TV, as well as creating and performing his own music for theater and dance productions. He is a member of the LA Musicians' Union and the DeKah Hip-Hop Orchestra, and a producer of Origins, an album of rap, poetry and music in collaboration with Street Poets Inc.


Antoine Salem. Los Angeles based, Swiss born and Freelance guitarist/composer Antoine Salem has performed, written and recorded music professionally since age 17, he has toured internationally and worked in collaboration with countless artists across the globe (including George Clinton, Praz -of the Fugees, Bob Moses, Miguel Atwood Ferguson, Clare Muldaur, Lionel Loueke and many more).
As a composer, he has had his music and songs featured on several independent films and numerous TV shows. Aside from developing his music library and several personal side projects, he currently writes for and performs/tours (in the US and EU) with Shoestring Trio and Hale May.


Ted Savarese (guitars & engineering)Ted Savarese is a bay area based musician, songwriter, and producer who has worked with various independent San Francisco musicians.  He received a Golden Eye award for is film scoring of the documentary October Country by Michael Palmieri and Donal Mosher.

Sean Beresford has engineered, edited and/or mixed Vanessa Carlton, The Explosion, The Star Spangles, The Upwelling, The Donnas, Brain and Buckethead and The Echo Falls as well as continued a long-time connection with San Francisco Bay Area band Third Eye Blind.

Lucia Lilikoi (guitars, vocals, piano, programming, percussion, kalimba, producing) Lucia is currently recording her third studio album, Vessel. She has worked with Grammy winning producer Malcolm Burn for her second album "Tame the Night", which was fully funded by 903 fans. Her music and voice has been featured on "The L Word" and several documentaries, and last year she wrote her first original score for the film The Future of Energy, featuring luminary Joanna Macy, amongst others. Lucia has studied music extensively since she was 7 years old, learning classical piano at the Conservatory in Madrid, Jazz at Berklee College of Music and Improvisation from master teacher Rhiannon. Lucia teaches music, helping her students find their authentic voice, and ultimately follow their own creative impulses, through exploration, fun, embodiment, and listening.


San Francisco Video Production by: http://startmotionmedia.com"

Thanks to Dante Rouser and Josh Halpern for photos and additional footage.

connection with San Francisco Bay Area band Third Eye Blind.Lucia Lilikoi (guitars, vocals, piano, programming, percussion, kalimba, producing) Lucia is currently recording her third studio album, Vessel. She has worked with Grammy winning producer Malcolm Burn for her second album "Tame the Night", which was fully funded by 903 fans. Her music and voice has been featured on "The L Word" and several documentaries, and last year she wrote her first original score for the film The Future of Energy, featuring luminary Joanna Macy, amongst others. Lucia has studied music extensively since she was 7 years old, learning classical piano at the Conservatory in Madrid, Jazz at Berklee College of Music and Improvisation from master teacher Rhiannon. Lucia teaches music, helping her students find their authentic voice, and ultimately follow their own creative impulses, through exploration, fun, embodiment, and listening.San Francisco Video Production by: http://startmotionmedia.com"Thanks to Dante Rouser and Josh Halpern for photos and additional footage.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who is Darrow Chemical Company?

Thank you for visiting the Darrow Chemical Company campaign page!

Many of you are familiar with our band and we thank you for your continued support. But for those that aren’t, Darrow Chemical Company comes from the ashes of several namesake underground bands. Past member projects include Mister Monster, Gotham Road, Michale Graves Band (Ex Misfits), Blitzkid and The Doomsday Prophecy. 


This band was started in late 2009 and we have prided ourselves on being a hard working DIY band from that moment. Since October 2011 Darrow Chemical Company has released 3 studio EP’s and 1 live EP on our own label, W.H.B. Records. A split 7” on No Balls Records (Germany) and a Second Pressing of our 1st Studio EP in cassette format (W.H.B. Records). We've also embarked on 2 self booked, financed and promoted national tours, not to mention a pretty impressive line of DIY merchandise. 

Natural Born Grillers Tour & More!

A little over a year ago, we launched our first Indiegogo campaign. We successfully met 120% of our goal, reaching $12,000. With that money we set out and accomplished just about everything we had planned and then some.  

This year, we plan a new campaign with different goals in mind. We recently announced our 3rd US tour, a 6 week tour that will span from coast to coast this summer. This time around, our goals involve repairing and maintaining our van so that it survives a 6 week run, ensuring our safety and successful completion of the tour. We aim to re-stock our merchandise for the tour, as well as provide new content.

This is where you, the fans, and Indiegogo come into play!

Once again, we are leaning on our fans for support. We have so many ideas that we want to bring to reality, but we need your help to make that happen. We have tried to come up with fun and valuable perks at many levels as an incentive to invest in our campaign without being too cheesy about it.

What We Need & What You Get

We’ve set our campaign goal at $5,000. The following is an outline of the items our budget will cover:

Items include but are not limited to:

  • 4 new tires plus alignment for our van 
  • other mechanical repairs and maintenance for our van
  • New/additional merchandise and restocking of the old merchandise
  • Production, mastering and pressing of a B-sides release entitled "Demos, Outtakes and Obscurities"
  • Mastering and pressing of The Doomsday Phrophecy (Loki and JV's previous band) demos through W.H.B. Records
  • Repressing of older releases
  • Promotional materials for upcoming tour (Tour posters, post cards, stickers, etc...)
  • Video & Audio equipment to begin filming a future DVD. We also plan to start our very own Bootleg Series which we will make available on DVD and digital download. 
  • Tour road crew
  • Cases for our gear
  • Costs for producing and shipping perks

There are a couple of items here that can't be stressed enough. Our Indiegogo costs alone will be close to, if not over $1000. The health of our van is of the utmost importance as it pertains to our safety and to the success of the tour. Our $5000 goal is very modest. In reality we will have to exceed our goal by a healthy margin. 

Our perks and incentives for pledging include:

  • Digital raffle ticket for a grand prize
  • Pins
  • "Natural Born Grillers Tour" koozie 
  • Hand written lyrics
  • Exclusive T-shirt with art by Argyle Goolsby
  • "Natural Born Girllers Tour" BBQ Apron
  • Exclusive!!! "Natural Born Grillers Tour" logo tee
  • BBQ with Darrow!
  • Our soon to be released "Demos, Outtakes and Obscurities"
  • "Return of the Touring Dead" Crew shirt
  • "Return of the Touring Dead" Hoodie
  • Other one of a kind goodies!

You’ll see a much more detailed rundown of our perks in the right column! We will be adding and removing perks as we go along so if you see something you're interested in, act quick! You never know how long that perk will be available. We worked hard on trying to create incentives that gave you excellent value on your investment and are fun. We hope that you like what we have to offer!

The Impact

Last year was a huge success. We look to build off that foundation. We want to expand our reach, we look to introduce new types of content through our website, YouTube and on DVD. We look to give you the biggest possible return on your investment in us. 

 We’re excited about this campaign. We’re lucky to have had such loyal support from our family, friends and fans throughout the years. We’re looking to create a team concept with all of you. This band begins and ends with you. We can only hope to entertain and inspire you to the best of our abilities.

Every contribution counts!

No contribution is too small. Every pledge makes a world of difference. The reality is we need to exceed our goal by a healthy margin for us to accomplish all of our goals.  We are humbled by your contributions and appreciate your efforts all the same!

Can’t invest monetarily?

Trust us. We understand that times are tough. But maybe you can invest a little bit of your time? Please take a moment and share this campaign on ALL of your social networks and even spread it by word of mouth. You can use the social networking tools available on this site to help share our page! Help us get the maximum exposure possible for this campaign!

We humbly thank you so much for the support

Grand Prize

This is a rare chance to get not only the Darrow Chemical Company complete discography, but the whole W.H.B. Records catalogue in one swoop! Many of these releases were limited and are out of print. In many cases you are getting discs from our own personal collections.

Included Items are: 

  • (WHB01) Darrow Chemical Company “A Nightmare on Seventh Avenue” CD 1st Pressing. Only 300 made. 2 years OUT OF PRINT!
  • (WHB01) Darrow Chemical Company "A Nightmare on Seventh Avenue" 2nd Pressing. Only 100 made. OUT OF PRINT!
  • (WHB01-CASS) Darrow Chemical Company “A Nightmare on Seventh Avenue” Cassette. Only 245 released.
  • (WHB02 )Darrow Chemical Company: “Live in Brooklyn” CD Only 100 released. 4 Years OUT OF PRINT! 
  • (WHB03) Darrow Chemical Company “Lone Star State” CD
  • (WHB04) Ghouls Night Out Presents "Songs to Murder that Special Someone 2" CD
  • (WHB05) Darrow Chemical Company "Plastic Smile" CD
  • (NBR049) Darrow Chemical Company/Vagora Split 7" Only 138 released.on No Balls Records (Germany) OUT OF PRINT!
  • Unused picture disc sheet for the Darrow Chemical Company/Vagora Split 7". Only 6 of these sheets exist. You can own one of them.

Includes items not pictured!

  • (WHB06) The Doomsday Prophecy's upcoming release "Demos 2010-2011" 
  • (WHB07) Darrow Chemical Company's upcoming release "Demos, Outtakes and Obscurities" CD (Limited to 100)


"Natural Born Grillers Tour" Koozie

Exclusive Campaign Pin

"Natural Born Grillers Tour" Apron

"Natural Born Grillers Tour" Tee

"Return of the Touring Dead Tour" Crew Shirt

"Return of the Touring Dead Tour" Hoodie

Darrow Chemical Company Flip Bill Cap

Exclusive Tee Art By Argyle Goolsby

Workshirt

Demos, Outtakes and Obscurities

story:
It's TIME to start celebrating what we hold closest to our hearts - family, community, abundance, and Spirit! Let's celebrate the LOVE in this Universe through the songs we sing together. I have challenged and dedicated myself to completing and masterfully recording my debut EP, DreamCatcher.  You amazing people are my best friends and closest families. You've been there for me in your own unique, yet crucial ways along this journey of my Spirit, my growth, and my musical creation.  In the same way I strive to make myself and my energy avaiable to positively affect each of you, I now use my Hawk's cry to humbly call for your loving donations.  In return, I am proud to offer some fantastic rewards that will leave you feeling ecstatic about your contribution to something bigger than all of us.  


The songs I write and sing ALL come from the Spirit in my Soul, which I use to hold up the mirror into YOUR own journey of the Spirit.  Songs of overcoming fear, being unlovable, and finding your compass and your hearts song. Songs of freedom, passion, and new beginnings.  Songs of silly nonsense, and of meandering Spirit sounds.  My dreams have been clawing their way through my waking reality in the form of musical medicine, and I'm proud to offer you a dose of my heart.

Your pennies, nickels, dimes, and dollars will be used to pay for studio production, engineering, mastering, rehearsal space, CD duplication and design, promotional photos, online distribution, legal blah blah, Dreamcatcher making supplies, and stickers of course. Maybe lovingly made Dreamcatcher soaps and bath fizzies?! It's gettin' real.


WHY Am I asking for your pledges to DreamCatcher:

Cost Breakdown

*The cost of recording music inependantly has come WAY down over the years thanks to technology and improved quality of computers/mics/interfaces.  That being said, what would have cost well over $10,000 in the past can be done for way under $5000 now!  My $3333 number is an odd one, but considering indieGoGo takes between 4-9% of the final proceeds, (dependand on hitting the goal) $3000 is exactly what I'll need to officially record, mix, master, produce, and duplicate the DreamCatcher EP, complete with original cover art, CD design, eco friendly cases, etc. YOUR willingness to buy a great CD with fun rewards, and help a man you love make his dreams come true is what this project is all about!  Music for your life, your heart, your yoga, your soul, your movement - both physically and spiritually, your willingness to step into your greatness and bring people with you - that's what I'm about, and that's what my music is all about.

Here's where the money comes into play:

>Producing physical copies of the record - $1000

>Equipment - Digital Interface for Recording(Saves me from Studio Costs!) - $150

>Equipment - Actual Working Non-broken Guitar - $900

>Equipment - Recording Headphones/Cables/Wiring - $100

>Digital distribution (releasing on Spotify, iTunes, etc) - $200

>Cover art/photography - $200

>Copyrights for each song - $200

>DreamCatcher Making Supplies - $100

>Sticker Printing - $100

>Album Release Bonfire Party supplies! - $100

>IndieGoGo's Percentage for Hosting - approx. $300 (TBD upon completion)

TOTAL - $3350


There will undoubdtedly be unexpected costs that arise during this fantastic journey, so anything that exceeds the goal will be put right back into the album to increase its greatness in the way of more songs, better audio quality, super ultra top-secret rewards... Exciting! 

I am extremely proud and excited to share my music with each and every one of you.  I sincerely believe that we can awaken and enliven the spirits and souls of those around us with our messages of LOVE.

I stand as a living example of what it means to discover your passion and live from trust.  I surround myself with incredible people like you, and now it's time to spread the Love to those who need it the most.  Please help me make this album, so I can return the favor in countless ways on countless days!  I'll be UPDATING this project page often, so check back for uploads and videos of rough cuts and live gigs featuring songs from the album.

THANK YOU from the bottom/top/sides of my heart for choosing to help create a peaceful Universe by supporting your local Hawk :)

Catch The Dream,

Hawk

SUP Yoga with LIVE Music on Lake Natoma - Summer '13

story:
J. Zuzanna a Polish jazz vocalist, pianist, composer and arranger currently living and recording in Los Angeles. J. Zuzanna was discovered performing in major Polish piano competitions and festivals as a child piano and vocal prodigy when she was just 8 years old. By the age of 10 she was performing with nationally recognized children television band ’Tecza’. It was also at this age, when she met her mentor and friend Christopher Sadowski (President of Polish Jazz Society), who took a close interest in her talent and introduced her to the jazz scene in Warsaw, Poland where J. Zuzanna began to receive recognition as an emerging and talented local artist.
By the age of 16 she was a winner of one of Polish TV shows called ‘TWOJA DROGA DO GWIAZD’- ‘YOUR WAY TO THE STARS’ and by the same time she was discovered and employed by Janusz Jozefowicz – owner and musical director of one of the biggest Broadway theaters in Warsaw. J. Zuzzana rapidly progressing jazz career took her from her native country of Poland to the United States where has made numerous guest appearances with artists such as: India Arie, Richard Smallwood, Stevie Wonder, Jack DeJohnette, Kuba Stankiewicz, Zbigniew Wegehaupt and Christopher Sadowski. J. Zuzanna appeared at Chicago’s Midwest Clinic with the Jazz Singers Group which led her to the East Coast where she performed at prestigious Harlem jazz clubs in New York City. She released and promoted her first album – The Meeting – in Trenton, NJ. Shortly thereafter, she was offered and accepted a scholarship to the prestigious Berklee College of Music in Boston, MA where she studied Jazz Composition. While at Berklee She composed and arranged for such artists as Rod Steward, Count Basie Orchestra, Arturo Sandoval Big Band, Grateful Dead, Patty Austin, Babyface, Dee Dee Bridgewater and the Tonight Show with Jay Leno. 

What we will do with the money:


1)  The EP should be twenty or so minutes in length  The money will be used to professionally record, mix, master and package the music.

2) I will be shooting music video with For My Single Already At Radio "I'll will Be Loving You". Professionally, Edited And Directed By One Of the Top Directors Of Music Videos TBA

story:
Short Summary


The Desert Rose ‘Soul Journey is all about ‘you' as an individual, ‘you’ as the collective’. We need and value your support. Please spread the word! Get your friends, neighbours, boyfriends, girlfriends, classmates, colleagues - whoever - to contribute to our campaign.

We are campaigning to raise funds for the premiere performance of ‘A Soul Journey’ at Wits Theatre in Johannesburg, following which will be a new CD and an international tour in April/May 2015. 

Desert Rose have been acknowledged by esteemed members of society such as Archbishop Desmond Tutu along with various Interfaith organizations, government and media in response to their creation of multi-lingual world music designed for the purposes of promoting peace.

Desert Rose are also well recognized as 'Musicians for Climate Change’ which continues to challenge the world on a global scale. Their song, ‘Bring Back Life’, has been selected by CAC (Climate Action Network - Collective of 900 NGO’s dedicated to alleviating the impact of Climate Change) as the official song which will promote Climate Justice. 

Supporting our campaign and assisting us with funding makes it possible for Desert Rose to bridge the social divides that exist within these arenas through their creation of Universal World Music. Help us promote peace and climate justice!

The South African group, based in Cape Town, have become leaders in creating and performing universal world music. A Soul Journey, a unique fusion of eclectic sounds and rhythms, a language beyond words will  enthrall audiences as they are transported into a unique musical journey for the soul.

The Desert Rose experience has been described as epic, emotive & mystical and is a fusion of orchestral sounds and African indigenous rhythms such as the live African Harp, Djembe Drum, Mbira, African Bow, Talking Drum & Pipe Flute. Together with multilingual vocals that includes Sanskrit, Aramaic, Hebrew, Arabic, Latin, Sumerian and English they have created a unique sound in the world music genre.

Desert Rose has been critically acclaimed for leaving a lasting impression on their audiences having performed and headlined major events in South Africa which include the following: Mandela Day at the Ubuntu Festival (2009), Cape Town Festival on Human Rights Day (2009 & 2011), the Peace March Celebrations in St Georges Cathedral (2009), the launch of the Charter of Compassion with Archbishop Desmond Tutu (2010). Since 2012 they have performed to standing ovations in  and in the UK (London, Oxford, Clophill)  Europe (Poland) and Far East (Singaporre, Malaysia, India).


What We Need & What You Get


We are Crowdfunding! Desert Rose is campaigning to raise $2100 towards our premiere performance ‘Soul Journey’ at Wits Theatre in Johannesburg and thereafter, the global release of our new CD which will be promoted when we embark on our international tour in April/May 2015. 

Should we not reach our entire goal, funds raised will be used towards the performance for as we all know: “The show must go on!”. 

Should we surpass our goal all additional funds will be used towards our long term goals which include an international tour, a global cd release, video costs, tour promotion and future recordings.

We have been working tirelessly on our Soul Journey performance, honing our repertoire and personally investing in our project.  For our Indiegogo campaign we are concentrating on the following: 

  • Raising our budget for travel and accommodation - Not only is this a realistic amount to gather but in addition, travelling between our local South African Provinces is a vital part of our creative process
  • Compensating our artists and our team - Creating new performances from scratch is a costly endeavour, especially with our local musicians dependent on these performances as their livelihood. 
  • Raising the necessary production and replication costs for our CD, transforming it into a creatively packaged listening experience. Your contributions will offset our debts and help us as we push forward. 
  • Having additional funds at our disposal for publicity and marketing will supply the key ingredient for a full house and the freedom to focus on ensuring that the ’Soul Journey’ experience will be an unforgettable one and will allow us to ensure an inspired musical adventure into an evocative landscape of rhythm and sound on the evening of our performance. 


The Impact


Founded in 1999 by world music composer, Lynne Holmes, Desert Rose is based in Cape Town and are widely regarded as leading composers, producers and performers of Universal World Music. 

Yusuf Ganief and Lynne Holmes are at the heart of Desert Rose, a dynamic and quirky couple determined to challenge convention as they explore the creation and emergence of a new musical genre. Desert Rose includes leading South African musicians and vocalists and is committed to creating new works annually which merge a kaleidoscope of culture with the innovative use of ancient languages and ultimately transform into a language beyond words. 

The ‘Soul Journey’ debut at Wits Theatre in Gauteng on the14th of November 2014 marks the beginning of Desert Rose’s shift toward an internationally recognized partnership with Waken Undaground which will serve to enrich the industry and allow further development of their collective and proudly South African brands both locally and internationally. 

As the debut performance draws near, Desert Rose, in collaboration with Waken Undaground, are simultaneously preparing for a world tour to Scotland, France and Ireland, scheduled for April/May 2015. 

The primary focus for the tour, running throughout April/May 2015, is to create an entry point and set the stage for the launch of our joint venture, ‘The OZ Project’. This initiative will engage on many levels as a global multi-cultural music, visual and performing arts exchange program which aims to dissolve artistic borders between South Africa, Ireland and France and launches officially 1st July 2015 in Dublin. 

Desert Rose’s return to the world stage will facilitate the momentum for the long term partnership goal to produce and disseminate music, promoting culture and encouraging processes for change. 

The Waken Undaground dream is as simple as it is ambitious, a global social organism operating within an artistic framework, representative of the diversity of the human family wherein each individual plays a crucial role in creating symmetry on every level. 

We aim to inspire a new world with our enterprise using collaboration as a tool for transformation, liquidating boundaries via music, art and dance and staying true to our relentless pursuit of global unity. One world, one nation , one heartbeat, one mind. 

We value your support and would love to hear from you should you wish to become involved in our projects or perhaps you would simply like to meet and greet to explore the art of opportunity whilst sharing ideas. 


Risks & Challenges


Life as musicians is a beautiful struggle. We must keep the journey going not because of the guarantee but because of the possibility. As with any venture, our starting point is an absolute, unswerving devotion to our cause and a healthy dose of reality. 

In todays climate collaboration is key and in order to ensure our success we are partnering with Waken Undaground and many local and international artists in keeping with the philosophy that collectively we achieve so much more than we can individually. 

We are tremendously focused and each one of our team is equipped with the necessary skills to overcome any hurdles we may encounter as we pursue our long term vision which is dedicated to achieving peace through the exploration of multi-cultural music, visual and performing arts and the practical support of grassroots peace initiatives throughout the world.


Other Ways You Can Help


If we have inspired you there are very many ways you can help, please support us by spreading the word… Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools

If you are intrigued and want to follow our progress please find us, like us and follow us on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube. We value your support!

Our purpose is structured around community. We would love to hear your thoughts and ideas with regard to our various initiatives. Please send us an email!

If you have a little spare time we are always up for a cup of coffee coupled with interesting conversation. We are happy to meet and greet or even have a little face-time on Skype to find out more about you.

We are always interested in growing our network and would be grateful to have the opportunity to connect with your communities, groups and/or organizations. If our projects are aligned with your vision please contact us regarding exploration and collaboration.

Our initiatives depend on the passion and dedication of the people we work with. If you have time to spare and would like to volunteer your services, become a member or partner or simply wish to find out more about getting involved we would love to hear from you.
