story:
Schubert's songs - written for me and for you.

                      

Hi, my name is Kathryn Whitney and I'm the Artistic Director of the Winterreise Project - a performance course for amateur pianists and singers over the age of 30 who are preparing a joint performance of Franz Schubert's 24-song cycle, Winter Journey (Winterreise).

Schubert wrote almost all of his over 400 songs for amateur musicians - and yet they are performed almost exclusively by professionals today. The Winterreise Project reconnects Schubert's wonderful songs with their original, intended amateur performers.

At the same time, the Winterreise Project offers amateur musicians rare access to professional-level training and the spotlight in which to perform as soloists - and it gives audiences the equally rare chance to hear them when they do.

We hope you will consider supporting the Winterreise Project!

Your donation will help make our course a success and you will ensure that we can continue in our campaign to provide high-quality song performance courses to adult amateur musicians in future.

Join us on our Winter Journey!

What is the Winterreise Project and what do we do?

The Winterreise Project is an intensive course, but it is also a pilot project. It is the first in what I hope will be many similar courses, all aimed at providing training and performance opportunities to amateur musicians over the age of 30.

Over a two and a half month period, the 34 students on the Winterreise Project meet every weekend for a series of masterclasses in which they learn to perform the songs in Schubert's cycle through intensive performance coaching with myself and with my colleague, the Russian-Canadian pianist, Anna Cal. Each student works on a minimum of four songs in masterclasses, and additionally each student takes four solo coachings and four duo coachings in pianist-singer pairs at other times during the week. 

Pianist-singer duos are a key element in our project. Each student is matched with a number of duo partners so they can discover the songs together through both voice and keyboard, just as amateurs would have done in Schubert's lifetime. The mixing of partners lets students see how a different voice and a different touch on the keyboard can make for a very different song. It also helps our students to bond into chamber music partnerships that we hope will continue once the course is over.

Masterclass in Wood Hall, Victoria Conservatory of Music

We also have a number of auditor participants working with us on the course - these are song lovers who attend all our sessions as audience members, providing an interested group of sympathetic listeners, just as Schubert would have had in his many musical salon gatherings.

At the end of the course, our performers come together to give a joint performance of the full 24-song cycle, with each pianist-singer pair contributing between one and three songs. 

Our students in rehearsal at the Baumann Centre, Victoria

How you can help - and our gifts of thanks to you!

We would be very grateful if you would consider helping us to make the Winterreise Project a success!

As a pilot project, we kept our tuition low to encourage applications, in particular from people from all economic backgrounds. From the outset, we aimed to make up the difference needed to balance our budget through this fundraising initiative, which will help up meet some outstanding administrative costs. 

Additionally, we are raising funds so that we can film our final concerts and pay for associated fees such as editing and DVD production. This film will be a welcome record of our work together, but its main purpose is to provide important footage for future grant applications for similar work.

Work on the Winterreise Project is a labour of love for our staff, who put in hundreds of volunteer hours to make the course happen. Your gift can help us make this effort worthwhile by ensuring the project is financially as well as artistically viable, and by giving us the means to continue with our work.

Your support will also help us lay a solid foundation on which to build future similar high-quality courses for amateur pianists and singers, and for music lovers.


Our perks: something (musical) for everyone!

To express our thanks, and to provide you with a way to be more closely involved in the project through your donation, I have created a few perks which I hope you will find interesting.

As you will see, each of our perks is itself a form of performance - I hope you will find one that gets your heart singing, and brings you and your loved ones closer to Schubert and his poet Mueller, and to the heart of their beautiful songs.

First, we are offering companies or foundations the opportunity to partner with the Winterreise Project. For a gift of $1000 you can opt to have Your Company Logo displayed on the Winterreise Project website at www.thewinterreiseproject.ca. We are looking forward to creating music together!

Second, we are offering you the chance to have your very own Winterreise performed by myself (Kathryn Whitney) and my colleague, pianist Anna Cal, for friends, family or colleagues - and this perk comes in two forms!

1. The 12-song Version. Schubert first published the first twelve songs of the cycle as a group and this 'original' 12-song version is often performed on its own. With a donation of $1200, you can claim a perk of a Winterreise Concert (12-song) version to be held in your own small venue.

2. The 24-song Version. For a gift of $2000, you can claim Your Own Winterreise Concert - a performance of the full 24-song cycle that we know and love!

Both concert perks will be performed live in your home or small venue on Vancouver Island. (Donor to provide piano. Donors to provide transportation and accommodation costs for performances outside Southern Vancouver Island. Thank you.)


Your Impact

Your donation to the Winterreise Project supports our course, and is a strong vote of encouragement to our singers, pianists, and auditors who are working hard together to produce a performance of the highest possible quality.

Your support also send an important message to our organizers and hosts - it is a vote of confidence in our decision to develop this quite unorthodox project, and will help us hugely to continue to develop similar projects for amateurs in future.

Finally, you will help me personally to fulfill a dream to develop high-quality training of this kind for amateur soloists in my home country, Canada. Having lived and worked abroad, I've seen how warmly adult amateur musicians are embraced and provided for as valuable musicians in their own right in other countries.

In Canada, we do very well at educating young musicians, and we have excellent career-track training program across the country. I would like to see Canadian funders, schools, and arts organizations broaden their scope to create greater opportunities for adult amateur musicians of all ages to have access to professional-level solo and chamber music training and performance projects that will challenge and inspire them.

I want to build lasting, performance-based bridges between adult amateurs and the superb solo and small ensemble chamber music written for them. Schubert appreciated and supported amateur musicians through his projects and we can too.  Your donation will help me make this case especially strongly, and will help make this dream a reality!


Receipts for your Donation

When you make a donation on the Indiegogo site, you will be issued with an automatic receipt from the Winterreise Project naming the amount of your donation, the name of your perk (if you chose one), together with our thanks.

If you would like an Official Tax Receipt for your donation, please do not donate on this page, but instead make your donation directly to the Victoria Conservatory of Music, via the official VCM CanadaHelps website. Please be sure to name THE WINTERREISE PROJECT under 'Special Instructions for the Victoria Conservatory of Music'. Thank you! You can also email Pam Prewett (Manager, Development, VCM) at prewett@vcm.bc.ca or telephone her on 250-386-5311 ext. 2370 to discuss your gift.

If you have any questions, don't hesitate to write to me (Kathryn Whitney) at mail@kathrynwhitney.net. Thank you!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are enthusiastic about Schubert song and amateur music-making but unable to contribute to our campaign in financial terms, thank you so much for reading all the way to the end of this page! We really appreciate your interest and we hope we will see you at one of our concerts (admission by donation!) or on a future course.

You can still help us in important ways by spreading the word about our campaign to your friends, family, and colleagues. Indiegogo has their own share tools, but you can also just cut and paste the URL into an email and send it round to your friends - or simply walk next door and tell them. Every bit helps, and we appreciate your support!


Thank you!

On behalf of myself, my colleague Anna Cal, and all our pianists, singers, and auditors, thank you so much for supporting the Winterreise Project!

story:
We know how hard it is for unsigned artists to break through the music industry. The stress, demand and financial struggle to maintain a music career is challenging, but we are here to help you access the tools you need to take on the industry.

 

Summary

Nico Rooney and David Ramlakhan originally founded YOUWANTIN in 2015, as an entertainment platform. Until recently, when they noticed a gap in the market for an urban artist development, media and promotions company. By contributing to this campaign you will be helping to further music careers and support our venture.

 

The Founders

Nico Rooney is an entertainer / entrepreneur currently studying a BA Music Business (Hons) degree at BIMM London and Interning at The Orchard (Sony Music). Nico has performed at over 70 shows nationwide and scored a Top 20 on iTunes, managing various aspects of his career independently whilst helping other artists around him.

David Ramlakhan is a graduated videographer and editor from Ravensboure university. David has edited over 100 music videos to date and worked with Capital Radio, filming interviews with some of their celebrity clients. He has a passion for videography and music.

Together we have built YOUWANTIN, allowing our creative industries to collaborate and empower unsigned artists. We are raising funds, which will allow us to develop an artist without having to charge them. One artist will WIN a development deal with us worth £1,000! and we will then be able to take the work we do with them, to investors and grant funders who may fund further artists through our platform.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are offering one lucky artist a chance to win a development deal with us worth £1,000. We need a minimum of £1234.75 to cover our start up business costs and fund our first artist development deal. We are willing to invest £534.75 of our own money into this project once we raise £700 through this campaign. Here is a break down of how the funding will be spent:

Artist Development (Ultimate Single Deal) - £1000

  • Songwriting - £100
  • Music Production - £100
  • Studio Time - £150
  • Mixing + Mastering - £70
  • Music Video - £200
  • Photoshoot - £90
  • Cover Art / Graphic Design - £70
  • Marketing / Promotion - £200
  • Distribution - £20

Business Start Up Costs - £234.75

  • Official Website (£9.24 x 24 Months) = £221.76
  • Register Company - £12.99

*Indiegogo charges a 5-10% fee (we will be paying this fee).

Within our Perks section we are also offering some of our artist services before we launch with a 20% discount, allowing you to save some money. All of our contributors are encouraged to send us a screenshot of their contribution to contact@youwantin.co.uk for some FREE tickets to our first YOUWANTIN showcase, date to be announced.

If we gain more funding than expected, we will fund another artist development deal and further our advertising for the company. If we don't reach our funding goal, we will continue to raise money through grant funders and investors.

Our next step is to approach the Arts Council for a grant, allowing us to fund more development deals for under privileged artist from communities around London. However these agencies don't give out funding unless there is a demand for our project and an amount raised prior to approaching them. This is why we need your help!

 

The Impact

Your contribution will enable us to create and promote a single for an unsigned artist and allow us to build a portfolio, to use when pitching for grants.

We are building up a name within the urban music scene and believe that the services we offer will help elevate careers of urban unsigned artists. By contributing to our campaign you will also be helping to fund for our official website. Once our website is launched, we will be offering various services to unsigned artists here is a list of our services:

  • FREE artist consultations
  • FREE blog features
  • Music production (producing, songwriting, recording, mixing and mastering)
  • Video production (managing, directing, editing and grading)
  • Royalty collection
  • Marketing and promotion
  • Distribution (iTunes, Spotify, MTV, VEVO + more)
  • Branding (graphic design, cover art, merchandise, photoshoots + more)
  • Event management (gigs, tours, launch parties)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute by funding our project you can still help us spread the word, please share our campaign with your social network, friends and family but most importantly please share the campaign with any urban unsigned artists you know, as they may benefit from our services.

You can sign up to our mailing list here: http://youwantin.co.uk and be the first to know when our official website has launched.

Thank you for taking your time out to read about our campaign we really appreciate it!

YOUWANTIN - The key to the industry
story_txt:
We know how hard it is for unsigned artists to break through the music industry. The stress, demand and financial struggle to maintain a music career is challenging, but we are here to help you access the tools you need to take on the industry.
 
Summary
Nico Rooney and David Ramlakhan originally founded YOUWANTIN in 2015, as an entertainment platform. Until recently, when they noticed a gap in the market for an urban artist development, media and promotions company. By contributing to this campaign you will be helping to further music careers and support our venture.
 
The Founders
Nico Rooney is an entertainer / entrepreneur currently studying a BA Music Business (Hons) degree at BIMM London and Interning at The Orchard (Sony Music). Nico has performed at over 70 shows nationwide and scored a Top 20 on iTunes, managing various aspects of his career independently whilst helping other artists around him.
David Ramlakhan is a graduated videographer and editor from Ravensboure university. David has edited over 100 music videos to date and worked with Capital Radio, filming interviews with some of their celebrity clients. He has a passion for videography and music.
Together we have built YOUWANTIN, allowing our creative industries to collaborate and empower unsigned artists. We are raising funds, which will allow us to develop an artist without having to charge them. One artist will WIN a development deal with us worth £1,000! and we will then be able to take the work we do with them, to investors and grant funders who may fund further artists through our platform.

story:
The Goal...

Hi guys

Last year we clubbed together to raise enough money to record my first professional EP: 'I Was Waiting'. I could never have done this myself and it's amazing to be sat here a year on with a completed, professional product in my hand, and one that you seem to all love so much.

The next step is to release a single from the EP and give it the best chance of being received by critics, press, radio and the wider world.

There are two key ways to do this.

Firstly, with a music video.

Secondly, with a PR campaign - a campaign that revolves around pitching the track to blogs, radio, press etc.

Now, fortunately, due to support I have so far received, I have been able to fund the PR campaign myself. The deposit is paid and the campaign is scheduled for release early November.

Where I need your help now is in funding the music video to bring the whole thing to life.

After much advertisement and 12 different pitches, at the very last moment, Harry came through with his script (15 minutes prior to the deadline i'd set for submissions!). He is a fantastic director and one that believes in the song as much as we do. As a result he is directing and editing the video totally free of charge.

What I Need

As well as a director working for free, I have also recruited my school-friend and pro-actor James McNicholas to play the role of the evil illusionist. He too has agreed to do this for free! 

Here's a breakdown of the remaining costs involved. As you will see it totals £1,010.00:

£300 - location 

£80 - Actress 

£80 - camera/lighting assistant 

£100 - make up artist (inc expenses) 

£150 - costume designer, inc costume budget 

£150 - props 

£50 - consumables 

£100 - transport + catering

What I Can Give You In Return

I have a host of fun and exciting exclusives to give you in return for your contributions, from access to the video script, to dedicated personal studio recordings. 

Please see the table of goodies laid out on the right hand-side of this page.

 

The Impact

 

We have come so far without the aid of any agents or record labels - here is our chance to take the music to the next stage and give it the wings it needs to be heard.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Please help get the word out and share the campaign and track with your friend and social networks.

And that's all there is to it. Thank you for reading

I truly believe if we reach the goal we'll make it into November with a phenomenal video and single release that will make a real impact.

Love and hope always

Michael x

story:
Qui je suis ?

Née dans un village des Chaudières Appalaches, j’ai su dès mon plus jeune âge apprécier la beauté de la simplicité.  La photographie a toujours été présente dans ma vie et j’ai appris à jongler avec cette dernière, d’abord par pur plaisir.

Lorsque venu le temps de choisir un métier, j’ai opté pour le design de mode qui s’est plutôt avéré comme étant un beau passe-temps. Quelques années plus tard, après une tentative d’études en design graphique, la révélation m'est apparue: je vis que pour la photographie!   J’aime figer dans le temps des souvenirs, des émotions et une personnalité propre à chaque image.

Automne 2011, le début d’une belle aventure, je me suis inscrite dans un DEP en photographie, puis en hiver 2012, le cours de lancement d’entreprise m’attendait à bras ouverts.   Je pratique la photographie depuis 2010 avec beaucoup d'admiration pour mes sujets; passionnée par toute forme d'art, j'adore tout ce qui touche à la culture. Festivals, spectacles de musique, danse, théâtre, photos de casting, mode locale, tout pour faire briller la créativité.

Je rêve à l’Islande depuis plus de 10 ans maintenant. Je suis passionnée par leur culture, leur musique, leurs paysages et leur climat typique. 

Je n’avais jamais voyagé, j’essayais d’économiser pour visiter ce pays. Je me suis rendue à l’évidence: c'est vrai ce qu'on dit des premières années d'une entreprise. Les profits ne sont pas au rendez-vous et la vie de travailleur autonome ne me permettrait pas de mettre des sous de côté avant plusieurs années. Mais l'Islande me hante toujours, encore plus depuis l'acquisition de ma formation en photographie. J’ai donc décidé d'utiliser ce qu’il me restait des prestations reçues, suite à un accident de vélo, étant jeune, pour m'y rendre.

Le 28 mai je quittais mon emploi à temps partiel pour me consacrer qu’à la photographie ! Par le fait même, j'ai pris place dans un avion me menant tout droit à l’aéroport de Keflavik, Islande, les larmes aux yeux devant toute cette beauté.


Mon projet

À mon retour de voyage, je me suis inscrite au projet Jeunes Volontaires afin de réaliser une exposition de grande ampleur me permettant d’avoir un statut d’artiste professionnelle. Les fonds accordés ne semblaient pas suffisants pour ma nouvelle condition de travailleur autonome à temps plein et pour ce que je voulais accomplir avec mon exposition mais j’allais y arriver... 

Au début de juillet je partais pour le premier festival d’une longue liste: le Festivoix . Peu après mon arrivée à Trois-Rivières, mon appareil photo se retrouve malgré moi au sol, dans une flaque d’eau. Le boitier et l'objectif doivent être réparés, je les perds pendant un mois, en pleine période de contrats et déjà appauvrie par mon voyage en Islande. On me prête un appareil, je loue un objectif et j’en achète un autre; mais je me vois dans l'obligation de me faire remplacer pour un mandat important. Les plans de mon été sont désormais fortement affectés et mon emploi de photographe est mis en jeu.

Aujourd’hui je me retrouve dans un situation très, très précaire avec un beau problème cette fois; celui d’être acceptée pour couvrir le renommé festival de musique Iceland Airwaves pour un journal Islandais. Par le fait même, j’en profiterais pour aller dans l’autre moitié inexplorée du pays afin de présenter une exposition plus complète.


5000$ - 3 objectifs

Ayant déjà dû emprunter un montant maximum à la fin de mes études pour l'achat de mes outils de travail (ordinateur, appareil photo, flash, objectifs…) je ne dispose pas des liquidités pour payer ces sommes inattendues. Afin de pouvoir continuer à faire ce métier, présenter une exposition à la hauteur de mes attentes et réaliser ce rêve complètement fou (voir inespéré) d'être photographe à un festival de musique en Islande j'ai besoin de ces sous pour: 

Payer le bris de mon appareil photo et achat de matériel supplémentaire

Frais de réparation de l’objectif: 400$
Frais de réparation du boîtier : 550$
Boîtier en surplus: Minimum de 2000$
Objectif spécialisé pour le spectacle: 1 500$

Réaliser une exposition

Impression photo et matériel: 1 500$
Local d’exposition: Minimum de 300$
Publicité: 150$
Vernissage: 150$

Participer au Iceland Airwaves 

Passe média: 150$
Location chambre: 500$
Avion: 1000$
Location voiture: 1000$

Comme vous pouvez le constater, peu importe le montant amassé, il est certain que cet argent sera bien utilisé et que la somme de 5000$ n’est pas suffisante pour couvrir tout ces frais. Votre contribution est donc fortement appréciée ! 

Gâteries !

Comme la tradition le veut avec Indiegogo, chaque don est accompagné d’un petit bonheur; j'ai donc créé quelque items spécialement pour l'occasion. 

Macaron
Petit macaron de 1,5" de forme carré avec un paysage typiquement islandais ainsi qu'une salutation islandaise.

                                 


Affiches 11x17 et 16x24
Il vous sera possible de choisir une photo parmi cette sélection ou même un coup de coeur que vous auriez eu auparavant en regardant mon travail. Ces dernières seront imprimées sur un papier très fin pour reproduire un fini "poster" mat.

Cadre "dollie" 8x10
Le choix devra être fait parmi cette sélection. 

         


*** À noter que l'achat des items (excepté les macarons) exclus la livraison postale  mais qu'il me sera possible de vous livrer le tout en main propre dans les alentours de la ville de Québec et ce sans frais supplémentaire. Si vous êtes de l'extérieur, le coût devra être évalué avec poste canada.
Surveillez vos email, je vous écrirai pour valider votre choix d'image ! 


Services de photographie

Vous pouvez aussi contribuer à ce projet tout en ayant l'opportunité de payer à l’avance, à prix réduit, une séance photo ! Il s'agit d'un prix spécial pour la campagne, aucun choix de photos n'est à faire, je traite et vous envoie ce qui est bon. Le montant exclus les retouches autres que celles de base, du temps supplémentaire lors de la séance, de même qu'un déplacement de plus de 70km. 
Pour plus de renseignements écrivez-moi: contact@llamaryon.com ou ma page  www.facebook.com/llamaryon !

Tónlist – Musique - Spectacle 100$

         

Ég heiti... - Je m'apelle... - Portrait pour une personne 125$

         

Leikir - Jeux - Photo Booth - 150$

         

Hátíð – Fête - Évènement 200$

         

Andlit - Visage - Séance famille 300$

         

Hjónaband - Mariage

         


Pourquoi contribuer ?

1. Je gravite dans la ville de Québec depuis maintenant 6 ans, appareil à la main, avec une passion énorme pour mon métier, en aidant la créativité et le talent d’ici à se démarquer. Ainsi, de façon bénévole, je mets mon appareil et mon temps, au service d’une communauté musicale qui n’a pas beaucoup de budget. Ces artistes émergents gagnent ainsi la visibilité dont ils ont besoin. Sans cette campagne, je devrai me résigner à me retrouver un emploi et ainsi devoir consacrer moins de temps à la photographie.

2. Je couvre depuis 6 ans le Festival OFF de Québec, 5 ans le Festival de cinéma de la ville de Québec et une première expérience au Festival d’été de Québec pour le Voir. Une participation au Iceland Airwaves serait un excellent tremplin pour ma carrière et un ajout de taille à mon curriculum vitae !

3. En me procurant votre aide pour l’achat d’un matériel adéquat, vous vous assurez d'une qualité d’image et de la fiabilité du matériel utilisé lors d’un futur mandat, en votre compagnie. De plus, mes dernières malchances m'ont convaincue que d’avoir du matériel de rechange était essentiel !

4. Je songe à mon exposition sur l’Islande depuis presque aussi longtemps que je fais de la photographie. Les idées bouillonnent et je vous promets qu’elle sera très différente de ce à quoi on s'attend de ce genre d’évènement. Pour se faire, j’ai absolument besoin de ressources financières supplémentaires: vous ne serez pas déçus!

5. J’ai eu beau essayer divers domaines d’études, des emplois dans des milieux différents, faire des tests d’orientation fréquents dans le but de trouver un métier avec l'assurance d'un meilleur salaire… rien n'y fait, il y a seulement la photographie pour me passionner autant !


Risques ?

Il n'y en a aucun. Si la totalité du montant n’est pas amassé, je ne m'envolerai sans doute pas vers l’Islande pour une deuxième fois. Je devrai tout de même remplacer tout ce beau matériel et une exposition se tiendra: mais elle ne sera pas aussi élaborée que je l'avais pensée !

Vous aimeriez m'aider mais vous avez vous même envie de voyager ou auriez besoin d’une campagne de financement pour payer votre épicerie ?


Partagez ce lien autant de fois que vous le souhaitez et je vous en serai tout aussi reconnaissante !

Takk-Merci !


NB. Si vous avez des questions au sujet de la campagne de financement, des services de photographie offerts ou des récompenses n'hésitez pas à m'écrire via mon courriel contact@llamaryon.com ou ma page Facebook www.facebook.com/llamaryon !

l'opportunité de payer à l’avance, à prix réduit, une séance photo ! Il s'agit d'un prix spécial pour la campagne, aucun choix de photos n'est à faire, je traite et vous envoie ce qui est bon. Le montant exclus les retouches autres que celles de base, du temps supplémentaire lors de la séance, de même qu'un déplacement de plus de 70km. 

Pour plus de renseignements écrivez-moi: contact@llamaryon.com ou ma page  www.facebook.com/llamaryon !

Tónlist – Musique - Spectacle 100$
         

Ég heiti... - Je m'apelle... - Portrait pour une personne 125$


         Leikir - Jeux - Photo Booth - 150$


         Hátíð – Fête - Évènement 200$
         


Andlit - Visage - Séance famille 300$


         Hjónaband - Mariage

         


Pourquoi contribuer ?
1. Je gravite dans la ville de Québec depuis maintenant 6 ans, appareil à la main, avec une passion énorme pour mon métier, en aidant la créativité et le talent d’ici à se démarquer. Ainsi, de façon bénévole, je mets mon appareil et mon temps, au service d’une communauté musicale qui n’a pas beaucoup de budget. Ces artistes émergents gagnent ainsi la visibilité dont ils ont besoin. Sans cette campagne, je devrai me résigner à me retrouver un emploi et ainsi devoir consacrer moins de temps à la photographie.
2. Je couvre depuis 6 ans le Festival OFF de Québec, 5 ans le Festival de cinéma de la ville de Québec et une première expérience au Festival d’été de Québec pour le Voir. Une participation au Iceland Airwaves serait un excellent tremplin pour ma carrière et un ajout de taille à mon curriculum vitae !

3. En me procurant votre aide pour l’achat d’un matériel adéquat, vous vous assurez d'une qualité d’image et de la fiabilité du matériel utilisé lors d’un futur mandat, en votre compagnie. De plus, mes dernières malchances m'ont convaincue que d’avoir du matériel de rechange était essentiel !
4. Je songe à mon exposition sur l’Islande depuis presque aussi longtemps que je fais de la photographie. Les idées bouillonnent et je vous promets qu’elle sera très différente de ce à quoi on s'attend de ce genre d’évènement. Pour se faire, j’ai absolument besoin de ressources financières supplémentaires: vous ne serez pas déçus!
5. J’ai eu beau essayer divers domaines d’études, des emplois dans des milieux différents, faire des tests d’orientation fréquents dans le but de trouver un métier avec l'assurance d'un meilleur salaire… rien n'y fait, il y a seulement la photographie pour me passionner autant !



Risques ?Il n'y en a aucun. Si la totalité du montant n’est pas amassé, je ne m'envolerai sans doute pas vers l’Islande pour une deuxième fois. Je devrai tout de même remplacer tout ce beau matériel et une exposition se tiendra: mais elle ne sera pas aussi élaborée que je l'avais pensée !Vous aimeriez m'aider mais vous avez vous même envie de voyager ou auriez besoin d’une campagne de financement pour payer votre épicerie ?
Partagez ce lien autant de fois que vous le souhaitez
et je vous en serai tout aussi reconnaissante !
Takk-Merci !NB. Si vous avez des questions au sujet de la campagne de financement, des services de photographie offerts ou des récompenses n'hésitez pas à m'écrire via mon courriel contact@llamaryon.com ou ma page Facebook www.facebook.com/llamaryon !

story:
Hello! I'm Berry, a young independent lgbtq+ musician/youtuber from the PDX area. Music has been a huge part of my life ever since I was young and, cliche as it sounds, I've always known I needed to be a musician. Over the past few years I've been working on trying to create an EP of my music however I am lacking in resources and funds as an independent artist. 

The original plan to make a 5 song EP, however, it's starting to look like I will have enough songs to make A 10 SONG ALBUM! 

It's a huge dream come true to be able to make an album of my own music. 

I have found a lovely recording studio that is interested in helping me produce it, however, I could use a little help and support to make this dream a reality. 

No matter how much you can support or donate toward helping me create 'Permafrost,' even  if you can just share the indiegogo and spread the news, I am forever grateful for it. Thank you so, so, so much <3 

- Berry

How to support me & What you'll get in return!!

I need about 1000 dollars to make this album a reality, which will cover paying the recording studio, shipping out perks, making the album booklet art, and any other unexpected expenses for covering the cost of this album.  
In return, when you donate, you will get some pretty awesome perks as a thank you for supporting me and this album.

Also you get all perks previous to the ones you claimed unless it's one of the limited perks!! 

Representation & My Lovelies

If you have just stumbled upon this indiegogo and don't know me from elsewhere, I run a youtube channel where I have talked about lgbtq+ topics and also post videos of my music/covers. A big reason I want to make this album, beyond it being my biggest life dream, is to represent the teens/kids in the LGBTQ+ community who have a lack of representation in the media and music industry. To show young LGBTQ+ that there are humans like them out there who have the same dreams and you can reach them. Representation is so important and we need to change the lack of LGBTQ+ in the industry especially because when represented it isn't often represented in a good light. 

Risks & Challenges

There are always risk and challenges when it comes to being an artist in any way. If it's music, visual arts, video, photography, etc. The big one here is I have been trying to figure out how to make an album for two years and struggled with doing it myself. I've finally realized that I need to go to people who have experience in mixing, producing, and recording music with the proper equipment, which I don't have. 

Other Ways You Can Help & Support The Album!

If you cannot donate but would like to help in other ways share the indiegogo online! facebook, twitter, instagram, etc! get the word out about this project!! Thank you to anyone who does share because a big part of funding is getting the word out and you are helping tremendously even if you cannot donate.

story:
THE OPPORTUNITY

On April 21 and 22, we will bring our work-in-progress to audiences at JACK, an obie-winning performance venue in Brooklyn.  Our mission: 

  • Integrate new music generated last year in Chicago with the script, presenting a music-driven story, inspired by Afrofuturism, house music, and the queer black experience. 
  • Test our dance party / live theater concept. A DJ on board with our team of theater and music artists, we will blend the show with a dance party experience. 

This is an ambitious project on limited funds. And we've got an awesome team lined up. With your support, the magic will happen. 

YOUR TAX-DEDUCTIBLE CONTRIBUTION AT WORK

We're working from a small budget and seeking $10,000 to offset production expenses, primarily the modest stipends we're offering to the team:  our nine performers, general manager, stage manager, costume/wardrobe/make up, transportation, food, you get the picture.

Every little bit helps, and our team is rolling up their sleeves to make sure donors feel the love. That means our perks include everything from personalized serenades and styling consultations to customized social media shade for that special someone.  

In the meantime, our team is activating all sorts of resources to make Bring the Beat Back happen.   We've helped keep the budget lean with some key supporters:

The Drama League - our director, Christopher Burris, received a residency for the project just in time to help us save money on rehearsal space and other admin costs. 

The National Black Theatre - our playwright, Derek Lee McPhatter, is currently an I AM Soul Resident Playwright at The National Black Theatre in Harlem, which hosted our first round of auditions and is also providing some administrative support.  

Under the Spell Productions, Inc., is managing the money stuff. It's a 501c3 non-profit organization. So that means your gift is tax-deductible. 

YOUR IMPACT

Your support will do more than help keep the bills paid. It will demonstrate the diversity of the communities in support of Bring the Beat Back.  

The story we're telling is specific. It reflects many of our playwright's challenges coming of age as a black gay male (and sci-fi geek). But the struggles in the show are shared by many team members, some black, some queer, some sci-fi fans, and some are none of the above.

But all of us have found something resonant about Bring the Beat Back and we believe you will too.  Your support will be a powerful demonstration of what becomes possible when we celebrate the diversity of our experiences.  

Plus its gonna be tons of fun.

And success with the show in 2017, means we'll be able to do more of it very soon.  Maybe even bring a touring version to a theater (or night club) near you! 

 

CHALLENGES

There aren't very many queer, black, sci-fi, music-theater extravaganzas out there for us to learn from, so we're definitely charting our own path. Does this show go to Broadway? Should it evolve underground? We're not sure, but the April presentations will help us figure that out. 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

We know times are hard. And $$ is just part of the plan.  There are lots of ways you can show your support: 

  • Make your Voice Heard - Tell everyone you know about Bring the Beat Back.
  • Contact us for volunteer opportunities - we are in need of some volunteer help for the Brooklyn show - in stage management, transportation, and other areas. Inbox us!

story:
The members of the Brooklyn Philharmonia Chorus are asking you to keep good music alive in Brooklyn, New York.

The Brooklyn Philharmonia Chorus was founded in 1955 by Siegfried Landau as the choral affiliate of the Brooklyn Philharmonic Orchestra. The chorus has brought a wide variety of great choral music to the Brooklyn community in at least 2 concerts a year. We have performed at the Brooklyn Academy of Music and venues throughout Brooklyn, as well as Lincoln Center and Carnegie Hall.

We are now in our 62nd year – we are the longest running community chorus in Brooklyn! We perform challenging, ambitious works. Last winter we produced Amahl and the Night Visitors. This spring the Chorus is performing Brahms’ Requiem.

We lost a major source of funding this year and barely have enough resources to put on our Spring 2017 concert, as well as our Winter 2017 concert. That’s the reason for this crowd sourcing campaign.

We are an all-volunteer group of singers who come from Brooklyn, Manhattan, Long Island, and Westchester to share our love of choral music. One of the joys we experience singing in this chorus is performing with professional musicians. We don’t know anywhere else where an amateur can be “this close” to the pros and personally see how they make music come to life.

Our audiences tell us it is a super experience for them as well!

To produce the Spring 2017 concert, we need to hire two profession pianists and four professional soloists, as well as pay our conductor and piano accompanist. We of course have other costs to produce the concert, including printing the concert program and paying the church staff.

We have been rehearsing with gusto under the direction of our long-time conductor, Doug March, and this is shaping up to be a great concert.

When you contribute to this crowdfunding campaign, we have lots of goodies for you, including tickets to a special reserved seating section at the concert. If you are unable to join us, then please consider pledging to receive a CD or DVD of the concert.

Please consider making a donation to allow us to make our 2017 season happen. The people of Brooklyn deserve to hear good music at a very affordable price of $20 per ticket (just a little more than the price of a movie ticket.) As they say, “The Show Must Go On.”

The Brooklyn Philharmonia Chorus is a 501 c 3 non-profit organization, so all of your donations to this campaign are tax deductible. Thanks in advance for all of your help.

story:
Hi Folks! 

My name is Edison, I am Singer/Songwriter from ED CURTIS (www.edcurtismusic.com). After recorded two EP's "Haunting Feelings" (2015), and "Watching You Go" (2016), I am happy to announce that Im about to finish my FIRST ALBUM.

 

Your Support

In the frame of the release & promotion of my Album Debut, I have received a formal proposal to book some shows in Europe, but the offer only includes accommodation and food for the dates of each venue. So, the main issue to solve is how to come to Europe and the expenses during the tour, its all about the budge. You know, as independent musician is not easy, I already spent a lot of money on independent's production (EP's, Album Debut),  and now also on promotion services for my first Album. It would be great if you can support this project, and also why not, we can meet in some of the venues in Europe :)

Let's Do It Together  

The main issue to make it real, and rock with my band in Europe is the cost of Flight Tickets from South America to Europe, and the Accommodation Fees during the tour.

For that reason, I have some awesome perks for you: Digital Album Download Link, Signed CD, Entry Tickets, Collection Box, Meet & Greet , and Acoustic House Concerts.

Let's do it together, this project will cost around USD 8,500 to make it happen:

- Flight Tickets Buenos x4: USD 7300

- Accommodation: USD 1200

Finally, if we don't reach the entire goal, but if we reach at least 80%, I could be able to manage and invest the rest and make it. Otherwise we can use part of this money for the production of hard copies & merchandising to deliver to the contributors.

The Importance Of Music In Our Lives

"Music is best way that I have to express myself, my essence, emotions and feelings, while connecting other people". Ed Curtis

The main impact is share and connect with local people in the frame of multi-cultural exchange, and also meet with the Chilean and Argentinean community in those countries. Also it would be great share with people who support us and meet them at the concert and also talk about the experience and cultural exchange,  you can all be part of this!

The last three years I worked hard to arrive to this point, investing time, resources, and energy, etc. That the reason why I decided to come here and create this campaign, for sure there are a lot of people that can feel identified with this.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, it doesn't mean you can not help me, you can also help with:

  • Make some noise about our campaign and share between your friends and network.
  • Don't forget that you can also use the Indiegogo share tools :)

THANKS YOU

story: I'm Maddie Bruno, I'm 15 years old and I'm from New Jersey. All my life, music has given me the best feeling in the world. I knew since I was younger that singing is all I want to do. As I got older I began writing some music, as well as performing some of it as well. to record my own album would be the most incredible thing in the world, considering this has been such a huge goal of mine. Recently I got an opportunity to work with a Billboard charting music producer at Capitol Records in Los Angeles, and I'm gonna be raising money so I can put out my first EP (small album) for you all. This campaign is so important to me because pretty much all my life I have wanted to be able to share my own music with others so that I could inspire others, and give others a feeling from my music. Everyone that contributes, you have no idea how thankful I am. Every donation goes such a long way towards this album and I am so excited for all of you to be apart of my journey. Every dollar from my campaign will go straight to making the music. I'm gonna need $15,000 to put out an album with 3 songs, and I know we can do this. Again, thank you so much for all of your support. It means the entire world to me. If I don't reach my entire goal, I'll still be able to fund one song! Everyone contributing will automatically be apart of my entire journey. Because without you, none of this would be possible. An obstacle I may face while achieving my goal would definitely be reaching it, but I believe we can do this. So I am super super excited to start this campaign, and if you can, please spread the world! It means so much to me and I am so thankful for all of you!

story:
2015 is a big year for BBB as we plan to write this summer and record our 4th studio album. The band has been on hiatus for the past couple years only doing a few European tours and select gigs. It has been almost 4 years since our last release and want you all to be a part of the next BBB chapter! 

We ask that you help us make it happen through donations of Any size, we think our goal can be easily met with donations as simple as $1. 
The way we see it, if each of our followers on Facebook donated just $1, we would have over $80,000!

We look forward to sharing our next creation with all of you and cant wait to play your town and visit new places around the world!


Spread the word and SHARE!



Bonded' Started back in 2005 playing gigs anywhere and everywhere-Backyard gigs, Warehouse's and small venues throughout California.

The Original 4 piece Line-up consisted of Ruben on bass,Jose on vocals,Carlos on drums and Alex Lee on guitar. After about a year playing together the band decided to add another guitar for a more fuller sound with Juan Juarez, he was just the second guitarist to try out and would get the job on the spot.  

After competing and winning a battle of the bands of the Inland Empire, The band was awarded $3000 and free time at a local record studio, which birthed the "4 Pints of Blood" Demo in 06'

The band would then go on to self-release the EP "Extinguish the Weak" in 2007.

In 2008 the band would come to an agreement with earache records and go on to record 3 full length albums "Feed the Beast" 2008 - "Exiled to Earth" 2010 - "The Aftermath" 2012


Be a part of our next record and help keep the scene alive!


The Current Line-up consists of Mauro Gonzales on vocals, Jessie Sanchez on bass. Juan Juarez on guitar and Carlos Regalado on drums,

It has been almost 4 years since our last release and want you all to be a part of the next BBB chapter! 


We ask that you help us make it happen through donations of Any size, we think our goal can be easily met with donations as simple as $1. 
The way we see it, if each of our followers on Facebook donated just $1, we would have over $80,000! 



We look forward to sharing our next creation with all of you and cant wait to play your town and visit new places around the world!
Spread the word and SHARE! Bonded' Started back in 2005 playing gigs anywhere and everywhere-Backyard gigs, Warehouse's and small venues throughout California. 
The Original 4 piece Line-up consisted of Ruben on bass,Jose on vocals,Carlos on drums and Alex Lee on guitar. After about a year playing together the band decided to add another guitar for a more fuller sound with Juan Juarez, he was just the second guitarist to try out and would get the job on the spot.  
After competing and winning a battle of the bands of the Inland Empire, The band was awarded $3000 and free time at a local record studio, which birthed the "4 Pints of Blood" Demo in 06'
The band would then go on to self-release the EP "Extinguish the Weak" in 2007.
In 2008 the band would come to an agreement with earache records and go on to record 3 full length albums "Feed the Beast" 2008 - "Exiled to Earth" 2010 - "The Aftermath" 2012


Be a part of our next record and help keep the scene alive!

The Current Line-up consists of Mauro Gonzales on vocals, Jessie Sanchez on bass. Juan Juarez on guitar and Carlos Regalado on drums,

story:
20th Anniversary Clarissa Street Reunion:
                             "Celebration of Neighborhood" 

The Clarissa Street Reunion Committee invites: you to join our 20th anniversary reunion "Celebration of Neighborhood".  To be held on August 15th, 2015 on Clarissa Street, our theme pays tribute to the people in places comprising our reach history. 
Reflecting our theme, we invite people from neighborhoods throughout Greater Rochester to join us on August 15th to celebrate neighborhood in a broad sense. 


What We Need & What You Get

What we are looking for is $50,000 to establish a "Vision Fund." This "Vision Fund" will enable the reunion committee to fund the development of concept proposals aligned to Cornhill Neighbors Association and the Western New York Landmark Society vision for Clarissa Street. The "Vision Fund" will provide funds to develop the concept proposals for: 

1. The Pythodd Club Amphitheater

2. Historical Murals 

3. Historical Banners

4. Historic Signs and Plaques


The Impact

Neighborhoods and stakeholders and controllers of land use will be engaged throughout the development to create a permanent marker for this historic community. 


Potential contributors can encourage others to share in this project to promote the significance of "Historical Community" throughout the country.

story:
My name is Steve McClain and I am a musician and composer in Nashville, TN.  I am recording an EP of 5 brand new songs at Dark Horse Studios.  The tracking is almost done, but we need some help producing the final product.  You can make this happen – the more the money we raise, the better the project will be. 

By supporting this campaign, you will play a personal role in making this all come to life.  Funds from the campaign will cover mixing and mastering  and production of the actual CDs.  And every level of support comes with some great perks, like free digital downloads, signed posters, CDs or you could get your very own house concert.

If we don’t raise the goal amount, we won’t be able to produce the CDs – only digital downloads and that would be sad.  Wouldn’t you rather have a physical copy with liner notes and photos?  I would. 

So thanks for reading.  If you can’t contribute right now, please pass this on by sharing the link or using the Indiegogo share tools and we’ll get this project rolling.

story:
It's been 10 years of Total Torment, we've played sold out shows with legends like Exodus, Obituary, and Ensiferum. For all the high's that we have had we've also had our low's, but over the last 2 years since the release of our sophomore album "Prophetic Deceiver" we've stepped our game up to a new level taking our show on the road for the first time and getting featured in magazines like Decibel, it's been an amazing last two years. 

The time has now come to craft and produce what we think will potentially be our masterpiece. We've grown leaps and bounds as musicians since our last album, we took that to create what we think will be our signature sound. We want you to help create this best of a record. 

We could have taken this to task on our own, and dug deep into our pockets for this project, but with the material that we have ready to go we want this to be done the right way with the best production we can get to give you the best listening experience possible!

Musicians as a whole are fueled by their fans, and we feel this is an extension of that. With your help we can breath life into this project and unleash the rifftastic fury that this album will promise!

We've put some cool perks together for our pledges and there are a variety for you to choose from.

Make sure to tune into our Facebook page Monday August 15th, 2016 at 08:50pm (PST) as we will be streaming a special live set from the Regent Theater in Los Angeles. We will be announcing the title of this new album and debuting the title track. This will give you an opportunity to get a taste of what to expect from the new album!

story:
Hi! I'm Heather & I'd like to share an album with the world 

Earlier this year I wrote (and finished) songs during a solo month-long journey on a  musical adventure down south. I got home more inspired than I've EVER been. And I knew what had to be done next... I found an EXCELLENT producer here in Rochester to help the songs come alive and I couldn't be more excited about how they sound!
I've invested my life in music. I've been around it since I was born. I've weaved through many genres with passion from classical to jazz, blues, celtic, folk and rock learning new skills and honing the craft. I've even dedicated my day job to supporting musicians, supporting their musical souls and fatigued muscles.

I know with absolute certainty that I need to follow my dreams to play music, travel and perform as much as the fates allow.

Unfortunately, the loving and awesome band I play with (The Crawdiddies) aren't up to travel as much as I'd like and what I know is that I MUST! This album represents me being able to go out on my own and make things happen!! This is an investment in my future so I have something on the road that I can sell and support myself with as I travel and play music!

What I Need & What You Get!

Money (check)  time (check) and soul (check) are invested, now I need help completing it! 
$1000  Remainder of the studio time with producer
$1000 Physical distribution costs to print CDs with a reliable company 
$300 Everything to do with the art and hosting the accompanying art show (book                  binding, supplies, room rental)   I'd love to employ a professional local          artist and friend to help me book bind the art for you!
$200 shipping expenses and indiegogo platform
...in exchange for...
THIS AWESOME ALBUM FULL OF SPIRIT!!
Cool things in the "GALLERY" AND "PERKS"
THE GREAT FEELING OF SUPPORTING A CREATIVE ARTIST AND FRIEND!
SUPPORTING THE SPIRIT OF CREATING ORIGINAL MUSIC!

Connection

I want this album to inspire an emotional connection.  I'm calling it House of Healing for many reasons. As i've come to concretely realize through the profession of massage therapy, we all know someone (or are someone) with an illness. Weather it be physical, mental or emotional, doesn't matter, everyone is going through something incredibly painful.... AND the worst part,  is that it is usually only acceptably talked about behind closed doors. The healing happens when the wound is recognized and supported. These songs were written to support the spirit to continue on. 

It's my hope that the CD can remind listeners of our compassion, of our strength and of the mysterious qualities of the universe. 

I'm dedicated to music, weather it's me busking on the streets or going to an open mic or booking shows in different cities, I know i can get my music out there the old fashion way. This is the first step!

Risks & Challenges

 As an artist I'm opening my raw self, my emotional baggage, my feelings of hope (and insecurity) inside this record and within this campaign because I believe in communication and the strength of the human spirit. 

I took a giant leap of faith in making this record knowing that I'd be able to pay for it weather by small donations, benevolent patrons or paying it off in time. I believe in putting myself and this CD out there enough to do that. My goal is to raise money in 30 days!  

Talk talk talk about it!

If you can't contribute that doesn't mean you can't help. Please consider sharing this on your page. I'll be littering your news feed in the next month on facebook and playing shows around town. 

WISH ME LUCK!!!!!!

story:
Ants on a Log is music for children and other childlike people. 

We believe that kids' music should be excellent--so excellent that adults want to listen too. And so excellent that kids learn while singing along. Here are some things that kids might learn from our album:  

  • An environmentally-friendly way to take home leftovers from a restaurant
  • Some girls have short hair
  • Two friends working as a team can go a long way.
....and more! We've got our songs all recorded and ready to go....now we need your help!

Our album production reflects our socially conscious values.

Your contribution goes toward:

  • Original artwork by local artist Tamara Weiss.
  • Local, small business CD production by Sire Press (thanks Chris!) and Buckeye Studio (thanks Peter!).
  • Non-jewel case and no-plastic-wrap packaging.
  • An album that encourages kids to explore songs through their own artistic creativity. (Yes, the album includes a coloring book! And if you send us your colored-in pages, we'll post them on our website!)

Thank you for your support!

We have been blown away by the support we have received so far! In our first year as the Ants, we have already been played on WXPN's Kids' Corner, featured on Kathy O'Connell's Kids' Corner Stage at the Philadelphia Folk Fest, and booked as part of the acclaimed kids' series Peanut Butter and Jams at World Cafe Live. It's been an amazing year, and we are looking forward to taking this next step with all of you as our community!

Something for YOU!

We appreciate your support (see above paragraph for statement of gushing love.) We've got some sweet perks for you generous donors... And for those who go above and beyond in the support category, we want to give you something special-- A donation of $300 gets you your very own personalized love song (based on details you provide) --basically the BEST gift EVER for a loved one.

story:
Live Recording

Leprous has existed for almost fifteen years, and have gone from being a completely unknown youth band from Notodden, Norway to being a recognised name within the progressive metal scene.

For quite a lot of years we've played with the thought of doing a live video and audio recording, but there have always been aspects of our live show, we thought we could improve. In addition to that, the budget always seemed unrealistic. Now however, we have a show we're very proud of and we wish to eternalize it. 

Making a live recording is very expensive, especially if you want to do it properly. Therefore, we're reaching out to you, to help us realise this dream. 


What you get

We're applying for 20, 000 euros for this project. Those money will help us cover things such as venue rental, film crew, editing, sound recording, mixing, mastering, equipment rental etc etc. 

When supporting the band, you can get your hands on some very unique items. Signed products, lessons, interaction with the band, rare items, vip concert tickets and many other interesting perks. 

The more funds we manage to raise, the more money we will put into making this show spectacular. 


The Product

Through the years, Leprous has managed to get a very good live reputation, and we believe that we can make a very artistic and unique live recording, both musically and visually. One thing is to see a concert, but there's something very special with being able to sit at home in your own living room, studying the details of the show.


Risks & Challenges

There's always a risk when starting up a new project and especially a project as big as this one, but Leprous are known to go through with and complete all that is started. 

If you support our campaign, you can count on us keeping our end of the deal. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the possibility to help us financially, you can still help us by sharing the campaign on social medias such as Facebook, Twitter and Instagram or simply letting your friends know about the campaign. 

Thank you so much in advance, and we hope you can help us make this dream come true.

Leprous

story:
Short Summary

We have a goal to work daily, with the commitment to creating scored compositions and new arrangement of compositions. 

From our past experience with Tim Francis acting as composer and Cari Burdett acting as performer, we are currently interested in exploring the creative relationship and the possibilities it offers. We would like to explore the intersection of composer and performer and see how the traditional lines and boundaries might be pushed, blurred and reversed.

Explore our potential as creative collaborators:
Pushing and exploring the boundaries of performer/composer/collaborator,
where we each respond and try new ways of meeting in the creation of a piece, as well as the delivery of the performance, which includes taking risks with new forms of instrumentation in performance/composition.

3 main methodologies of work:
- Tim's composed work as source material with Cari offering insight into performance of the piece.
- Pieces already in Cari's repertoire as a starting point for reimagining and re-composing existing pieces as collaborators.
- Jointly composer/performed new works written from the developing perspective of our new relationship as artist.

Benefits of working in Banff:
- Opportunity for focussed time to commit to exploration of the project in an uninterrupted process is the biggest factor.
- Mentorship from professionals in the field.
- Influenced by surroundings, not only the natural environment and beauty of Banff, but by the environment of the Banff Centre itself - the facilities, other participants, and faculty/guest artists.

Our residency time will lead to new compositions and possibilities. 


Timothy Francis:

Timothy attended the Victoria Conservatory of Music on full scholarship and studied composition, theory, and piano. He won their composition contest every year he was in attendance, open to composers from anywhere in Canada and was twice awarded their most prestigious scholarship. Before graduating, he lectured on Shostakovich for the Victoria Symphony, and taught classes in harmony, music history, and theory. He has worked with Pacific Opera Victoria for their Libretto Laboratory (LibLab), after being selected from composers across Canada. Shortly after graduation his work “For Wordsworth” for orchestra and tenor was premiered at Carnegie Hall, NYC by the New York Pops and went on to several other performances in North America notably the Vancouver Opera Orchestra at a concert at the Orpheum Theatre and on a cross Canada tour by tenor Ken Lavigne. His song cycles have been song internationally as well as in Canada in competitions, concerts, and masterclasses. He has performed as a pianist in jazz festivals across British Columbia and toured internationally performing along the West Coast from Vancouver to San Diego. His music has been called “a worthy re-examination of the practice of Berg and Webern looked at through a 21st century lens” and his songs as “grateful to and for the voices that sang them”. Films featuring his music have premiered to acclaim in Victoria, Vancouver, Montreal, and Berlin film festivals.

Cari Burdett: 

Coming from a focused operatic training at McGill and the Royal Academy, London England where she focused on song performance of new music, opera, early music and soloing in orchestral performances. One of her great joys continues to be in the collaborative process of performing and developing works for the stage, with a special interest of premiering new works of compositions written for her unique rich alto voice.  Over the recent years, Cari has focused on developing  ‘Dramatic Gypsy Cabaret’ music as a theme into her performance creations. Most recently Cari was nominated for Best World Album at the Year by the CWMA, 2015 for her album ‘ Magnoli’a, which was released March 2015..  This music project was recorded in studio with the Juno Award winning producer, Joby Baker and is paired with outstanding Canadian talent; Richard Moody, Adrian Dolan, Quinn Bachand, Miles Black and Joby Baker.

Cari Burdett lives through music, as anyone who has spent five minutes with her immediately understands. She possesses a varied repertoire with a focus on new music and composers like Mahler, Mussorgsky, Tchaikovsky, Elgar and Britten. She has performed world premiers of new works, notably Shouts for Herodias: a Melodramatic Scena for solo voice, by Thomas Hyde.  Cari’s vivid presence and singing garnered her star reviews for her London performance of the role of Baba the Turk in Stravinsky’s “The Rake’s Progress” and Carl Jenkins’ ‘Stabat Mater’. Cari embodies a vast repertoire of musical styles, methods and expertise.

www.CariBurdett.com

The Money Situation
The Banff Centre has covered more then half of the tuition expenses and has given us approx $2000.00
We need now with your generous Help:
 $400/each = $800 to cover our travel in airfare to fly from Victoria to Banff. 
$120/each = $240 to get from Calgary Airport to the Banff Centre in the bus
$80/each = $160 to get from the Banff Centre back to the airport ( they give artists a discount for one direction)
$600/each = $1200 to cover the remaining Tuition, Room and Board at the Banff Centre. 
Total = $ 2,400
Where we will have a room, meals, a music studio, a musical mentor, performance opportunities in amazing state of the art theatres, recording possibilities, meeting and collaborating with other artists.. it will be AMAZING. 
We Thank you for your support. 
Check out our perks - we are excited to compose for you!!

Thank you for sharing this fundraising campaign with your networks, Facebook and friends with the Share Tools!!

We will offering a 'workshop- presentation -concert' when we return which will feature highlights and the processes we went through, including performances of our compositions. 


Many thanks. 

Please feel free to ask questions - 

Cari.burdett@shaw.ca

www.Cariburdett.com

We will be uploading bits from Banff while we are there.

Coming from a focused operatic training at McGill and the

music, opera, early music and soloing in orchestral performances. One of her
great joys continues to be in the collaborative process of performing and
developing works for the stage, with a special interest of premiering new works
of compositions written for her unique rich alto voice.  Over the recent years, Cari has focused on
developing  ‘Dramatic Gypsy Cabaret’
music as a theme into her performance creations. Most recently Cari was
nominated for Best World Album at the Year by the CWMA, 2015 for her album ‘
Magnoli’a, which was released March 2015..  This music project was recorded in studio with
the Juno Award winning producer, Joby Baker and is paired with outstanding
Canadian talent; Richard Moody, Adrian Dolan, Quinn Bachand, Miles Black and
Joby Baker. 
Cari
Burdett lives through music, as anyone who has spent five minutes with her
immediately understands. She possesses a varied repertoire with a focus on
new music and composers like Mahler, Mussorgsky, Tchaikovsky, Elgar and
Britten. She has performed world premiers of new works, notably Shouts for
Herodias: a Melodramatic Scena for solo voice, by Thomas Hyde.  Cari’s
vivid presence and singing garnered her star reviews for her London performance
of the role of Baba the Turk in Stravinsky’s “The Rake’s Progress” and Carl
Jenkins’ ‘Stabat Mater’. Cari embodies a vast repertoire of musical styles,
methods and expertise.
www.CariBurdett.com
The Money Situation
The Banff Centre has covered more then half of the tuition expenses and has given us approx $2000.00
We need now with your generous Help:
 $400/each = $800 to cover our travel in airfare to fly from Victoria to Banff. 
$120/each = $240 to get from Calgary Airport to the Banff Centre in the bus$80/each = $160 to get from the Banff Centre back to the airport ( they give artists a discount for one direction)
$600/each = $1200 to cover the remaining Tuition, Room and Board at the Banff Centre. Total = $ 2,400Where we will have a room, meals, a music studio, a musical mentor, performance opportunities in amazing state of the art theatres, recording possibilities, meeting and collaborating with other artists.. it will be AMAZING. We Thank you for your support. Check out our perks - we are excited to compose for you!!   Thank you for sharing this fundraising campaign with your networks, Facebook and friends with the Share Tools!!
We will offering a 'workshop- presentation -concert' when we return which will feature highlights and the processes we went through, including performances of our compositions.  Many thanks. 
Please feel free to ask questions - 
Cari.burdett@shaw.ca
www.Cariburdett.com
We will be uploading bits from Banff while we are there.

story:
Anthropos Arts Needs YOU

Hi! Ann Wade here, writing on behalf of Anthropos Arts, a local non-profit founded in 1998 to provide high-quality music education for low-income and at-risk students. I have had the rewarding opportunity to jump on board this year and teach for this organization, and now I ask you humbly for your help.


The Cause

For the past two months, I, Ann Wade, Elizabeth McQueen, and Sarah Sharp have been working with seventeen amazing students from Eastside Memorial and Reagan high schools, and we need your help to provide them with a LIVE BAND at our recital on Sunday, May 3rd, from 1-3 at the ABGB. 

The Impact

Your small donation can make all the difference for our dedicated students. We as teachers can do only so much to train live musicians in the classroom. The most valuable experience comes from performing with a band and an audience. We are raising a small amount, $700, to be able to pay our first class band and provide our students with this important life-changing experience. 

The Perks

Of course, the greatest "perk" is attending the performance, which is free, at the ABGB on Sunday, May 3rd, from 1-3pm. But wait, there's more!

  • Donate $50 and receive a personalized T-shirt
  • Donate $100 to have a song of your choice dedicated to you at the recital
  • Donate $200 for four lessons from one of our teachers
Low on cash? Forego those fancy coffees and tacos from the food trailer for a few days and instead donate just $10. Every dollar helps.

The Result

You cannot put a price on the live music experience here in Austin. These students deserve the joy of performance with a live band, and we would love nothing more than to be able to provide them with this. Any extra money raised will go straight to Anthropos Arts, so that we can provide even more students with lessons.

If you cannot donate money, that's OK! You CAN share this post with your friends, family, and fellow musicians. Help us get the word out!

Thank you from the bottom of our live music-loving hearts.

story:
Let’s Celebrate Larimer’s Living Legacy with a Larimer Street Festival!

Help shed light on the revitalized Pittsburgh neighborhood of Larimer by supporting a memorable, neighborhood festival, Larimer Street Festival on Saturday, August 29 from noon to 11 p.m. 

Join Larimer in celebrating the vitality of our emergent community by supporting a community day that will foster the heritage of the people who live there, African America, German, and Italian. Support the rock climbing wall, musical performances, petting zoo, yoga, pony rides, car show, face painting, dunk tank, bouncy obstacle course, parade, line dancing, movie screening, bookbag giveaways for the youth and much more. The Larimer Street Festival will foster the radical transformation for Larimer residents and Pittsburgh neighbors. 

Support the Larimer Street Festival and Be a Change Agent of the Larimer Community! LA!!!!

We need to raise at least $18,500 to provide entertainment and youth giveaways for the Larimer Street Festival and create an unforgettable experience for the Larimer Community. Your contribution will go directly to providing entertainment for the Larimer Street Festival.

The higher your level of support, the greater the level of acknowledgement during the Larimer Street Festival. Rewards range from seeing your name on the Larimer Living Legacy Board at the Festival to mentions on our social media campaigns!

In supporting the Larimer Street Festival, you will be demonstrating your support of a community that is beginning to deliver on a vision of sustainability, diversity, and community vitality.

A Larimer Street Festival

On Saturday, August 29, Larimer Street Festival will highlight the Larimer neighborhood with a community-focused, family-oriented event with live music, food, and arts and entertainment activities. The festival will use the surrounding environment to engage current and former residents, businesses, and external participants in celebrating Larimer’s storied past, dynamic present, and extraordinary future.Create a Larimer Street Festival So Memorable It Will Live In The Imagination for Years To Come

We need your help!

This is a community effort with many partners. You can help in many ways.

  • Speak about it to your friends and your social circles.
  • Email your friends or faith-based, peace & cultural organizations that could contribute. Use the “share tools” to link this effort via Facebook, Twitter, etc..
  • Come to the Larimer Street Festival on August 29.
  • Join us as a Volunteer during the festival. If you would like to contribute your time or services, let us know by contacting us at LarimerFestival@gmail.com.


    • Thank you for your support.

story:
Short Summary

The South Georgia Music Jam Benefit Concert is the first of hopefully many more to come benefit concerts in South Georgia aimed at gathering as many bands and musicians as possible in an effort to collect donations to help those friends of ours who are down on their luck.   The main goal here is accept donations and hopefully get some Sponsors that can help kick this benefit jam into gear and to keep it going on a quarterly basis.   All profits will be given to a chosen person or family that has had an unforeseen event happen in their lives.   
Here are the details for the first family this Benefit Concert will help.     This will help everyone understand the impact of the situation and the reason why we are putting on this Benefit Concert.  I want to stress this to the max.... This family has not asked us to do this nor asked for anything from us. We are doing this solely because they are our friends and as friends we felt compelled to help.  He is currently out of work and hasn't received a paycheck in a couple weeks and will not receive another paycheck until two weeks after he returns to work. At this point, the date that he will be able to return to work is not known.
Here are the main facts of what is known without going into too much detail of the incident itself. Please bare with me....
He was jumped and beaten pretty severely. Below is a detailed list of injuries.
Orbital base on both sides was broke
Broken nose
Broke jaw
Jaw is wired shut to realign his jaw
It was a stage 2 facial trauma which means his whole face was detach from the skull.
As anyone can see, this has been an extremely traumatic experience for the family as a whole. Again, they have not asked for anything. We, myself and many, many other friends and bands from the entire southern region of Georgia felt compelled to help this family because they are friends to us and have supported our band in the past. That is a very important thing within the musician community.

No further details will be presented about the incident itself out of respect for the family and their privacy.   

What We Need & What You Get

  • the main thing we need is contributions to help offset the financial needs of the family we are helping.
  • secondly, we need funds to help pay for the property being rented
  • Insurance is expensive and is needed to cover any unfortunate accidents that may happen at this event or any future events.
  • the entrance amount for this benefit is $5 for General Admission.     There will be V.I.P. tickets for $10.   V.I.P. tickets will allow those ticket holders to hang out with the bands and enter the sectioned off area set aside for band members only.
  • All funds will be used solely for the purpose of the South Georgia Music Jam Benefit Concert.

The Impact

The main impact will the fact that a family will benefit for the hard work and dedication of all involved.      
 

Risks & Challenges

   The main risk here is not collecting the needed amount to cover the initial costs of this Benefit concert.    That is why it is so important for everyone to contribute.   The second biggest risk is that of having an accidend.   This where the need for insurance comes in.  

Other Ways You Can Help

  
  • SPONSORS are a way to help and all major sponsors will get the name of their Business or Company on the Posters for this Benefit Jam.
