story:
Our story- ”Where the Old meets the New”

Hi! Thanks for taking some time to read about us!  

We are INTERNATIONAL OPERA PROJECTS, a company dedicated to providing performance opportunities for emerging talent, as well as serve as a platform for contemporary composers to have their works performed. Inspired by the phrase, "Where the Old meets the New”, we wish to emphasize the importance of the traditional operatic repertoire, while, at the same time, introduce new, innovative and emotionally driven operatic stage pieces!  

Over the years opera has been thought of as something out of reach for many people, and its relevance has even been questioned. We are here to add our voices to the change that is starting to take place in this world know as the performing arts! So, we urge you to step inside, take a look, consider making a donation or perhaps attend a show!

July 2016 kicks off our first summer festival for this emerging company! With a terrific cast and staff in place and a fabulous venue in which to perform, we want to ensure that this reaches the height of success that we know is attainable!  

This summer we will produce two operas, a visually stunning reduced version of Mozart’s Cosi Fan Tutte and the provocative and musically stunning As One by the superb artistic team of Laura Kaminsky (composer), Mark Campbell (co-librettist) & Kimberly Reed (co-librettist & film maker).

We are also very excited to announce that INTERNATIONAL OPERA PROJECTS was chosen to produce the European premiere of As One. This now hit opera has made the rounds to various opera houses in the U.S. such as; American Opera Projects, Washington Opera, West Edge Opera and in 2017 will be seen at Seattle Opera!! We want to get the word out and we ask you to consider joining us on this awesome, powerful and inspiring journey!

Partner or Attend...

Here’s the thing… 
We need your help! We have generated a lot of interest but cannot rely on ticket sales alone for income and more importantly longevity! Financial stability is the key to make things happen, and we know we have something special to offer. We would like to raise 12,000 euros to help defray some extra costs that have arisen.  

This is what we have done thus far for this summer’s festival:

  • Assembled a fine cast of singers, stage directors, conductors, costume designers as well as stage and technical crew!   
  • Secured a venue (the Ballsaal Studio in Berlin http://www.ballsaal- studio.com/)   


  • Published a website  www.internationaloperaprojects.com
  • Developed a stage design and concept that will serve both operas completely as it is versatile, streamlined and innovative!
  •  Secured the rights, video and other media funded for the European premiere of As One by generous donors of American Opera Projects who premiered the piece in 2014 (Music and concept by Laura Kaminsky, Libretto by Mark Campbell and Kimberly Reed &Film by Kimberly Reed)    


Be Our Breath Support...

When we make our goal, we will be able to add rehearsal time for our strings, pay the talented artists more money, hire a fantastic photographer to capture every moment, do more PR and advertising and basically ensure that all financial responsibilities are met for this season. It could also support the opportunity for future festivals!

There are some extremely AWESOME perks if you decide to contribute. For example, a ticket to a performance, an autographed program from the entire cast and crew, a personalized video shout out from the cast thanking you for the generosity and support, a VIP ticket for opening night that includes a champagne toast and chance to meet the artistic team behind As One or get a behind the scenes peek (attend a dress rehearsal and talk to the artists).

The Big Picture...

IOP was created to give more opportunities to emerging and professional artists alike. In today’s world of diminishing funding for the arts, our goal is to created a new spin on opera which could ideally become another established vehicle for a new wave of operatic performances. 

Risks & Challenges...

There isn’t much time before June 20th is upon us (the start of rehearsals) and there is still much to be done. We know that raising money isn’t always easy, but we do have a team of hard working and talented individuals who are eager to be a part of this new project. Some want to gain exposure and experience while others are excited to perform in Berlin!


Other Ways You Can Help...

We do understand that you may not be able to contribute financially, but here’s how you can help us:

   •   Invite friends and colleagues to Like us on Facebook or visit the website        
 at www.internationaloperaprojects.com
   •   Share this Indiegogo campaign on Facebook or simply email it to a friend who you think might be interested!

Thank you for reading and sharing!!!!

story:
Salsa-R-Us

We are N&Y: A Salsa band based in Cali - Colombia - South America.

Since February 2009 we are playing with a new style of Salsa with a unique identity because our music is characterized by the union of contemporary musical arrangements and romantic lyrics, with some pop, rock and jazz elements, that invites Salsa fans to listen, to dance and to fell in love with the rythm of our percussion.

We've been playing for 5 year on local bars and in "Feria de Cali" events: a traditional festival that every December turns out our city in The World Capital of Salsa!

Our foreign friends always notice the footprint of rock and pop on lead vocals and are always very pleased to feel closer to the sensations that Latin music have, through the musical arrangements with touches of jazz in our songs.

"Nacimos Rumberos" (We Were Born to Party) has been downloaded in countries like Spain, USA, Argentina, Perú, Ecuador, France, Italy, Canada, etc., and put us in the map of new Salsa bands in the world.


What We Dream

Right now we want to record our second album "Delicious", a perfect word to describe what Salsa is, comparing it with the actual food meaning of "sauce": a mix of different flavors to excite your senses.

"Delicious" is going to be a real hit on Salsa scene, because we want to add colours from all over the world to our sound, especially from USA and Europe.

Our goal is to earn a space in your playlist next to your favorite artists from other music styles. Even if you don't mind to get a single word of Spanish, if we make you move and dance, we´ll be more than happy!!!


What We Neeeeed

We are looking to raise $ 18,000 to record a 7 songs  Salsa album. We need to pay for rehearse hours (between 10 and 12) in an environment free of noise, studio hours in a very good place set to record Salsa, the time of 12 musicians to rehearse and record each instrument, the sound engineer, the mixing, the mastering, CD art design and duplication. So this is how your support will go toward:

* $2,000 - Rehearsing hours (both place and payment for 12 musicians)

* $3,500 - Studio hours

* $3,500 - Musicians

* $5,000 - Mixing & Mastering

* $2,000 - CD art design and duplication

* $1,000 - Media promotion

* $500 - Photo and video registration for the recording process of "Delicious"

* $500 - Legal, registration of the new songs, shipment of rewards, food,       transportation and other unforeseen expenses.


What You Get

You're gonna get the coolest perks!  

We´ll write a piano-voice song just for you about any subject you want, from any words or musical ideas you have.  If you don´t have any, let us know something relevant about you and we´ll write a nice new song just for you.

Also, if you donate our highest, we´ll do the same but with full score arrangements.

You can choose between a rock, pop, salsa or string quartet version of your idea.


Other Ways You Can "Dance" With Us

Talk about us!!!

Spread the rumor that there's a new Salsa band in town and tell your friends we sound awesome!!!

DANCE.  Dance a lot with our music and smile.  Play our songs on YouTube, dance and don´t stop 'till you get enought!!!

* $500 - Legal, registration of the new songs, shipment of rewards, food,       transportation and other unforeseen expenses.

   What You Get 
You're gonna get the coolest perks!  
We´ll write a piano-voice song just for you about any subject you want, from any words or musical ideas you have.  If you don´t have any, let us know something relevant about you and we´ll write a nice new song just for you.
Also, if you donate our highest, we´ll do the same but with full score arrangements.
You can choose between a rock, pop, salsa or string quartet version of your idea.



 
  

Other Ways You Can "Dance" With Us
Talk about us!!!


Spread the rumor that there's a new Salsa band in town and tell your friends we sound awesome!!!


DANCE.  Dance a lot with our music and smile.  Play our songs on YouTube, dance and don´t stop 'till you get enought!!!

story:
I have dreamed of recording my first album ever since I was a little girl, 

and I am so excited that time has finally come. This past year I have been overwhelmed with the need to write new music, and I've focused on songwriting as well as exploring different forms for improvisation. The music on "Chapter One" will be as diverse as my influences, blending unaccompanied improvisations, sultry vocal, fiery jazz, and funky grooves into a record that paints a picture of who I've become as an artist. I have brought together a wonderful group of musicians for this project, and I can't wait to share our sounds with you! 

We have a great plan set out, which will begin with a three-day recording session this June at Water Music Recorders in Hoboken, New Jersey. You can learn more about the studio here:  http://www.watermusic.net/ From there we will go on to mix and master "Chapter One." and we have a great photographer, graphic designer, and illustrator on board to help package the final product and give us all the tools we'll need to market it to the world. 

I need your help to make this project possible! 


Your donation will help offset the cost of recording, mixing, mastering, CD production, graphic design, illustration, photography, and marketing expenses. Any additional  funds from this campaign will be used to help us with an album release tour, which we are hoping to do sometime in the fall/winter of 2015.  

I thank those who have encouraged me to follow my dreams, which have gotten me this far. Writing music for this album has been an amazing experience, and I can't wait to see how everything unfolds. Thank YOU for your contribution to this project, and stay tuned as we get underway with recording! 
Much love,
Alison

story:
"Thrown Away" is a song about how painful it can be to feel unseen. The money raised will go towards equipment (cameras, lighting, sound, etc) as well as to pay actors to portray specific groups of people who can feel this way (Veterans, people who cannot hear, etc). We plan on shooting it with very dramatic lighting, focusing completely on showcasing the story!

If you're kind enough to donate, we will put your name in the credits of the music video, as well as send you a high resolution copy of the final product free of charge!

For a contribution of $25 or more, we will also mail you a copy, along with the mp3 and a signed photo!

Feel free to check out Michelle on Twitter (@michellessong), www.michellemarieanderson.com and www.truestlewis.com

Thank you for your consideration and support!

story:
Short Summary

Chicago based music group Deep Fayed is heading into the studio to record their first album. Bringing in familiar and new names to the project, Deep Fayed is excited to give listeners a vast and exciting new work. While diving deeper into their unique, and genre-bending sound, the four-piece group continues to fuse Hip-Hop, Rock and Jazz music. As the project progresses you will be updated on who Deep Fayed is working with in the studio, detailed artist profiles, behind the scenes session videos and much more! 
Musicians: George Wundsam (guitar), Matt Wilson (bass), Chresten Hyde (kit), Cole DeGenova (keys) and Binkey (mc) + more features TBA shortly! 

It's an exciting time for the Fayed crew and we want to make this album an amazing experience for our fans. Thank you for showing your support over the years and please help us continue making music! 

Before our our new music drops check out our EP from 2013, streaming FREE on spotify and soundcloud! https://soundcloud.com/deep-fayed/sets/deep-fay...

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need your help! In 2013 we self-funded all production for our debut, six-song EP. For or next album we are asking you, our fan, to donate and help us finish our first full length studio album.
  • When you donate you will automatically receive the digital album when it is finished. It's just like a pre-order! There are also many other perks to choose from in addition.
  • We want our fans to get the best sounding product possible! We have an amazing team working together on this project. We've got our studio time booked, but we need your help to finish the album. When you donate, all proceeds go towards production costs to finish the album. 

Please spread the word and share this campaign your friends! Thank you.

story:
A demonic carnival inhabited with possessed clowns welcomes you...

What is Carnival of horrors?

Carnival of horrors is a horror soundtrack like no other. It will take horror music in a new darker direction that has not been heard before. This music is designed to be used in games, horror films and haunts. We guarantee that you will be shocked, suprised and more importantly scared. The album is a concept album that tells the story of a journey to an evil Carnival. It will take the listener on mint journey to hell. With clowns! 

We have released 4 halloween albums so far and each one has touched on the theme of a dark carnival. This new album will be a new collection of the darkest, scariest carnival music possible. We want to push the boundaries of horror music further by experimenting with soundscapes, samples and new techniques. We will also be collaborating with other great artists in the UK Horror Scene and looking to work with local talent to create a mini horror video to accomany the release. With your help we can make this project happen.

Here are links to some of our carnival themed songs so far:

https://soundcloud.com/sam-haynes-halloween/scary-carnival-music-new-music-for-halloween-2014-freakshow


https://soundcloud.com/sam-haynes-halloween/carnival-sam-haynes-vs

Why should I back the project?

If you love halloween and horror and want to help me take the carnival theme into new, exciting and dark territory then please support the project. in return you will get exclusive stuff that will not be available anywhere else. We have been fortunate enough to receive excellent reviews fromt he horror haunt community and really want to deliver something different with this album. My goal is to make the 'Citizen Kane' of carnival music.

What will successful funding mean?

Professionally designed artwork is a must. This album needs to look and sound awesome, and so do the T shirts! We also want to make a great video to support the project and get professionally pressed CD's. Your contributions will also mean we can spend more time during the production and recording process.

How can I help?

You can make a huge difference to getting the project completed. The most important thing you can do to help is to back us, and share this project we have some great supporter rewards, check them out and grab something special from our list!

Thanks,

Sam Haynes

www.hauntmusic.co.uk

story:
Help the SNP to win Berwickshire, Roxburgh & Selkirk by donating to the Berwickshire, Roxburgh and Selkirk SNP Election Fighting Fund

This year the SNP can win Berwickshire, Roxburgh & Selkirk, where we've had Paul Wheelhouse as a great South of Scotland SNP MSP - but where, since 1997, Michael Moore (LibDem) has offered no defence against the Tory government he joined. Once more, people need to keep the Tories out – and that , despite his attempt at camouflage, is John Lamont. We know that Calum Kerr,for the SNP, will really represent the folk who live here.  Now we need your help with the campaign to get Calum elected to work for us all.

What We Need & What You Get

We aim to raise enough to make our presence visible in all our communities and to get out the information so everyone can see the real benefit of voting SNP, so we can elect Calum Kerr - a Borders MP who'll focus on our whole constituency, towns and villages, farmlands and fishing ports, businesses and colleges.  He's got plans for boosting our area with the creation and promotion of Scottish Borders - The Brand - at last an MP to make  Berwickshire, Roxburgh & Selkirk really count.

If we raise more money than our target, we’ll just be able to do a better job, building an SNP team in Berwickshire, Roxburgh & Selkirk to work for all the Borders.

The Impact

Berwickshire, Roxburgh & Selkirk is a huge area and it will make a real difference to have a campaign budget that allows us to reach every part of the constituency.  We need premises, publicity materials, leaflets and much, much more.  To run this winning campaign, we need to raise funds, which is where you come in…

Risks & Challenges

Michael Moore's majority looks set to crumble - but we need to help it on its way. We need to make sure that the thousands of voters disappointed by Moore's Westminster government, get the chance to see how Calum Kerr and the SNP can work successfully for their futures here in the Borders.  We need your support to make that certain - by electing an MP for a Better Borders in a Stronger Scotland - Calum Kerr, a real voice for our communities.  Please give us your help.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know everyone can’t be in a position to contribute, but we’d still appreciate your active support.  If you’re local, please come and help us campaign, and if you’re further afield, please share our page, and our social media campaign pages.

story:
Short Summary

Hey everyone!  Thanks for clicking through to our Indiegogo campaign.

Christian from Transvaal Diamond Syndicate here.  I've probably met most of you over the last 6 years of hectic touring.  The band has chalked up some 250,000kms and done close to 1000 all-original gigs!  For those of you we haven't met... WELCOME.

We're looking to raise enough money over the next 40 days to help pay for our brand new double EP to be released later this year.  This project is a different one for us.  We're actually going to acknowledge the different influences within the band and release a Blues-focused EP and a Riff-Rock-focused EP.  Until now we've been hitting you somewhere in the middle!

This will see us travel down to Sydney to record the Rockier EP with Daniel Antix (Gay Paris) at the new Def Wolf Studios and team up with Phil Graham (Head of Music QUT) at Gasworks Studio in Brisbane for the Bluesy EP.

A double EP/album is an expensive exercise, one that ideally we'd fund ourselves, but with all this touring and endless driving we basically come home to empty pockets.  We've never asked for help before but feel that this is the right time to involve our fans, friends and family.

The project will cost us around $15,000 all up, we're hoping to raise $10,000 with help from you legends.

    Of course you'll get something rad in return!  We have a range of rewards and experiences on offer which will certainly make it worth your while.


    What We Need

    The specific budget breakdown for our new release is something like this:

    • RECORDING AND MIXING - $7500
    • MASTERING - $1500
    • PRESSING - $1500
    • VINYL - $2500
    • MERCHANDISE (Tees and Caps) - $500
    • PUBLICITY AND PROMOTION - $1500
    • TOTAL: $15,000

    We're hoping to raise at least 10k of the total to mix with our band savings and make this bad boy a reality!

    Any excess money raised will go towards extra publicity and promotions along with postage costs associated with the rewards and the travel costs involved in recording.

    If we don't make our target we will pool what money we have into getting just the first EP part-recorded.


    What You Get

    Different levels of contribution get different levels of reward.

    You can buy the double EP with a digital download or step it up and order it on vinyl (we're excited about this).  Maybe you want a live gig at your house or you want Juzzy to cook you dinner (he's done that for some of you already haha).  Maybe you want to splash out and purchase one of the guitars used by the band or buy a unique portrait of one of the band members by a renowned artist...

    We've tried to put fair $ amounts next to all of the rewards so it's wins all 'round. 


    The Impact

    For the last 6 years we've been releasing and touring material around Australia.  In that time we've:

    • regularly featured in the top 10 most requested tracks on Australian community radio (AMRAP)
    • had 4 songs played on Triple J
    • Been in the Top 10 singles charts on iTunes (Blues)
    • Won 'Song of the Year' award at the QLD Blues Awards
    • Top 5 at the MusicOz Awards (Blues and Roots)
    • Won an Independent Music Award (Blues Song Category)
    • Taken out 4 top 20 slots on 4ZzZ annual Hot 100 List
    • Had a bunch of 4 and 5 star album reviews (inc. Sydney Morning Herald, The Courier Mail, Zoo Magazine, The Music)

    So I guess we know what we're doing is relevant and people are vibing off it... Otherwise we probably would have stopped ages ago!  You guys give us constant feedback to keep us motivated.  High fives all 'round.

    We know that this release will be our best and most expansive work yet and we're really pumped to start the recording process and get the finished product into your hands and ears.  Every $ you help us with honestly goes straight into the direct expenses involved in the project.

    We have 2 x 6week tours planned with a bunch of dates through QLD, NSW, VIC, WA and NT (first trip to WA and NT!) for the rest of the year including a few festival shows.  We'd love to hit the road with a new double-release to show you.


      Risks & Challenges

      For those of you who've met us on the road, fed us, put us up, bought us a beer or two... you'll know that we live pretty thin.  Touring for the last 5 years around Australia has been awesome.  We've met so many amazing people who will be mates for life.  But the reality is that all this touring leaves us full of stories but with empty wallets.  It's a challenge for us when we return from tour and have to fish around for work and try and get back to a 'normal' way of living after spending some 10 months on the road per year in the past.  We made a decision a while back that music and connecting with people was to come first but this is a daily struggle as the Arts don't pay much.

      The reality is that it's like that for most of your favourite bands.  We all toil away behind the scenes, living thin and wearing ourselves out in the name of Australian Music.  You guys usually only see us when we hit your local and it's all fun and games, but times that by 10mths of the year for at least 5 years and it can be a big challenge to stay motivated/healthy and in some sort of positive financial position.

      We're hoping you can help us get this project off the ground so we can visit you with something new reeeaallll soon.


      Other Ways You Can Help

      We know not everyone has enough money for a new album but there are a couple of other ways you can help out:

      • Share our campaign link through your social media pages
      • Tell ya mates!


      Pictures of the Prizes

      TDS TEE (S - 3XL) $40


      PENRITH PANTHERS SIGNED JERSEY $350


      TDS SIGNED FENDER RESONATOR $700


      TDS CUSTOM CRUISER (CUSTOM-MADE STREET CRUISER) $600


      BRAND THE TDS EXPRESS $1500


      TDS THE ARTWORK $1500


      THANKYOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!  GYSO



      www.transvaaldiamondsyndicate.com

      For further enquiry please email bookings@beatscartel.com

      #liveandoriginal

story:
Who Are We?


El Café de las Seis, is a seven-piece group that loves to create music and tell a story through it. There's been a lot of debate between the band members when it comes to name the genre that predominates in our compositions (we play with elements of funk, soul, jazz and our own influences), but lately we think that shouldn't be limits in what to use to express ourselves and be heard.


The last year, we started to record our first full-length album, putting all our effort and love in what we do, and despite the circumstances that imply to live in our country these days, we are really close to fulfill our goal, and hopefully, with your help, we'll make it happen.


Check our Soundcloud profile for more music and follow us on Twitter and Instagram!!


The band:

Luís (Tenor Sax)
Henry (Clarinet, Tenor Sax)
Ángel (Drums)
Jhensy (Voice, Keys)
Elías (Guitar)
José (Guitar)
Yhousel (Bass)

What we need, what you get


After making some numbers, we estimated a minimal of 1200$, in order to finish all the process of: 

  • Studio rental and recording
  • Mixing and Mastering
  • Art work
  • Physical reproduction

This will be enough to finish a 10 track album, the result of 2 years of writing, producing and rehearsal.


For us & for you!!


This album will not be possible without your help, so every person who makes a contribution will be listed in the credits and, depending on the perk of your choosing, your photo will appear on the album as well!!!


The reason


With a professional quality album in our hands, we could share with the world what we love doing.

Most of the band members have a professional career that differs from music, but we've found true inspiration since the first time we started making music together, and now we've decided to follow our dream, and make it happen. 



Our Rewards


Feel free to check out Jhensy's poetry blog here,

and her publications on a digital magazine on this link.



Risk & Challenges


Through experience, we have learnt that, the recording process itself usually brings up setbacks, that could delay a little the release date, but we are determined to complete our goal, and take our music as far as possible.

What represents a major risk, for us as an independent band, is that every expense made is coming out of our pockets. If we don't reach our goal, we will have to cut some things out of the budget, and yet deliver a product with the best possible quality, and faithful to our sound.


Share, comment, spread the word!


-  Share this campaign to your contacts, make use of Indiegogo's tools.

-  Spread the word about our music.

-  Share our music between your musicians friends.


Thank you so much for your time and support!



¿Quiénes Somos?


El Café de las Seis, es una banda de siete personas que disfrutan el hacer música y contar una historia a través de ella. Siempre ha existido un debate entre los integrantes cuando se trata de definir el género musical que predomina en nuestras composiciones (nos gusta mezclar elementos del funk, soul, jazz junto con las influencias de todos), pero al final todos estamos de acuerdo en que no debe haber ningún límite a la hora de expresarnos y ser escuchados.

El año, pasado comenzamos a grabar nuestro primer álbum, poniendo todo nuestro empeño y corazón en lo que hacemos, y a pesar de todas las dificultades que presenta el país en la actualidad, estamos muy cerca de completar nuestra meta, y con un poco de suerte y con tu ayuda, podremos hacerlo realidad.

En nuestro Soundcloud encontraras más de nuestra música, también puedes seguirnos por Instagram y Twitter!


Lo que necesitamos, lo que obtienes


Luego de varios cálculos, estimamos una cantidad mínima de 1200$ para completar todos los procesos de:

·  Alquiler del estudio y grabación

·  Mezcla y Masterización

·  Arte Gráfico

·  Reproducción Física

Este monto cubrirá todos los gastos para terminar un álbum de 10 temas, el resultado de 2 años de escritura, producción y ensayo.


Para nosotros y para ti


Este disco será posible sólo con tu ayuda, así que todas las personas que contribuyan serán nombradas en los créditos y, dependiendo de la recompensa que elijas, tu foto también podrá aparecer dentro del disco.


La razón


Con un álbum de calidad profesional en nuestras podríamos mostrarle al mundo lo que disfrutamos hacer.

La mayoría de los miembros de la banda poseen carreras profesionales que difieren del ámbito musical, pero hemos encontrado inspiración y un motivo en nuestra vida desde la primera vez que comenzamos a hacer música juntos, y hemos decidido seguir nuestro sueño y hacerlo realidad.


Lo que ofrecemos



Puedes ver el blog de poesía de Jhensy aquí,

y sus publicaciones en una revista digital en este enlace.



Riesgos y Desafíos


Por experiencia, hemos aprendido que al momento de grabar siempre pueden presentarse imprevistos, y esto puede retrasar un poco la fecha de entrega, pero estamos comprometidos a completar nuestra meta y llevar nuestra música lo más lejos posible.

Lo que representa un riesgo de gran magnitud para nosotros como banda independiente, es que cada gasto realizado sale directamente de nuestro bolsillo. Si no completamos la meta, tendremos que recortar el presupuesto, y aún así entregar un producto de la mejor calidad posible y que se mantenga fiel a nuestro sonido.


¡Comparte, comenta y difunde la palabra!


 ¡Ayúdanos a hacer ruido en las redes!


-  Comparte esta campaña, usa las herramientas de Indiegogo.

-  Corre la voz sobre nuestra música.

-  Comparte nuestra música con tus amigos músicos.


 ¡Muchas gracias por tu tiempo y por tu apoyo!

story:
Hi,

I'm so glad you are here. I have been working tirelessly for the past four years on this music and I'm so excited to share it with you. 

"Book of Hours" began as a five movement piece based on the history and text of the Latin Mass Ordinary. Originally entitled "Mass for Modern Ensemble," it premiered at Meany Hall in Seattle, WA in 2014 with a nine piece chamber ensemble of two trumpets, tenor and alto saxophone, bass clarinet, violin, drums, and guitar. 

A year later, it went through a transition to accommodate the instruments of a new trio featuring guitar, rhodes, and drums. "Miserere Nobis" was performed extensively as a trio, featuring more improvisation and an emphasis on mixing genres of Jazz, Rock, and Contemporary Classical music. 

This music, yet again, went through another phase to include bass. This would be the final instrumentation of the project, though the music would soon be extended by the inclusion of three new pieces entitled "Book of Hours," originally a solo guitar piece, reorchestrated for quartet. 

 

Which brings us to the present moment, where you come in.

 

What We Need & What You Get

For this record I've decided to self release, without the help or support of a label. This gives me total artistic control over the look, feel, and sound of the record, and where it will travel to, live and in record stores.

But it comes at a heavier cost. 

We are attempting to raise $3,500 to complete this record. What your generous contribution goes toward is album design, manufacturing CDs, publicity and representation from top notch artist management, and an East/West Coast tour with the band in support of the record. 

In exchange for your help, we are offering some fun and exciting perks, including physical and digital copies of the record, physical and digital copies of my previous two studio records, credits printed on the album, songs and compositions dedicated and recorded for you, and other neat stuff. 

The Impact

This is my first time crowdfunding in support of my music. I have been very fortunate to have been able to release my last two records with the support of labels and benefactors, but because this album means so much to me, I've decided to try and release it on my own and see it through to the very end. 

With your help, you are not only supporting me but the dozens of other artists related to this project, who continue to play, design, record, compose, and write about music. You are contributing to the beautiful eco-system of the arts. 

Risks & Challenges

There are no guarantees in art. Musicians like myself continue to do what we do because we feel compelled to bring beauty into the world, even if it is to the detriment of our own financial and mental well-being. We put everything on the line to put notes on a page. In spite of the Risks & Challenges we face, we continue to empty ourselves into the music, in hopes that we can share it with you and the world. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate any way in which you can help; sharing this with a friend, letting them know that there's new and exciting music heading there way, a bed to sleep in or a hot meal while we're on road, or a simple note of encouragement.

Keep in touch! And thanks for listening.

story:
WHAT IS STEAM DOWN TV?

Steam Down TV is a live remix concept happening on July 18th! We have an intimate preview performance for those STEAM DREAMERS on July 12th. Steam Down TV reworks an artist's music live on stage, exploring soundsystem culture alongside live musical performance. For the first episode Brother Portrait, a member of Steam Down and an amazing artist, will grace the stage reworking his music with a live band.

WHY SUPPORT US?

Steam Down flourishes through the support of its extended family - you! We rely on the reciprocation of giving-energy from everyone who shows up and share our events, projects and art. Steam Down isn't just another live music night, the audience is an integral part of all our performances and work. You bring the positive vibes and energy, we return that with sonic jams and authentic intimate experiences. The astral journey that we are heading on needs a crew. We need you!

We want to raise £1500 to pay every single person involved in our first Steam Down TV episode (from the performers to the person typing this up right now!), all the equipment and other expenses. Our ambitions are greater than faraway galaxies and this is just one step closer to achieving our goals.

For Steam Down TV, whatever you gift is returned with a gift in exchange... From exclusive access to Steam Down TV's first episode, a super intimate 3D binaural filming of a pre-show rehearsal to tickets to the live filming!

Here's a little break down of all the great things you can claim if you choose to support us...

STEAM VISION gives you full access to the entire Steam Down TV Brother Portrait episode. Only one song of the full performance will be available on video streaming platforms. Add another £2 to your donation and you can stream the entire performance live from wherever you are in the world with STEAM STREAM! You also get to take part in the Q and A with Brother Portrait. 3D STEAM gives you exclusive access to a 3D binaural film of a song from the rehearsals of Steam Down TV. You will be transported into the centre of the action - as the camera moves so does the sound. Surrounded by musicians, you will experience the most intimate of filmed music performance.

STEAM DOWN LIVE VISION gives you an audience ticket to the Brother Portrait Remix performance on 18th July. Filming takes place at a secret location and your presence is essential… we need your energy, vibes and moves to make our first ever filming a success!

STEAM DREAM not only provides a Steam Down TV ticket to the live performance but also an exclusive audience ticket to an intimate preview performance at the collective's rehearsal space on the evening 12th July!

WHAT IS STEAM DOWN?

If you haven't heard of us, it's a pleasure to meet you. If you have, thank you for returning. Steam Down is an artist collective, weekly event and music community based in Deptford, South-East London.

Founded by Ahnanse in May 2017, the intial event was created to connect London based musicians and producers. Since then it has evolved in to a weekly event where the Steam Down artists and extended musical family generate spontaneous sonic soundscapes and grooves reflecting their lives in the city.

Peace and love

P.S. Steam Down TV will be filmed at a secret location. If you claim the Steam Live Vision or the Steam Dream perks, we will email you the location details shortly before the event. The same follows for the Steam Dream intimate preview performance.

story:
Scott Garred Self-Titled LP

I've just finished a new album and it's time to get it in your hands and on to your turn tables. Please help me send it off to the record pressing plant. Consider this a pre-sale.

Why

While I do feel that every album I make is worth sharing, I don't necessarily feel that every album I make is worthy of the best possible format, which in my opinion is the LP. This one is worthy for many reasons.

This album features sounds I've used before but never quite like this. Every sound has a purpose. A guitar or ukulele may provide the basic structure but what makes each song come to life is left to the piano, drums, bass, distorted bass, melodica, vintage Casio keyboards, and vocal harmonies.

Collaborating with me on this album is Kelly Atkins. She's quite a fixture in the Bay Area music scene (perhaps you know Kitka or 20 Minute Loop?) She can make her voice sound like buzzing insects swarming around your head. Perhaps you like the theremin or the singing saw? She does it all folks.

My hope is that these songs will inspire you to think deeply about some of the world's issues. Walk in the shoes of a mass shooter. Shake hands with artificial intelligence. Think about climate change the same way you think about your own mother with dementia. 

What's needed

Through this campaign I'm hoping to raise money to manufacture the LPs and mail them to supporters. I am not asking for any financial assistance in producing the music. That part is done.

The reality is this album will never be in a local store. This is our shot people. Let's do it.

Goal: 

1. 250 LPs manufactured with beautiful artwork including full color printing, high quality sounds, and a protective poly bag.

Approximate cost: $2000

2. Limited run of 50 CDs. 

Approximate cost: $120                                                                                                                           

3. Shipping and handling costs so that each item can be shipped safely and efficiently to your door.                                                                                                                                                             

Approximate cost: $280

4. Each contribution big or small comes with a digital download of the album plus all the outtakes and alternate versions during the making of this project.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your friends. Even if you can't help financially, it makes a big difference just to spread the word. And if you have pledged, please encourage someone you know to do the same. 

If we don't make it

If we don't reach the goal then we don't make the physical products. That's all. No major crisis. It means you'll have to wait and catch it on Spotify or Apple Music or wherever you listen these days. And you'll get your money back.

story:
Greetings!

Hello Friends,

Thank you for visiting our site and for considering helping us toward our goal of releasing our new album on vinyl.

Who We Are

We are pianist Jed Wilson and drummer Tony Falco, old friends and collaborators who first met when were studying jazz at New England Conservatory. At NEC, we recognized a strong affinity but lost touch in the years after graduation as we traveled different geographical and musical roads. Jed played in jazz and singer-songwriter settings, most notably with acclaimed vocalist Heather Masse. Tony honed his skills as an improviser, including with avant-garde legend Tisziji Muñoz.

More recently, we found ourselves each living in the wilds of New England. We got in contact and began recording together. The resumption of our collaboration first resulted in the 2015 trio release Traces, with bassist Aryeh Kobrinsky. In 2019 we decided to continue our exploration of the creative possibilities of free improvisation by paring things down to the duo format.

This Album

Recorded in one day at Acadia Recording Company in Portland, Maine, this album was totally improvised. We entered each new piece without plans or preconceptions. To our pleasant surprise, all kinds of unique structures and shapes emerged, moments both poignant and playful, tempestuous and tender. Listening back, we were so enamored with what spontaneously occurred in the open space of improvisation that we want to share the totality of that day's work with you all. We decided to call it Illumine in order to reflect the experience of a flash of light or inspiration—that uncanny experience in which the terrain of the known is briefly transcended and something unprecedented emerges.
 

Why Vinyl?

It's undeniable: vinyl is experiencing a renaissance, and for good reason. Like most vinyl enthusiasts, we cherish the medium for its warmth and fullness of sound. Additionally, in our digital age, vinyl's nostalgic physicality is pleasing. Who doesn't love placing the disc on the turntable, hearing the needle meet the record's surface, and reveling in that famous "crackle"? And then there is the joy of holding the album as you listen, experiencing the cover art as an extension of the music. We are believers in the magic of vinyl, and feel that this recording was meant to be experienced in this special way.

Digital

We're not Luddites, though. We certainly understand the appeal of digital. And for that reason, this album will be available for download or streaming in high-quality digital.
 

Your Support

In order for us to present Illumine in the vinyl format, we'll need your support. For those who can help by pre-ordering your own vinyl double-LP, we are most grateful. Even if you do not own a turntable and glaze over when you hear us wax poetic (pun intended) about the vinyl format, your pre-order of a digital copy can help toward this goal. We've provided different tiers of support which include special perks as a token of our thanks. We hope you'll consider helping us out, and we thank you in advance for doing so. May you enjoy listening to Illumine as much as we delighted in making it.
story_txt:
Greetings!
Hello Friends,
Thank you for visiting our site and for considering helping us toward our goal of releasing our new album on vinyl.

Who We Are
We are pianist Jed Wilson and drummer Tony Falco, old friends and collaborators who first met when were studying jazz at New England Conservatory. At NEC, we recognized a strong affinity but lost touch in the years after graduation as we traveled different geographical and musical roads. Jed played in jazz and singer-songwriter settings, most notably with acclaimed vocalist Heather Masse. Tony honed his skills as an improviser, including with avant-garde legend Tisziji Muñoz.
More recently, we found ourselves each living in the wilds of New England. We got in contact and began recording together. The resumption of our collaboration first resulted in the 2015 trio release Traces, with bassist Aryeh Kobrinsky. In 2019 we decided to continue our exploration of the creative possibilities of free improvisation by paring things down to the duo format.
This Album
Recorded in one day at Acadia Recording Company in Portland, Maine, this album was totally improvised. We entered each new piece without plans or preconceptions. To our pleasant surprise, all kinds of unique structures and shapes emerged, moments both poignant and playful, tempestuous and tender. Listening back, we were so enamored with what spontaneously occurred in the open space of improvisation that we want to share the totality of that day's work with you all. We decided to call it Illumine in order to reflect the experience of a flash of light or inspiration—that uncanny experience in which the terrain of the known is briefly transcended and something unprecedented emerges. 
Why Vinyl?
It's undeniable: vinyl is experiencing a renaissance, and for good reason. Like most vinyl enthusiasts, we cherish the medium for its warmth and fullness of sound. Additionally, in our digital age, vinyl's nostalgic physicality is pleasing. Who doesn't love placing the disc on the turntable, hearing the needle meet the record's surface, and reveling in that famous "crackle"? And then there is the joy of holding the album as you listen, experiencing the cover art as an extension of the music. We are believers in the magic of vinyl, and feel that this recording was meant to be experienced in this special way.
Digital
We're not Luddites, though. We certainly understand the appeal of digital. And for that reason, this album will be available for download or streaming in high-quality digital. Your SupportIn order for us to present Illumine in the vinyl format, we'll need your support. For those who can help by pre-ordering your own vinyl double-LP, we are most grateful. Even if you do not own a turntable and glaze over when you hear us wax poetic (pun intended) about the vinyl format, your pre-order of a digital copy can help toward this goal. We've provided different tiers of support which include special perks as a token of our thanks. We hope you'll consider helping us out, and we thank you in advance for doing so. May you enjoy listening to Illumine as much as we delighted in making it.

story:
Short Summary

I think that music has the power to unite people and is a medium for communication, which can have a positive impact on human consciousness and our behavior as a species.

Over the past three years I’ve invested over $20,000 developing, recording and releasing the music I make and I have found that the existing business models are not viable for the type of music that I make and the way that I make it.

In our day-to-day lives, music is one of the elements that determine the kind of trance states we inhabit and we change from one to another as we are exposed to different types of music; and yes, music can have a therapeutic impact as well.

I am not and do not intend to be held captive to genre or trends. I do not want to be told how I should think or dress or act on stage.

I don’t like the way that most record labels promote only what they call “mainstream” music. I want the music I make to be promoted by those who like it.

So I give you my latest creation ‘Death Of An Avatar’


For Those Who Don't Know Me:

I collaborated on ‘The Day That Never Was’, a live triple album now being reworked as an opera.

Together We May See

The Second Horseman – Pollution And Global Climate Change

http://youtu.be/nMQcSiU1en0

The Fourth Horseman – The Growth Model Of Development

http://youtu.be/nfX3o8s7atk

I combined Thappu with Guitar and Bass for the first time to produce a new sound that has awakened a growing interest in this ancient instrument that I will be using to produce a line of heritage releases.

The Who Am I with Thappu

http://youtu.be/st3KCPFH2es

A clip from the very first rehearsal for this project 

I also released the single 'Walk On' which has been nominated for Best Rock song at the VIMA Music Awards India



About Me

I picked up the guitar in the year 2002 and played my first public performance in 2006 with Tantrum and went on to play with various other bands and musicians and I soon found myself, like Jimi Hendrix, Frank Zappa, Steve Vai, John McLaughlin, and other such guitarists who have broken free of the confines of musical genres, reaching out beyond the frontiers of human perception to bring back melodies, compositions, and musical techniques that express content from various states of awareness,

In January 2008 I attended the World Congress on Psychology and Spirituality - a conference held in Delhi, India where I met and interacted with people who were involved in the spiritual aspects of music. Here I underwent a shamanic initiation with Holotrophic Breathwork developed by Stanislav Grof.

In June 2009 I founded the Nevi’im ashram in Chennai, India to further explore the spiritual aspect of music, perceptual modification, music therapy, and conscious evolution.

Following the global economic collapse in 2009, I began to explore the dynamics of the global economic collapse and its implications for the future and the possibilities of expressing the impact of Global Warming and Civilizational Collapse through music. And in January 2011 in collaboration with my brother Vije, I recorded the Nevi’im ‘The Day That Never Was’, a live album aimed at articulating and raising awareness of critical issues through music.

In March 2013 I founded Moksha Studios, a place for musicians who are interested in exploring, and composing music form various non-ordinary states of awareness.

In November 2013 I was awarded the title of “Sasthrabhimani” in recognition of my work in the field of music.


What I Need & What You Get

The target for this campaign is $1,500 to cover the production cost of this EP


Perks

  •  $2 Walk On
Digital download of Walk On (single)

  •  $9 Death Of An Avatar

Digital download of Death Of An Avatar (EP)

  • $12 Death Of An Avatar & Together We May See

Digital download of Death Of An Avatar (EP) & Together We May See (Live Album)

  • $20 Death Of An Avatar & Together We May See + Bonus Tracks

Digital download of Death Of An Avatar (EP) with bonus track, Together We May See (Live Album), & two tracks off the Heritage live performance


The Impact

‘Death Of An Avatar’ is my first release as part of this FAN DRIVEN MODEL, which may become the MUSIC MODEL OF THE FUTURE.

This way your money becomes a vote for the kind of music that you like and through this new fan driven model

  • YOU DECIDE the direction in which the music industry goes.
  • YOU ENSURE that your favorite artists survive and their work becomes sustainable.
  • YOU DETERMINE the value of our music.


Other Ways You Can Help

Contributing money is not the only way you can help support this project, there are many other ways in which you can help make this campaign successful.

Help me reach as many people as possible by:

Following NEVI'IM on Facebook and inviting your friends to check out our music and 'like' our page.

Tweeting and sharing the Death Of An Avatar EP teaser with all your friends on Twitter, Facebook, and G+.

And by referring all your friends to this funding campaign

story:
What We Are Doing

Bill Carter, composer and jazz pianist, is leading his Presbybop band in a new direction. With a deep concern for the health of the earth, he has written a jazz suite that honors the "fierce beauty" of our planet. It is a significant new group of compositions inspired by the jaw-dropping vistas of the Canadian Rockies. 

"I've been there twice," he notes, "and the beauty is overwhelming. This new music will coax people to fall in love with the beauty that surrounds us, wherever we live." 

The suite is called "Beyond Banff," and it offers a musical exploration of the fragile balance between human responsibility and the natural world. 

In February 2015, Bill will take the Presbybop Sextet into Red Rock Studio to record this major work, along with other music that the band has developed since the 2011 recording of their "Interior Window" CD. We are thrilled that Dave Liebman - NEA Jazz Master and internationally known saxophonist - will be a guest soloist for this recording. 

The band has also scheduled major concerts for next May 18 (broadcast live from our local NPR station) and June 21 (near Binghamton, NY) to introduce the music to a wider audience. 

What We Need & What You Receive

We expect the recording will cost about $8900 to produce. We must pay the studio, the musicians, and the CD manufacturer. If additional funds can be secured, we will use them to upgrade the CD package, spread the word, repay the funds that Presbybop Music is putting into the project, and buy sandwiches and Cheese Doodles for the jazz guys when they are in the studio. As with our three successful campaigns in the past, we invite you to be our partner in getting this music recorded. We really need your help!

If you can help us, you will be the first to receive a copy of the CD, which will be in eco-friendly packaging. Depending on the level of support, we can also offer:

  • Access to exclusive "behind the scenes" videos with musician interviews, reflections on the music, and highlights of the recording process
  • Photographs and video clips from journeys to the Canadian Rockies that inspired the music
  • DVDs of the original premiere concert of the music  
  • Pages from the original score, autographed by the musicians in the studio
  • VIP seats at an introductory concert (May 18 or June 21)
  • A personalized thank-you video on YouTube
  • The opportunity to be listed as Associate Producer on the CD
  • Our undying gratitude!
And your donation can be tax deductible! Presbybop Music is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas - a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions on behalf of the Jazz for the Earth Project may be made here online, or made by check payable to Fractured Atlas, with "On behalf of Presbybop Music" in the memo line (contact us for details). Contributions are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law. 
We are excited about this project and hope you will be one of our partners. There are support levels for every budget and we will gratefully use every gift to make the best possible recording. Sign on today to become a partner. Spread the word among your friends through the links and widgets on this page.

The Impact

In a time of global ecological crisis, art has the power to teach and influence. This extended jazz work explores the relationships between human beings and a fragile yet merciless environment. The other new tunes included on this CD will also be a positive influence for "all people that on earth do dwell." After sneaking some of this music into our concerts, we already know it will stir your soul - and get your feet tapping!  

Thanks to our many, many supporters on three previous IndieGoGo projects, we have a perfect success record in getting the music done! Our fans are generous and persistent, and we are constantly inspired by their encouragement. With them, we want to expand the circle of those who believe that jazz can improve the quality of life. Can you help?

Other Ways You Can Help

Perhaps you cannot contribute now, but there are other ways you could help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Share the news on Facebook, Twitter, or among your friends.
  • Cheer us on - and demand that we put together a tremendous CD!

story:
Who are we?

 

Kilo and the Dew is an up and coming duo out of El Paso, TX.  We began performing and writing together in early 2013. We released our debut EP in December of 2013 which was met with positive reviews from the El Paso music community.

The El Paso music community is very diverse and we have set ourselves apart by developing music with a different sound. Coming from the city that paved the way for At the Drive In and subsequently the Mars Volta and Sparta, we want to represent our city well.

With this project, we intend to raise funds to record our first full length album. We have been in the process of writing this album since fall of 2013 and believe that this album will embody the message we are trying to get out. Follow your dream. No matter what!

We have been praised for having high energy and upbeat live performances and wasn't to capture with this new album. We will be working with an established producer who has produced bands such as: The Maine, Bless the Fall, and The Summer Set.

What We Need & What You Get

The funds raised will be used for studio time, the producers time, and the time for the mixing and mastering engineer. The total amount going to this will be $4000.

The next portion being raised is to create the physical CDs and other promotional items. The total cost for this is roughly $600.

The remaining amount of $400 will be for the travel and lodging expenses during the recording process. (The studio recording will be done at in Phoenix, AZ)

We have put together a set of pledge rewards that will satisfy those who are barley getting to know us up to those who are our most avid of fans.

The Impact

By helping us out, you are helping us advance our dream!

To fulfill this using the small amount of money we make from our day jobs, it would take nearly 2 years.

With you becoming a part of this, you are allowing us to do this project in under 1 year.

Other Ways You Can Help

We love all of you and understand that not everyone can contribute. If you are someone who does not have the means to do this, help us out by doing the following:

  • Share the campaign information with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram
  • Use the indiegogo share tools
  • Get your friends to check out our project and subscribe to our YouTube Channel

 

Thank you for being a part of this awesome project!

story:
ABOUT ME (Matt Check)

Since moving to New York City in 2006 I have been working as a Jewish Educator and also as a bluegrass musician. This unlikely work combination represents two passions in my life – my heritage and my music. The Bluegrass Kabbalat Shabbat Experience seeks to combine them.

MY VISION

The Bluegrass Kabbalat Shabbat Experience is a service featuring 10 traditional and newly composed melodies, infused with the vitality of bluegrass rhythms. It’s melodic and spiritual; it’s fun and inviting and inclusive; and it’s foot-stomping and hand-clapping. After all it IS bluegrass!

With your help, I hope to professionally record this unique music in the studio, accompanied by a group of great New York City bluegrass musicians (who also happen to be great friends). 

The recording will be a platform for bringing this style of prayerful music to communities across North America to enhance the Kabbalat Shabbat experience.

I'm raising money for the recording through March 3, 2014.  I'd love for you to partner with me on this journey.

Please take a moment to listen to the track of “L'kha Dodi,” and to peruse the list of perks available as rewards for your support.

Thanks!


WHAT NEEDS FUNDING

- Studio Fees = $5,000

- Costs = $3,500

- Release event on April 11, 2014 at the Park Slope Jewish Center (Brooklyn, NY) = $1,400

- Subtotal = $9,900

- IndieGogo Fee = $396 (4% of $9,900)

Total = $10,296

**All extra money will be donated to the Food Bank for New York City on your behalf.  This amount will be mentioned in the "Thank You" section of the website, Jewgrass.com.

story:
Hola, soy Carreyó, cantautor panameño residiendo en México. Llevo años componiéndome en canciones y buscando nuevos oídos que entiendan el mensaje detrás de los acordes de mi guitarra. Canto porque sé que la música es medicina para mi alma y para quienes se dedican escucharla.  Llevo dos discos grabados de manera independiente, estoy trabajando en el tercero y primer documental. siendo un artista que autofinancia sus proyectos hoy no no cuento con los fondos suficientes para terminarlo como quisiera y creo que se merece este mensaje.    

¿De qué trata la campaña Carreyó y tú por su disco?

  • La campaña consistirá de 40 días de acciones llevadas a cabo en la calle y por redes sociales para  lograr recolectar lo necesario para hacer realidad este nuevo disco con canciones que invitan a reflexionar de nuestra vida, y los sueños que nos esperan detrás del otro lado del miedo. También contendrá un documental mostrando el proceso creativo detrás de como se llevó a cabo esta idea.
  • El proyecto audiovisual cuenta con canciones secuenciales narrando el camino de "Jaime". Un chico que de pequeño sufre de bullying y como de grande podría tener una repercusión en la sociedad. Luego entiende que el miedo es parte de él mismo con "No te tengo, Miedo" y se atreve a decirle a una chica que le encanta: "Eres un paisaje". Luego se da cuenta que el amor va mucho más allá de lo físico, sino de quien somos por dentro y le compone "Tus Defectos Perfectos" que invita a amarnos como somos, a pesar que una relación tenga sus inviernos emocionales con "Ardes". Solo van seis canciones reveladas de las catorce que contendrá el disco. Checa los videos haciendo click en la imagen o en los links. 

Me emociona ofrecer recompensas exclusivas por sumarte a mi viaje. Desde el una canción personalizada, clases de música, conciertos caseros, hasta artículos que podría usar cualquiera. Hay muchas opciones para que te sumes al mensaje que hay detrás de este proyecto. Con este disco espero inspirar a buscar sueños con todo y sus miedos retándolos, mi intención es que las canciones sean motor de valentía, aceptación y transformación de la oscuridad a su propia luz.

Todos tenemos un camino. ¿Me ayudas a escribirlo?

Con tu aporte podremos cubrir gastos de producción, promoción, maquila y distribución de este proyecto que irán divididos de la siguiente manera:

+$1000 USD Renta de estudio y tiempo de ingeniero de grabación

+$2000 USD Mezcla y Master del disco

+$1000 USD Maquila del disco 

+$1500 USD Edición de documental 

+$500 USD Promoción en redes sociales

+$700 USD Músicos

+$1800 USD por Video musical (Quisiera hacer cuatro más si sobrepasamos la meta :) *5400

+$1300 USD Aprox Gastos de servicio por parte de la plataforma.

+$1500 USD Aprox Gastos de envío

TODO SUMA $16700 USD. Esta sería la meta idónea para contar con los videos musicales restantes, sin embargo estoy presupuestando para solo 1 video musical de primera instancia sumando un total de $11,300 USD.

  • Depende de la meta alcanzada ó superada se repartirán los fondos en este orden de prioridad de aquí a un año: Tiempo de estudio, músicos, mezcla, maquila, edición de documental, regalos (camisetas, pins, usb), video musical, conciertos caseros.
  • Por cada concierto casero obtenido, se donará una presentación en una escuela a nombre de quien aporte.

 

El impacto

Pienso en el reflejo que tiene el mensaje de este disco, en quienes han atravesado un pasado complicado, situación amorosa inconclusa ó el miedo a buscar los sueños. Este proyecto sé que dejará una conciencia de empatía y auto-aceptación a quienes le llegue.

Hace tiempo me di cuenta que mi misión con la música es llevar un mensaje entre canciones que conecten a un mundo más honesto y consciente de nosotros.

La siguiente prioridad este proyecto es enfocar la gira a varias secundarias, preparatorias y universidades donde creo es que más necesitan el mensaje de Jaime.  

Me encantará cumplir esta parte del proyecto junto a ti. 

 

Reunir once mil dólares en cuarenta días se me hace un reto difícil pero confío en que lo alcanzaremos. Confío porque llevo toda mi vida preparándome para este proyecto y durante estos días no descansaré de encontrar maneras de sumar. Confío porque no estoy solo, tú que me lees, que compartes la campaña y donas con lo que puedes, que viajas conmigo... sé que tú me ayudarás a conseguirlo.

¿Cómo más puedes ayudar?

COMPARTE COMPARTE Y COMPARTE  

Entre más personas se enteren de esta campaña, más personas podrían sumar para conseguir nuestro objetivo. Comparte esta campaña en tus redes, conversa con tus amigos y familiares. Ayudará mucho que hagas eco de este proyecto. 

Gracias por viajar conmigo.
story_txt:
Hola, soy Carreyó, cantautor panameño residiendo en México. Llevo años componiéndome en canciones y buscando nuevos oídos que entiendan el mensaje detrás de los acordes de mi guitarra. Canto porque sé que la música es medicina para mi alma y para quienes se dedican escucharla.  Llevo dos discos grabados de manera independiente, estoy trabajando en el tercero y primer documental. siendo un artista que autofinancia sus proyectos hoy no no cuento con los fondos suficientes para terminarlo como quisiera y creo que se merece este mensaje.    
¿De qué trata la campaña Carreyó y tú por su disco?

La campaña consistirá de 40 días de acciones llevadas a cabo en la calle y por redes sociales para  lograr recolectar lo necesario para hacer realidad este nuevo disco con canciones que invitan a reflexionar de nuestra vida, y los sueños que nos esperan detrás del otro lado del miedo. También contendrá un documental mostrando el proceso creativo detrás de como se llevó a cabo esta idea.
El proyecto audiovisual cuenta con canciones secuenciales narrando el camino de "Jaime". Un chico que de pequeño sufre de bullying y como de grande podría tener una repercusión en la sociedad. Luego entiende que el miedo es parte de él mismo con "No te tengo, Miedo" y se atreve a decirle a una chica que le encanta: "Eres un paisaje". Luego se da cuenta que el amor va mucho más allá de lo físico, sino de quien somos por dentro y le compone "Tus Defectos Perfectos" que invita a amarnos como somos, a pesar que una relación tenga sus inviernos emocionales con "Ardes". Solo van seis canciones reveladas de las catorce que contendrá el disco. Checa los videos haciendo click en la imagen o en los links. 


Me emociona ofrecer recompensas exclusivas por sumarte a mi viaje. Desde el una canción personalizada, clases de música, conciertos caseros, hasta artículos que podría usar cualquiera. Hay muchas opciones para que te sumes al mensaje que hay detrás de este proyecto. Con este disco espero inspirar a buscar sueños con todo y sus miedos retándolos, mi intención es que las canciones sean motor de valentía, aceptación y transformación de la oscuridad a su propia luz.

+$2000 USD Mezcla y Master del disco
+$1000 USD Maquila del disco 
+$1500 USD Edición de documental 
+$500 USD Promoción en redes sociales
+$700 USD Músicos
+$1800 USD por Video musical (Quisiera hacer cuatro más si sobrepasamos la meta :) *5400
+$1300 USD Aprox Gastos de servicio por parte de la plataforma.
+$1500 USD Aprox Gastos de envío
TODO SUMA $16700 USD. Esta sería la meta idónea para contar con los videos musicales restantes, sin embargo estoy presupuestando para solo 1 video musical de primera instancia sumando un total de $11,300 USD.

Por cada concierto casero obtenido, se donará una presentación en una escuela a nombre de quien aporte.

Pienso en el reflejo que tiene el mensaje de este disco, en quienes han atravesado un pasado complicado, situación amorosa inconclusa ó el miedo a buscar los sueños. Este proyecto sé que dejará una conciencia de empatía y auto-aceptación a quienes le llegue.

Reunir once mil dólares en cuarenta días se me hace un reto difícil pero confío en que lo alcanzaremos. story:
Om Sai Ram! 

Firstly, sincere thanks for visiting my funding page. 

 I am Balaji Manoharan, a lyricist / singer, currently based in London, UK. I mainly write and sing devotional songs. I have previously launched a Tamil devotional song on Sai Baba of Shirdi last year titled 'Unai Indri'. It was funded personally. 

The Album

Since then I've been blessed with further tunes and lyrics by Baba. I decided that giving it life on His centenary year (2018) will be appropriate. Hence the name SAI100. I subsequently met music director KK, from Chennai, who incidentally was also a Baba devotee. We decided to join hands for this project. We have so far worked on the theme, tunes and lyrics. 

The songs are planned to be tracked in good studios with great acoustics for the best listening experience. There will be several talented live instrumentalists who will decorate these compositions. All by Baba's will and grace. 

How You can Help

The outline for the songs is nearly ready. Now kicks in the task of booking studios, artists and sound engineers to get on with the work. Below's what all the funds of this campaign are going towards:

Studio Costs: Live instrument recording and voice recording for all 3 languages.  So 27 songs in total!

Paying the Musicians: To pay the musicians for their talent, time and efforts.

Mastering the Tracks: The tracks will be mastered by a super talented mixing and mastering professional, so the songs sound great anywhere. 

Music Videos: Two of the tracks from the album will have music videos made for them.

Physical Copies: For devotees who are interested, I'll have some CDs and USBs of my album made. A memorabilia is always nice.

Social Media Campaign: I want this album to reach as many Sai devotees on this planet as possible. I propose to use social media to its maximum potential through campaigns in various stages of production and launch. 

Indiegogo Fees: I need to pay Indiegogo too for providing me the platform for funding :)

Give what you can. Bucks or blessings, everything helps. To involve you further in this project, I have planned some nice perks. It is my way to say Thank You for all your support, so please don't forget to click "Get This Perk" instead of "Back It" if you want to claim one.

Other Ways You Can Help

Give me your blessings. Spread the word about my campaign, about this album, SAI100!

Tell your friends and family. If you would like to collaborate and offer any professional support, please write to me at info.saifactor@gmail.com  

Help me make this OUR tribute to SAI. Thank you for all the support!

Sai Ram!

story:
My name is René G. Boscio; I've been making music for almost 20 years, with a focus on film/TV since my late teens. I first came to Los Angeles in the fall of 2013, and began working at Cow On the Wall Studio, alongside renowned composer Blake Neely. After spending 3 years full of wonderful experiences, including the opportunity to work on over 100 episodes of television series such as Blindspot (NBC), Riverdale (The CW), The Flash (The CW), and Arrow (The CW), among others, the time came for me to embark on my own journey.

Since branching out on my own, I've composed scores for dozens of short films, documentaries, mini-series, and other independent productions. My music has also been licensed for use in television advertisements for films like Wonder Woman, as well as branded content for companies such as Chevrolet, Arm & Hammer, Mercury Insurance, and more.

On the path to pursuing my dreams of writing music for major motion pictures, I recently accomplished what I consider to be a fairly significant step: scoring my first independent feature film. In hopes of maximizing, and further immortalizing that milestone, I've decided to self-release a soundtrack album to go with the film, and this is where you come in.

Essentially, I need $3,000 to make this happen.

Since a soundtrack album wasn't budgeted into the film, it's entirely up to me to fund and release it. Even though all of the music for the film has been composed and mixed, an album release is treated differently than the tracks that end up being used in the film. Commonly, albums are mastered to ensure a consistent level throughout the tracks, as well as to achieve additional transparency in the music, making sure the music sounds as it is intended to, across all and any kind of sound source.

The soundtrack album for Killing Animals will be mastered by John Rodd.

John has been responsible for mixing and mastering the music of several of my musical heroes. Some of his credits include the Mr. Robot, Vol. 3 soundtrack, films like Get Out, Elysium, The Lincoln Lawyer, and video games such as Call of Duty: Black Ops II, and Assassin's Creed II to name a few. He will be mastering the Killing Animals soundtrack album in the same studio where he's tackled some of these projects.

Needless to say, I'm still pinching myself about having him on board.

About 80% of the money from this campaign will go towards mastering. The other 20% will be divided between the costs of actually releasing the soundtrack (getting it on platforms like Apple Music, Spotify, Amazon, etc,) and covering Indiegogo's cut.

You can check out the full list of perks in the column to the right, but here are some of the ones I'm most excited about sharing.

Digital Album Download - $10.00

You'll get exclusive early access to the soundtrack album. The album will be released digitally with the premiere of the film, but by making this contribution, you'll receive an exclusive download link as soon as it is finished.

One on One - $50.00

If you're willing to invest in my career, I'm happy to invest in yours. We'll set up a 30 minute Skype session, where I'll be open to sharing bits of wisdom that I've picked up along the way, tips on setting up an efficient workflow, as well as addressing any questions you may have about pretty much anything. 

Soundtrack To Your Life - $500.00

You've inspired me! Tell me a story you wish had a soundtrack, and get a custom 2 minute piece of music composed just for you!

Other Ways You Can Help

There are other ways you can join in on this journey:

  • Sharing goes a long way. Not only would it increase the chances of reaching the goal, but it would also create some buzz, and potentially get us featured on the Indiegogo homepage.
  • Interviews and features. Have contacts on podcasts, radio, blogs, magazines, or other platforms? Help me spread the word about the soundtrack release by connecting me to people who could be interested in interviews or featuring the soundtrack on their platform.

If We Exceed The Goal

I would be very overwhelmed and excited with your generosity, but there are several plans and possibilities which would make this album release even more impactful.

  • $3500-$4000 : I could hire a graphic designer to design the cover art for the album!
  • $4000-$5000 : We can make physical copies of the album!
  • $5000+ : We could start saving for our next soundtrack album!

Thank you for lending me your time. I look forward to sharing this music with you!

story:
Mother Who!?

 

First things first!

Click play, and listen as you read.

 

Aha! Indeed.

We are a young prog rock band from Manchester, England. 

We've been operating now for around a year and a half, and boy has it been a blast. Numerous shows, Numerous band members, and hundreds of new song ideas.

In November 2016, we released our very first (crowdfunded) EP into the world, entitled "I". We set ourselves a goal of raising £500 for four studio days, and we smashed that target. We coasted along to a comfy £750, and we had a wonderful time sharing that experience with everyone who made it real.

Cover art for "I".


Now, the time has come for us to do it all again. Bigger, better, harder, and tastier.

We've got five brand new songs that we have decided to collect in a new record we call "Noir".

We actually recorded one of these songs a while back as a sort of "Proof of concept".  Thats the song that we asked you to click play on earlier.  So if you like what you're hearing, this is the project for you.

 

Meet The Team

Reece: Thats me! Guitarist and Vocalist of the band. I write the music and i do the do.

Saul: Our beloved Drummer, where would we be without him? My best friend and the wackiest cat i know.

Liam: Our engineer and human pilot light. He works the knobs, dials and twiddly things that make the music go boom.

Adam: A wonderful artist with a real eye for the bizarre. A perfect fit for Mother Krakens music.

 

Give & Take

This is the part where we tell you what we need from you, and what we want to give back, so lets get right into it.

When we ran the campaign for "I", we were probably a little over ambitious with what we could do. We did manage to record the EP, but the entire process took place over the span of a single weekend. This resulted in a somewhat flawed end product.

We love "I" like our own child, but we simply did not have the time or resources to do that record justice.

With Noir, we want to give ourselves slightly more breathing room. Instead of £500, we're asking for £1000 in total. We've spent a long time discussing our options with our engineer Liam, and our £1000 was the number settled on.

If this goal is reached, we will be able to record Noir with much more freedom.

Aside from all the lovely little backer rewards you spy over to the right, we also want to give you unprecedented access to the band. We will be livestreaming most if not all studio sessions, and we'll also be documenting the whole thing as we did last time.  

Speaking of backer rewards, we've figured out we can cover the cost of those with £100. Which would leave us a £900 budget for the music. Awesome right?

This wont be a huge operation. It's going to be three friends, working hard in a small independent studio, trying to deliver a truly great rock EP.

Risks & Challenges

As with any crowdfunding effort, there is always the chance of failure.

This was an outcome we were prepared for the last time, and thankfully didnt have to deal with.

That said, whatever we do raise towards the record will go towards recording as much of it as we can for a single release.

 

Overall, the risk is low. We need your help, but we are determined to give you a product that we can be proud of, and that you can enjoy being part of.

 

Feel free to contact us if you have any questions or concerns.
