story:
Summary

Music is the source of continued growth and depth in every area of my life. I am excited to create this album as my contribution to the world of art and a token of my love for the musical community. The vision to write and record my original music is paramount on my artistic path and I am thrilled to include you in the actualization of this dream.

The jazz-pop group Sarca is made up of my dearest friends who are also some of the most talented professional musicians in Portland’s music scene. With community-based financial support, we can do what we do best: communicate and create.

When you give to support this project, you are not only creating this album, but you also are reinforcing the musical backbone of this beautiful city. Often on startup projects, musicians, technicians, videographers and sound engineers donate hours of time. With your help, I am determined to pay my collaborators, some of Portland’s hardest workers and greatest talent, the rate they deserve. We can join together to support musicians, technicians, photographers, and artists here in Portland for they are truly the heartbeat of the culture we know and love.

If this album is meant to be, then I am determined to pay my musicians, technicians, photographers and artists here in PDX the rate they deserve. 

What We Need & What You Get

Budget = $17,500

I have decided to budget the production of the album this way because I know that cutting corners to save money often falls on the shoulders of talented, hardworking people who made it all possible in the first place. Every recording, photo and video made for this crowd funder has been donated by artists out of the kindness of their hearts and the passion they have for what they do. While I am exceedingly grateful for their generosity, this trend is not a sustainable way for anyone  to continue to do what they love. I will not go through with the production of the album if the importance of their work cannot be reflected in the wage they receive from working with me.

Every dollar that is raised for this project is going to the musicians, engineers and artists living in Portland who have already contributed so much to the powerful medium of music and art in this city. 

Here are the forces on board with the Sarca project, and heres how much it will cost to hire them.

Breakdown of the Budget

Musicians (Rehearsing and Recording with four hired musicians) =$5,040

  • $1,260 per musician for rehearsals ($20 per hour) and recording ($30 per hour) commitment (I will not be getting paid; this budget covers paying only musicians I hire)

Preproduction, Production and Tracking = $5,010

  • Sound Engineer for tracking at Supernatural Sound: $1,200
  • Pre-Production & Production at Supernatural Sound for 3 days: $1,200
  • Recording rate at Supernatural Studios @ $320 per day for 3 days: $960
  • 3 days mixing at $550 per day:$1650

Mastering: $500

Photos: $500

Graphic Design & Album Art: $500

Videographers: $1,000

PR: $2,600

CD duplication and digital distribution: $550 (for 200 cds and CD baby distribution)

Album Release location rent space: $200

Indiegogo Fee and rewards costs: $1,200

Additional ​Expense Buffer: $400

Total: $17, 500

Band

  • Stephanie Cooke, piano & vox (leader of band, will not receive compensation)
  • Andrew Endres, guitar & vox
  • Jonas Oglesbee, drums
  • Reid Newman, tenor sax & ewi
  • Jon Lakey, bass

Steven Tracy, producer

Josh Mathys, sound engineer

Antoine Simmons, videographer

Celeste Amadee, PR

Nina Lee Johnson, photographer

Melanie Von Trapp, graphic design/album art

The Impact

The majority of funds raised will be used to hire the professionals involved in pre-production, rehearsal and recording. As you give, you raise the standard for musicians in Portland. Music that changes lives takes time, dedication and talent. With your help, music is made, but more importantly, musicians (artists, videographers, technicians) make ends meet.

Risks & Challenges

Recording and sharing original music is a vulnerable journey. Seeking financial support for that endeavor feels even riskier. I hope that others will join with me in supporting the heart and vision behind this Sarca album. I know there’s a risk that I won’t reach my goal and my dream for creating this album and infusing income and vitality into the Portland music scene may not be realized. But I’m willing to take any risk and I hope you will join with me.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute anything monetarily, I would be so grateful for your help with spreading the word and making some noise about this debut album. Sharing on social media and letting your friends and family know would be so greatly appreciated.

It takes an army to make something like this happen, and I'm incredibly grateful for your support!

Facebook:

https://www.facebook.com/stephanie.cooke.319/ab...

Soundcloud:

https://soundcloud.com/user-403496140/the-road-1

Instagram:

sarcapdx

The jazz-pop group Sarca is made up of my dearest friends who are also some of the most talented professional musicians in Portland’s music scene. With community-based financial support, we can do what we do best: communicate and create.

story:
Faith & Music

I wrote the music in REVIVAL over the past two years to counter messages of intolerance and fear with a call for love and justice. 

Raised Catholic in San Antonio, TX, I began playing guitar in my church choir when I was ten years old. I loved the music. It was uplifting and I felt deeply grounded in the themes of faith and hope. Since childhood, I have also understood social justice action as an expression of faith, following my parents to nuclear disarmament demonstrations in the 80's and protests against the first Gulf War in the 90's. And the role music played in these efforts left an impression.

My personal journey led me to Judaism and my spiritual home is a progressive synagogue in NYC, where my wife Julia and I have been members for many years. What has stayed with me, and what continues to deepen, is my understanding of sacred music as a source for replenishment and revitalization.

The work of repairing the world is hard, despairing even, but music can offer resilience and hope. Music can speak to the struggles of our times and remind us that we can still create a world that honors the earth, welcomes the stranger, and celebrates the divine in each of us. This is what REVIVAL seeks to do.

About REVIVAL

REVIVAL is spiritual folk-rock music that speaks to moral issues of our day. It features original story-driven songs performed by a small ensemble of singers and instrumentalists. Rooted largely in Hebrew biblical texts, the music expresses themes of justice and healing, and envisions a world grounded in love, compassion, and dignity for everyone. Song topics include, among others: welcoming immigrants, women's/LGBTQ empowerment, earth justice, celebrating the divine in each person, and repairing the world together. 

We first shared REVIVAL a month after the November 2016 election at WOW Cafe Theater in NYC's East Village. Since that initial three-night run we have performed the music in progressive spiritual spaces around NYC, including the 14th Street Y, Intersections International, and Congregation Beit Simchat Torah. Now we want to bring the music right to your headphones!

The Ensemble

(from left to right)

Samantha Gillogly was born in Los Angeles and began her musical training in violin at age six. She graduated summa cum laude from Berklee College of Music and is fluent in the western classical tradition. Samantha also loves the freedom and creativity of improvisation, and is an avid fan and performer of Celtic, Middle-eastern, Gypsy, and other global styles. She joined the REVIVAL ensemble in the fall of 2017.

Lea Kalisch grew up in Switzerland and writes, "I want to spark the people around me with enthusiasm... when I hear Jewish music, synagogue prayers, or traditional Yiddish songs, it goes under my skin and something magical happens. It’s healing, it’s spiritual and so is REVIVAL!” She is an original member of the REVIVAL ensemble.

Julia Ostrov is a soprano who studies classical voice and the art of davvenen’ leadership. She rediscovered her love of singing after a life-changing physical injury altered the course of her professional endeavors. Julia lives in Brooklyn with her wife Kristen (see above!), and is an original member of the REVIVAL ensemble.

Ugene Romashov is a Russian born guitarist, composer, and producer who has played and recorded with a variety of different artists in genres ranging from straight jazz to psychedelic. Improvisation has always been central to his outlook on music and life in general. Ugene joined the REVIVAL ensemble in the fall of 2017. 

Click here to read full bios!

Budget Breakdown

Your contribution to this fundraiser will help us create a professional, richly textured recording that folks can listen to whenever they want. 

Percentage Breakdown:

Dollar Breakdown:

  • Recording Costs (studio time & performer compensation): $2,950
  • Post Production (mixing & mastering): $1,475
  • Art (album design & photography): $450
  • CD Printing & Distribution: $1,825

         TOTAL: $6,700

Any funds we raise over this amount will go towards enhanced CD booklet printing and Indiegogo + credit card processing fees.

"Perks"

Contributions can be in any amount of your choosing, from $1 and up, by clicking the pink "BACK IT" button if you scroll towards the top. At certain increments, beginning at $10, you'll receive a corresponding "perk" (choose from the column on the right)-- from a digital download of the single "I Am" to a private concert in your home. 

If you live outside of the United States and want to choose a perk that involves shipping, please contact me directly by scrolling to the top of this page and clicking "Ask a Question." We'll let you know the best way to contribute and receive your perks.

With gratitude...

Our heartfelt thanks for supporting REVIVAL! Music is one vital way of bringing people together – in solidarity, in resistance, in celebration. Thank  you for joining us to help make this album happen.

story:
Inlak'esh have just finished working on 4 brand new tracks! We have worked extremely hard making these songs the best they can possibly be and it seems only right to record them in the best possible way. In the past we have recorded our 3 previous albums ourselves but we have decided our fans deserve a certain level of audio quality that only a professional producer can deliver. 

We're asking for £2500 to spend purely on getting the best audio production we possibly can. We've already found the perfect producer in an awesome studio. 

80% of the funds raised will go solely on audio production. The rest will be used to fund the manufacture of CDs and the CD artwork.

We've got some great perks for pledges including CDs, T shirts, custom Inlak'esh guitar picks, stickers and private shows but we want our fans to be a part of this campaign in a special way; We want everyone to be part of what they are helping to create. We'd love each pledger to send their name and their selfie to us and we'll make up a collage to go in the CD credits. (Contact details below)

We know we can't do this without you, so even if you can't contribute please share with your friends and help us make some noise about our campaign - and send your selfie to us anyway - we want all our fans included, pledge or no pledge. 

We'll promise to play our hearts out if you keep listening.

Much love,

Dan. C, Ash, Steve, Dan. M


 

Send your selfies to enjoyinlakesh@gmail.com or contact us via:

www.inlakesh.co.uk

Facebook

Youtube

Twitter

Instagram

Soundcloud

story:
About Us and Our Project

We  met in 2013 and quickly realized we were kindred musical souls, inspired by American acoustic and country music but also passionate about the greats of the singer-songwriter genre.  After playing as a duo (Dakota Joe) for three years, we decided we needed a change of pace, changed the name of our band to The Lean and The Plenty, and formed a backing band.  We just so happened to get some of the best musicians in the Bloomington area, with Eric Fritz on drums, Ian Ottinger on upright bass, Devin Brown on mandolin, and Andrew Van Nieuwenhze on electric guitar.  This will be our first full-length record together.  It features five Joe Bolinger songs and five Dakota Curtis songs, with one epic duet.   And we need your help to get it off the ground.  The recording process was done homemade style, with a lot of blood, sweat, and tears in the basement of our drummer Eric's garage.  We've done the hard part of writing and recording the music: now we need to get it mixed, mastered, and manufactured.  

What We Need 

We need about $800 dollar to mix, master, and manufacture the record.  Our approximate budget is:

Mixing and mastering help:  $300.00

Pictures and design help:  $200

Physical Production of the record: $300  

Pre-orders and Other Rewards

We are offering you the opportunity to pre-order the record.  That means you pay for it now, which will help us raise the money we need to get it made.  When we have the physical copies in hand, we will get it to you.  You will have already paid for it, so no need for any additional payments.  Our goal is to have the record in hand by Christmas of this year (2017).  

We are also offering other rewards for people who wish to contribute a larger amount, including personalized thank you's on our album art, audio shoutouts on the record, and even personalized concerts.

Risks & Challenges

While there are always risks in making music, there is virtually no chance that we won't make this record.  We are 100% committed to making it, come hell or high water.  The main risks here are whether there will be complications in the editing and mixing and mastering processes that might arise from having done the recording by ourselves and not with a studio.  While this was absolutely necessary for us (we could never have afforded the 100+ man hours put into the recording process if we had been paying for studio time), it does mean there could be mistakes that could cause delays.  So, the biggest risk is that your receipt of the record could be delayed beyond the current goal of Christmas 2017.  I believe the risk of this is fairly low, but it is a possibility. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute financially right now, we would greatly appreciate your spreading the word about our work, coming out to shows, and most importantly, listening!  We put our hearts and souls into our music in the hopes that it will mean something to you.  That can't happen if nobody listens.  So the most important thing to us is for you to simply do us the honor of lending your ear.

story:
Beauty From Nothing was inspired by the book "A Universe From Nothing" by Lawrence Krauss. Where does beauty come from? Did we invent it, or was it always here - a property of the universe?

SUMMARY
 

By pure happenstance, early in 2016, David Ibbett and I (Sophia Vastek) met and began having some wild, big conversations about music and art and their relationship to our reality and physical worlds... somehow, out of those conversations, came Music of Reality – a multidisciplinary event series. 

We quickly saw a mutual desire to create spaces for open dialogue between disparate fields that don’t often have clear paths for conversation.  Since our founding, we have hosted integrated events and educational workshops that put scientists and artists together on the same stage, with the aim of instigating cross-pollinating inspiration. 

This campaign will help launch us into our second year of existence with some crucial groundwork.  With your support, we will finish our first recording – the Beauty from Nothing EP, a large-scale work by David Ibbett, performed by pianist Sophia Vastek.  Additionally, your support will allow us to put on an event to celebrate the EP release and continue building the Music of Reality community.

Our release event will feature Dr. Cora Dvorkin, Harvard professor and physicist, who will talk about the Cosmic Microwave Background, as well as performances by Table Manners, a Boston-based DJ collective, new music duo Transient Canvas, pianist Sophia Vastek, and electronic music performer David Ibbett.  We are also commissioning five new works by composers Robert Honstein, Mary Kouyoumdjian, Mischa Salkind-Pearl, Stefanie Lubkowski, and Jason Charney.

BUDGET + DETAILS

We recorded at Blue House Productions in late November.  The album will be mixed at Mix One Studios in Boston, and mastered by Bob Ludwig in mid-February.   Bob Ludwig has worked with the most legendary artists of our time, including Radiohead, Wilco, Daft Punk, and David Bowie, to name just a few. 

Recording costs are: 

  • Studio time
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Physical Production

TOTAL: $2990

The release event is scheduled for April 26 at The Armory in Somerville, MA.  Your money will go first and foremost towards paying our collaborating performers and composers.  Additionally, we will use the money for the venue rental and other production costs.

Event Production costs are:

  • Venue rental
  • Piano tuning
  • Videography
  • Print materials and advertising

​TOTAL: $2000

Artist fees:

  • Performers/Ensemble fees
  • Composer fees

TOTAL: $1300

IndieGoGo/Fractured Atlas Fee:

TOTAL: $629

WHY

We have now collaborated with NYU-affiliated physicist Matthew Kleban, the NoiseGate Festival, New York University, Boston University, Yamaha, and Brandeis-affiliated biologist Paul Garrity, in addition to a community of composers and performers.

This campaign is important to our growth as an organization, but more importantly, you would be supporting a growing community of artists, researchers, and thoughtful minds who are coming together in conversation. Now, more than ever, we need open forums for conversations in the arts and sciences.

STAY IN TOUCH

If you’re unable to donate money, you can also help by spreading the word!  Every shout-out helps and is greatly appreciated.

And do stay in touch!  We’re always on the hunt for new collaborations, new ideas, and new forums for conversation and discovery.  Send us a message through our website if you’re interested in sharing ideas.  

Music of Reality is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non­profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Music of Reality must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” only. Any contribution above the value of the goods and services received by the donor is tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.
story_txt:
Beauty From Nothing was inspired by the book "A Universe From Nothing" by Lawrence Krauss. Where does beauty come from? Did we invent it, or was it always here - a property of the universe?SUMMARY By pure happenstance, early in 2016, David Ibbett and I (Sophia Vastek) met and began having some wild, big conversations about music and art and their relationship to our reality and physical worlds... somehow, out of those conversations, came Music of Reality – a multidisciplinary event series. We quickly saw a mutual desire to create spaces for open dialogue between disparate fields that don’t often have clear paths for conversation.  Since our founding, we have hosted integrated events and educational workshops that put scientists and artists together on the same stage, with the aim of instigating cross-pollinating inspiration. This campaign will help launch us into our second year of existence with some crucial groundwork.  With your support, we will finish our first recording – the Beauty from Nothing EP, a large-scale work by David Ibbett, performed by pianist Sophia Vastek.  Additionally, your support will allow us to put on an event to celebrate the EP release and continue building the Music of Reality community.Our release event will feature Dr. Cora Dvorkin, Harvard professor and physicist, who will talk about the Cosmic Microwave Background, as well as performances by Table Manners, a Boston-based DJ collective, new music duo Transient Canvas, pianist Sophia Vastek, and electronic music performer David Ibbett.  We are also commissioning five new works by composers Robert Honstein, Mary Kouyoumdjian, Mischa Salkind-Pearl, Stefanie Lubkowski, and Jason Charney.BUDGET + DETAILSWe recorded at Blue House Productions in late November.  The album will be mixed at Mix One Studios in Boston, and mastered by Bob Ludwig in mid-February.   Bob Ludwig has worked with the most legendary artists of our time, including Radiohead, Wilco, Daft Punk, and David Bowie, to name just a few. Recording costs are: 
Studio time
Mixing
Mastering
Physical Production
TOTAL: $2990The release event is scheduled for April 26 at The Armory in Somerville, MA.  Your money will go first and foremost towards paying our collaborating performers and composers.  Additionally, we will use the money for the venue rental and other production costs.Event Production costs are:
Venue rental
Piano tuning
Videography
Print materials and advertising
​TOTAL: $2000Artist fees:
Performers/Ensemble fees
Composer fees
TOTAL: $1300IndieGoGo/Fractured Atlas Fee:TOTAL: $629WHYWe have now collaborated with NYU-affiliated physicist Matthew Kleban, the NoiseGate Festival, New York University, Boston University, Yamaha, and Brandeis-affiliated biologist Paul Garrity, in addition to a community of composers and performers.This campaign is important to our growth as an organization, but more importantly, you would be supporting a growing community of artists, researchers, and thoughtful minds who are coming together in conversation. Now, more than ever, we need open forums for conversations in the arts and sciences.STAY IN TOUCHIf you’re unable to donate money, you can also help by spreading the word!  Every shout-out helps and is greatly appreciated.And do stay in touch!  We’re always on the hunt for new collaborations, new ideas, and new forums for conversation and discovery.  Send us a message through our website if you’re interested in sharing ideas.  Music of Reality is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non­profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Music of Reality must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” only. Any contribution above the value of the goods and services received by the donor is tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
Meg Lindsay's Debut EP

First and foremost, I want to thank you for taking the time to explore my campaign a little further--to learn a little about me, my life-journey, and why I'm doing what I'm doing.

The Who:

I'm Meg Lindsay--a singer-songwriter from the small town of Norwalk, Ohio and I currently reside in New Orleans, LA. My musical journey began so many years ago and surprisingly, not specifically with music. My mom used to read to me when I was little. I remember, she would point to each word as she read it aloud. I remember feeling a connection to the words; a budding interest in the way they come together to paint pictures, stories. My favorites were alway the books that could tell these stories, but with rhythm and rhyme. Each word a puzzle piece, the author carefully and intentionally put together, even if just to create a simple children’s book, I recognized the beauty of the craft and I began to fall in love with it. At age 7, my mom enrolled me in piano lessons and slowly, overtime, these two things began to merge. Somewhere around junior-high, I discovered the real magic of songwriting--and once I felt the spark, I couldn't help but fall in love. My passion for music eventually led me to move to Nashville, TN, where I was able to hone and perfect my singing and songwriting craft at Belmont University while experiencing it all first-hand in Music City, itself.

The What:

I'm looking to release this debut EP in early 2018. I've put the entirety of my life-work into these songs and I believe that this is absolutely my best yet.

With your financial support, I will have the opportunity to record at Sound Stage Studios in Nashville, TN. Sound Stage is one of Nashville’s most prestigious and historic recording facilities in the city and home to over 500 #1 hits from names such as Johnny Cash, George Strait, and Alan Jackson. It’s an absolute dream and honor to have the opportunity to record in a studio that has been a platform for so many monumental artists in the music industry. But again, I can’t do this without you.

I value your support and I welcome and appreciate any help you can give as I embark upon this this exciting yet humbling endeavor. I need to raise $3100 for this project, and with your help I believe I can do it.

The Why:

My journey to where I am today is brimming with both struggle and triumph. A picture of hills and valleys, unexpected trails, and sometimes dead ends. My story is one of both losing to and overcoming fear. The up and down roller-coaster of self-doubt has left me tired, nauseous, and somedays, paralyzed. But I'm still here. I keep getting up.

I've spent a significant part of my life weaving my roots around music. Some of the years, I've pushed my roots deep into the soil soaking up everything I can get. Others, I've spent trying to cutting them off, even letting them rot.  But like the rings of a tree trunk music is ingrained within me. I can't run from it, because it always finds a way to resurface.

So, I'm making and recording this EP because I want to put myself out there. I want you guys to see what I can really do. Heck, I want to see what I can really do. It's time I start traveling in the direction of my fear, not away from it. And this, is a step in that very direction.

What I Need & What You Get

Want to know where your donations are going and how they will help? Everything you donate will exclusively go to the following:

  • studio rental
  • engineering
  • production/tracking
  • mastering

I need to raise $3,100 for this project, and I've got some fun perks for you to enjoy all while helping me do it. You can check them all out over there ---> on the right!!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially, you can still help! By sharing this link you can get the word out to others who can. Spreading the word is a HUGE part of this campaign. You can use the Indiegogo share tools on your Facebook, Twitter, or social media outlet of choice. Sharing really is caring, my friends. Let's make this happen!

Thank you again for being a part of this important experience in my life. It means everything to me.

story:
We're Making an Album called Coyote Gunfight

Coyote Gunfight is a post-apocalyptic, spaghetti western rock opera told across 14 tracks and 2 acts. It is our ode to concept albums, rock & roll, cowboys, heavy metal, the American myth, and the progressive music we grew up on. It is very silly and awesome and we can't wait for you to hear it.

 

Who We Are

Dynamite Thunderpunch formed in late 2012 in a house built on a precarious hill with no air conditioning and constant basement flooding. One EP and four years later, we're finally ready to release the love child of our combined talents and vision.

If you've never heard us before, our first EP is available at dynamitethunderpunch.bandcamp.com. We play fast, loud, high energy rock & roll, and could probably stand to be a bit less pretentious.

 

Goals

The goal of this campaign is to lighten the load on our shoulders (or pockets?) through allowing you to pre-order this album! Recording a full length album professionally is expensive. We've been extremely fortunate to have so many people already willing to help us complete this project. However, we are paying for this album entirely out of pocket, and we need your support to make this project as big and bad as possible!

We want to be entirely transparent about where your money is going & what costs it's helping us recoup. Our album budget currently looks like:

Recording and Mixing with Audio Bridge Studios - $4000

Mastering with JR Mastering - $350 

Album Art - $100

100 physical CDs with full color insert - $180

GRAND TOTAL : $4630

This isn't including merch and any other promotional work we would like to delve into. Right now we're just paying for the bare basics of an album release, and we would love to be able to afford extended t-shirt runs, the capacity to tour more, and possibly even a vinyl release down the line, to name just a few. However, none of that can happen without your support!

 

Rewards

$5 will get you a full digital copy of our album! That's 14 songs spanning over an hour of music that will surely rustle your jimmies in all the right ways!

$10 will get you a physical and digital copy of our album for those who like to have something to hold in their hand at the end of the day!

$15 will get you a digital copy of our album and one of our existing style T-shirts! (Small and Medium sizes only; while supplies last) 

$25 will get you our $10 tier plus our limited edition Coyote Gunfight Album shirt. 

If you feel inclined to donate over $200 for some reason, we will write you a custom song! That may be an acoustic duet, it may be a drum solo, it may be a secret song we've been sitting on since 2012, or even something we figure out from your input, but no matter what, it will be all yours.

In addition: We'll be unloading some older merch we have! Any backer will get some random assortment of merchandise we have sitting around as a bonus!

 

 

The Impact

Contributing to our campaign is the most direct way to show you care and support our goals. That means more to us than any dollar amount could ever mean. 

Coyote Gunfight is already recorded. Its going to be released August 4th. BUT, we're young professionals just starting our careers, and economically speaking, making a record isn't the easiest thing to do alone. We will forever appreciate every single contribution that assists in helping this dream happen.  

 

Challenges

As stated, the album has already been recorded and is in the process of being mixed. Regardless of how this campaign performs, there is nothing that can stop our backers from receiving their copies on August 4th.

We can assure you that to our ears, this is the best product we could have made given our circumstances. Throughout the recording process, we were consistently blown away with how great everything sounds, and as a band, are so excited to share this work with you.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, then you're dead to us. DO YOU HEAR ME? YOU'RE DEAD! YOU'LL NEVER WORK IN THIS TOWN AGAIN!!

No but really, like stated above, we'll find a way to pay for this album, and there are other ways you can support us if you can't contribute right now! We're still a relatively small band, so sharing this campaign with your friends makes as much a difference as throwing us a little bit of money. Additionally, following facebook.com/dynamitethunderpunch is the BEST way outside of this campaign to keep up to date on our goings on and hear new music as it comes out.

We can't thank you enough in advance for your support, it means the world to us.

Love,

Dynamite Thunderpunch
(Max Hentosh, Michael Ragan, Michael Clouse, Mike Hühn, & Kirby)

story:
About Zack Varner

     Growing up just outside of Atlanta, Georgia, I developed an insatiable curiosity for music in my youth.  At thirteen I discovered the saxophone, and music has been a compelling force in my life ever since.  As a career musician for well over a decade now, I have spent my life studying, composing, performing and teaching in a broad spectrum of musical environments.  Five years ago I arrived in Austin, where I completed my Doctorate of Musical Arts at the University of Texas.  I also discovered a music scene that would come to shape my creative development profoundly.  

What This Project Means

     This album represents not only a personal milestone for me, but an opportunity to connect with people in a positive and creative way.  Blues in the Nude reflects the culmination of many years of hard work and artistic growth.  I believe strongly in the material I have written, and the artistry and skills of the musicians involved.  It means a great deal for me to have an album under my own name to show for this work.  Completing this project will not only help me achieve a tremendous career goal, it will allow me to share something I have  created with people.

What We Need & What You Get

     Thankfully, the creative work involved with producing a full length album from scratch is mostly complete.  However as many know, there is a great deal more to the process of releasing a record.  The Blues in the Nude band recently finished recording at Greenhaven Studio, one of Austin's finest recording facilities, and thanks to many hours of hard work and top notch engineering work, we have an excellent foundation to build upon.  

Here's where we need your support:

     The remaining part of the production process includes: mixing and mastering, CD duplication, online distribution, album artwork and design, publicity, indiegogo platform/credit card fees and shipping.  The image below displays how the funds contributed to this project will be used.

Making the CD and Getting It Out There

     Meeting our full project goal of $6,000 will provide us with everything we need to bring the record to life.  As well as covering the basic costs for producing the physical CD and online digital download, reaching this amount will allow us to put funds towards online press, radio, album reviews, regional tours and concerts!    

Funding Details

     The music industry has evolved drastically in the last few decades, and new challenges have emerged in the process of creating and sharing material, especially for independent artists lacking major label support.  Crowdfunding provides an accessible and effective solution to this challenge, and a means by which artists can produce and spread their music.  With indiegogo's "flexible funding"  platform, every dollar contributed will go directly towards the realization of this project.  In other words, we keep everything we raise.  

How to Contribute:  If you simply want to support the process, just click "back it" (located at the top right) and enter your contribution amount.  If you'd like to claim a "perk," just scroll down the right hand side of the page and select your favorite option.      

Perks!

     An exciting variety of perks are available for this project.  The CD is packaged as a high quality 4 panel digipak featuring original artwork by Ilia De La Rosa.  Signed CD's, sheet music and play-alongs, private music lessons (live or skype), your name in the album credits, a song written for you, even a private house concert and an executive producer credit are all available.  I will personally be handling the fulfillment of all items and perks, so feel free to contact me directly with any questions, comments or concerns:  zackvarnermusic@gmail.com

     The life of a musician comes with its own set of challenges, but when a project like this comes together, it makes it all worthwhile.  We appreciate your support more than you know.  Please feel free to share this project with anyone you like.  Let's reaffirm that crowdfunding is an effective way to create, fund, and share music!   

About The Band

Ross Margitza, Piano

.     

 

 

 

 

 

     Born in Detroit, Michigan, Ross Margitza is a pianist, trumpeter, composer, and arranger. He comes from a musical family with both his father and grandfather being professional pianists. Ross discovered his passion for jazz early in his life after listening to recordings of the virtuosic jazz pianist, Oscar Peterson.

     In 2009, Ross received his Bachelor of Music from Michigan State University. He has had the opportunity to perform with musicians such as Jon Faddis, Gerald Wilson, Patti Austin, Wess Anderson, Antonio Hart, Lynn Roberts, and Christian McBride. He also worked as pianist for both the Glenn Miller Orchestra and Tommy Dorsey Orchestra. Ross has had the opportunity to play internationally in various cities in Japan, Spain, and Colombia. In 2009, Ross won second place in the Phillips Jazz Piano Competition in Pensacola, Florida.

     In 2011, Ross received his Master of Music from Northern Illinois University. Soon after receiving his master's degree, Ross began teaching as music faculty at Northern Illinois University. From 2012-15, Ross worked as musical director and pianist for the American Queen, which is the largest paddlewheel steamboat in the world.

     Ross currently resides in Pasadena, California where he is the Instrumental Music Director at Flintridge Preparatory School.  He is currently working on his Doctorate of Musical Arts at the University of Texas in Austin where he is majoring in Jazz Piano Performance. 

Wayne Salzmann II, Drums

     Wayne Salzmann II is best known for his work with Grammy winning guitar virtuoso, Eric Johnson, with whom he has played multiple world tours, and recorded several Billboard no.1 albums. He has been the drum-set Instructor at the University of Texas at Austin since 2010, and has given dozens of clinics and master classes at Universities and Music Conservatories worldwide. 

     Salzmann has performed and/or recorded with a wide variety of artists such as Steve Miller, Kenny Rogers, Kris Kristofferson, Joe Satriani, Christopher Cross, Robben Ford, Mike Stern, Joe Bonamassa, Oz Noy, Sonny Landreth, Albert Lee, Bobby Mcferrin, Chris Potter, Jeff Coffin, Bill Watrous, Terence Blanchard, Esperanza Spalding, Carmen Bradford, Andre Hayward, and many more. He has been featured on dozens of albums, music videos, commercial jingles, television shows, and Hollywood film soundtracks. 

     Salzmann is an active member of the Drum Set Committee for the Percussive Arts Society, and he proudly endorses DW Drums, Pedals, and Hardware, Zildjian Cymbals, Evans Drumheads, Puresound Snare Wires, Westone In-Ear Monitors, Reunion Blues Cases, and Vic Firth Drumsticks.

Carter Arrington, Guitar

     With a driven personality, dedication to new opportunities, and a reputation for his pursuit of excellence, Carter Arrington has made passion for music the center of his life. Arrington's lifetime of professional live performance and academic training has made him one of the most sought-after guitarists in Austin, a valued private teacher, and a fixture across genres and many musical scenes.​

      Carter attended the Atlanta Institute of Music at night while still in his junior year of high school, later teaching classes after graduating. AIM provided a valuable foundation to further his education, and the city of Atlanta was home to an incredible pallet of culture, both musically and personally.  Eventually arriving in Austin to attend The University of Texas in 2003, the city's live music scene provided the ultimate training ground for his musical development. Balancing ongoing study and instruction with live performance in a variety of settings, Austin was the place to develop a career and thrive.​

     Carter has worked with a variety of artists and has shared performance/recording credits with The Crazy World of Arthur Brown, Progger, Peter Rowan, Eric Johnson, Alejandro Escovedo, Bernard Purdie, Fred Wesley, David Grissom, Crystal Bowersox, Col. Bruce Hampton, Kirk Covington, MOTOWN The Musical, Andre Hayward, Carmen Bradford, and many others both in the US and abroad. Commercial clients for studio work have included The Sundance Channel, Texas A&M, The Texas Lottery, Treviso, Louis Henna Chevrolet, among many others.​

     2016 was landmark year for new opportunities and included the release of fusion group Progger's 3rd album, "Scattering", on Ropeadope records, a run of shows with the critically acclaimed Broadway play "Motown! The Musical", headlining the Psycho Las Vegas festival with Arthur Brown, performing weekly with guitar monster David Grissom, and some touring with rock-icon Alejandro Escovedo. A show with the ATL Collective presenting music from James Brown's Funky Christmas presented the opportunity to perform for some of the Brown family and to share the stage with legends Bernard Purdie(Steely Dan, Aretha Franklin) and James' long standing trombonist, Fred Wesley. ​​

Mark Gonzalez, Trombone

     Grammy award winning Mark Valentino Gonzales, or "Speedy G" as he is often called, has been impressing audiences with his style, versatility and musicality since he arrived in Texas from Philadelphia in 1990. While attending the University of North Texas he had the honor of being a member of the famed One O'Clock Lab Band under the direction of Neil Slater. He received a Bachelors in Music Education and began gigging regularly in the Dallas-Fort Worth area absorbing a vast number of musical styles and genres.

     During his time at U.N.T. he joined the Soul/R&B/Funk powerhouse, Mingo Fishtrap which has enjoyed great popularity since the early '90's. Mark and the group moved to Austin in 1999.  Joining Grupo Fantasma in late 2008, his gritty trombone sound has been a welcome addition to the band. Their 2011 album, El Existential which featured many arrangements done by Gonzales won a Grammy for best Latin Rock Alternative/Urban album. Amongst many awards and accolades, they have recently been inducted into the Austin Music Hall of Fame.

     When in Austin, Gonzales is very active in the Hot Jazz/Dixie scene, playing with Aunt Ruby's Sweet Jazz Babies, the East Side Dandies and others. He has also become popular among composers, producers and songwriters for his horn arranging abilities.

     Throughout his career, Mark as had the honor of playing and/or working with artists such as Erykah Badu, Bonnie Raitt, Justin Timberlake, Questlove, Delbert McClinton, Steve Berlin, GZA (Wu-Tang Clan), Steve Berlin, Los Lobos, Father John Misty, Lila Downs, Kris Kristofferson, Galactic, Greg Boyer, Spoon, DJ Jazzy Jeff, Larry Harlow, Stephen Bruton, The Neville Brothers, Ozomatli, Stanton Moore, Raul Malo, Frankie Valli, The Scabs and Bob Schneider, amongst others.

Adrian Ruiz, Trumpet

     Dr. Adrian Ruiz serves as the Director of Jazz Studies at the University of Texas at San Antonio. Courses taught at UTSA include: Jazz Ensemble, Jazz Combo, History and Styles of Jazz, and Private Jazz Improvisation.

     Dr. Ruiz is active as a freelance trumpeter, performing regularly throughout the state of Texas. He has performed internationally at the Montreux, North Sea, and Taichung Jazz Festivals. He has shared the stage with the following musical acts: Justo Almario, Angela Bofill, Carmen Bradford, Tony Campise, John Clayton, Richie Cole, Kirk Covington, Gerry Gibbs, Terry Gibbs, Al Grey, Andre Hayward, Jon Hendricks, Vincent Herring, Conrad Herwig, Will Kennedy, Doug Lawrence, Jerry Lee Lewis, Jason Marsalis, Johnny Mathis, Buddy Miles, Butch Miles, James Moody, James Morrison, Michael Philip Mossman, Eddie Palmieri, Bernadette Peters, Tito Puente, Jr., Rufus Reid, Graham Reynolds, Joan Rivers, Joshua Redman, Maria Schneider, The Temptations, Clark Terry, War, Mary Wilson and The Supremes, and Red Young.

     In addition to his performance schedule, Dr. Ruiz has presented clinics at the Texas Music Educators Association (TMEA) and the Texas Bandmasters Association (TBA) Conventions. He has served as an adjudicator at band contests, jazz festivals, and has presented masterclasses at various school districts throughout San Antonio and Austin.

     In May 2017, Ruiz made his recording debut as a leader, releasing his first full length album entitled Premiere: A Collection Of Originals. Scott Yanow, acclaimed jazz journalist/historian and author, states the following concerning Premiere: "Adrian Ruiz is an impressive trumpeter who makes his recording debut as a leader on Premiere...In addition to being a fine showcase for the Adrian Ruiz Quintet, Premiere: A Collection Of Originals, is a fun set of creative jazz that is easily recommended."

     Dr. Ruiz received his Bachelor of Music Studies from the University of Texas at San Antonio, Master of Music from Texas State University, and Doctor of Musical Arts in Jazz Trumpet Performance from the University of Texas at Austin.

Daniel Durham, Bass

   After studying at the New England Conservatory of Music in Boston, Massachusetts, Daniel Durham returned to his native Texas.  As a dedicated young bassist, he has become a prominent fixture of the Austin music scene.  He may be found performing almost every night of the week with Mente Clara, Rich Harney, Andre Hayward, Church on Monday and many other artists.  Durham has numerous album credits to his name, including studio records by Russell Haight, Elias Haslanger, Tommy Howard, and more.  His infectious swing feel, rich and powerful tone, and thoughtful lyricism keep Daniel in constant demand as an Austin, Texas bassist.

Bennett Wood, Saxophones

     Dr. Bennett Wood is an accomplished music pedagogue and performer living in central Texas.  Wood has served as a member of music faculty at Texas State University since 2013. Prior to his current appointment at Texas State University, he taught saxophone and directed the jazz ensemble at Texas Lutheran University and taught applied saxophone at Texas A&M University-Kingsville.

     As a professional musician, Wood has performed alongside internationally recognized musicians including Lukas Graham, Conrad Herwig, Nat Adderley Jr., Andre Hayward, Bruce Saunders, Doug Lawrence, Butch Miles, Ralph Bowen, Reggie Thomas, and Red Young. In 2009, Wood auditioned for and was selected by internationally acclaimed saxophonist Greg Osby to perform alongside Osby and St. Louis legend Willie Aikens for a weekend of performances at Jazz at the Bistro in St. Louis, Missouri. In addition to leading his own trio, Wood has appeared as a regular member of many of central Texas’ top ensembles: the N.O.W. (“New Original Works”) Jazz Orchestra, the Gabriel Santiago Quintet, Wayne Salzmann II’s Groove Society, the Akina Adderley Quartet, and the Urban Achievers Brass Brand.

     Wood earned a Doctorate of Musical Arts from the University of Texas at Austin in 2014. While attending UT Austin, he studied with John Mills, Jeff Hellmer, and John Fremgen, including additional study with Bob Duke and Laurie Scott. He holds Bachelor of Music and a Master of Music degrees from Southern Illinois University Edwardsville, where he studied with Jason Swagler, Reggie Thomas, Brett Stamps, Rick Haydon, and Tom Kennedy. Wood performed with each of his primary professors in professional settings. As a student, Wood performed with jazz greats including Maria Schneider, John Clayton, Terrell Stafford, David Bixler, Russell Gunn, Scott Whitfield, and Houston Person.

Ilia De La Rosa, Cello

     Originally from The Dominican Republic, Ilia De La Rosa began her musical studies at the age of eleven in the Escuela Elemental de Musica Elila Mena. During her studies there, Ilia was recognized as the Greatest Music Galardon in music literature and cello for four consecutive years.  She was a member of orchestral organizations such as the Sistema Nacional de Orquestas Infantiles y Juveniles,  La Orquesta Filarmonica de Santo Domingo and the Orquesta Juan Pablo Duarte.   With these orchestras, Ilia  participated in many didactic and popular concerts both local and international.  She continued her music studies at the Conservatorio Nacional de Musica with cellist Angela Holguin.  

     In 2004, she was awarded with a full Music Scholarship to pursue undergraduate studies at Columbus State University in Columbus, Georgia. After receiving her Bachelor’s Degree, Ilia studied privately with Martha Gershefski in Atlanta, Georgia. In 2012 she toured China and Japan with the Hollywood Film Orchestra. The tour consisted of 44 days and 25 concerts in 23 cities, including Beijing and Chengdu in China; Sapporo and Tokyo in Japan. That same year, Ilia was featured on the cover of the Southwestern Musician Magazine.  In 2013, she received a Masters Degree in Music Performance and Ethnomusicology from the University of North Texas in Denton. There she studied with cellist Eugene Osadchy and performed with the prestigious Center Stage Piano Trio/Quartet, as well as the New Music ensemble: Nova.  

     Ilia has also premiered several new works and collaborated on studio recordings with various artists in the Dominican and the United States.  She has also enjoyed collaborating with fellow musicians and composers and has premiered and recorded numerous compositions.  In the course of their studies Ilia has had the opportunity to perform in master classes for artists such as Andrés Díaz, MihaiTetel, Gregory Sauer,  The Borromeo String Quartet, the Kelemen Quartet, the Díaz Trio and the Prazak String Quartet among others.
story_txt:
About Zack Varner
     Growing up just outside of Atlanta, Georgia, I developed an insatiable curiosity for music in my youth.  At thirteen I discovered the saxophone, and music has been a compelling force in my life ever since.  As a career musician for well over a decade now, I have spent my life studying, composing, performing and teaching in a broad spectrum of musical environments.  Five years ago I arrived in Austin, where I completed my Doctorate of Musical Arts at the University of Texas.  I also discovered a music scene that would come to shape my creative development profoundly.  
What This Project Means
     This album represents not only a personal milestone for me, but an opportunity to connect with people in a positive and creative way.  Blues in the Nude reflects the culmination of many years of hard work and artistic growth.  I believe strongly in the material I have written, and the artistry and skills of the musicians involved.  It means a great deal for me to have an album under my own name to show for this work.  Completing this project will not only help me achieve a tremendous career goal, it will allow me to share something I have  created with people.
What We Need & What You Get
     Thankfully, the creative work involved with producing a full length album from scratch is mostly complete.  However as many know, there is a great deal more to the process of releasing a record.  The Blues in the Nude band recently finished recording at Greenhaven Studio, one of Austin's finest recording facilities, and thanks to many hours of hard work and top notch engineering work, we have an excellent foundation to build upon.  
Here's where we need your support:
     The remaining part of the production process includes: mixing and mastering, CD duplication, online distribution, album artwork and design, publicity, indiegogo platform/credit card fees and shipping.  The image below displays how the funds contributed to this project will be used.

Making the CD and Getting It Out There
     Meeting our full project goal of $6,000 will provide us with everything we need to bring the record to life.  As well as covering the basic costs for producing the physical CD and online digital download, reaching this amount will allow us to put funds towards online press, radio, album reviews, regional tours and concerts!    
Funding Details
     The music industry has evolved drastically in the last few decades, and new challenges have emerged in the process of creating and sharing material, especially for independent artists lacking major label support.  Crowdfunding provides an accessible and effective solution to this challenge, and a means by which artists can produce and spread their music.  With indiegogo's "flexible funding"  platform, every dollar contributed will go directly towards the realization of this project.  In other words, we keep everything we raise.  
How to Contribute:  If you simply want to support the process, just click "back it" (located at the top right) and enter your contribution amount.  If you'd like to claim a "perk," just scroll down the right hand side of the page and select your favorite option.      
Perks!
     An exciting variety of perks are available for this project.  The CD is packaged as a high quality 4 panel digipak featuring original artwork by Ilia De La Rosa.  Signed CD's, sheet music and play-alongs, private music lessons (live or skype), your name in the album credits, a song written for you, even a private house concert and an executive producer credit are all available.  I will personally be handling the fulfillment of all items and perks, so feel free to contact me directly with any questions, comments or concerns:  zackvarnermusic@gmail.com
     The life of a musician comes with its own set of challenges, but when a project like this comes together, it makes it all worthwhile.  We appreciate your support more than you know.  Please feel free to share this project with anyone you like.  Let's reaffirm that crowdfunding is an effective way to create, fund, and share music!   
About The Band
Ross Margitza, Piano
.     
 
 
 
 
 
     Born in Detroit, Michigan, Ross Margitza is a pianist, trumpeter, composer, and arranger. He comes from a musical family with both his father and grandfather being professional pianists. Ross discovered his passion for jazz early in his life after listening to recordings of the virtuosic jazz pianist, Oscar Peterson.
     In 2009, Ross received his Bachelor of Music from Michigan State University. He has had the opportunity to perform with musicians such as Jon Faddis, Gerald Wilson, Patti Austin, Wess Anderson, Antonio Hart, Lynn Roberts, and Christian McBride. He also worked as pianist for both the Glenn Miller Orchestra and Tommy Dorsey Orchestra. Ross has had the opportunity to play internationally in various cities in Japan, Spain, and Colombia. In 2009, Ross won second place in the Phillips Jazz Piano Competition in Pensacola, Florida.
     In 2011, Ross received his Master of Music from Northern Illinois University. Soon after receiving his master's degree, Ross began teaching as music faculty at Northern Illinois University. From 2012-15, Ross worked as musical director and pianist for the American Queen, which is the largest paddlewheel steamboat in the world.
     Ross currently resides in Pasadena, California where he is the Instrumental Music Director at Flintridge Preparatory School.  He is currently working on his Doctorate of Musical Arts at the University of Texas in Austin where he is majoring in Jazz Piano Performance. 
Wayne Salzmann II, Drums     Wayne Salzmann II is best known for his work with Grammy winning guitar virtuoso, Eric Johnson, with whom he has played multiple world tours, and recorded several Billboard no.1 albums. He has been the drum-set Instructor at the University of Texas at Austin since 2010, and has given dozens of clinics and master classes at Universities and Music Conservatories worldwide.      Salzmann has performed and/or recorded with a wide variety of artists such as Steve Miller, Kenny Rogers, Kris Kristofferson, Joe Satriani, Christopher Cross, Robben Ford, Mike Stern, Joe Bonamassa, Oz Noy, Sonny Landreth, Albert Lee, Bobby Mcferrin, Chris Potter, Jeff Coffin, Bill Watrous, Terence Blanchard, Esperanza Spalding, Carmen Bradford, Andre Hayward, and many more. He has been featured on dozens of albums, music videos, commercial jingles, television shows, and Hollywood film soundtracks.      Salzmann is an active member of the Drum Set Committee for the Percussive Arts Society, and he proudly endorses DW Drums, Pedals, and Hardware, Zildjian Cymbals, Evans Drumheads, Puresound Snare Wires, Westone In-Ear Monitors, Reunion Blues Cases, and Vic Firth Drumsticks.Carter Arrington, Guitar     With a driven personality, dedication to new opportunities, and a reputation for his pursuit of excellence, Carter Arrington has made passion for music the center of his life. Arrington's lifetime of professional live performance and academic training has made him one of the most sought-after guitarists in Austin, a valued private teacher, and a fixture across genres and many musical scenes.​      Carter attended the Atlanta Institute of Music at night while still in his junior year of high school, later teaching classes after graduating. AIM provided a valuable foundation to further his education, and the city of Atlanta was home to an incredible pallet of culture, both musically and personally.  Eventually arriving in Austin to attend The University of Texas in 2003, the city's live music scene provided the ultimate training ground for his musical development. Balancing ongoing study and instruction with live performance in a variety of settings, Austin was the place to develop a career and thrive.​     Carter has worked with a variety of artists and has shared performance/recording credits with The Crazy World of Arthur Brown, Progger, Peter Rowan, Eric Johnson, Alejandro Escovedo, Bernard Purdie, Fred Wesley, David Grissom, Crystal Bowersox, Col. Bruce Hampton, Kirk Covington, MOTOWN The Musical, Andre Hayward, Carmen Bradford, and many others both in the US and abroad. Commercial clients for studio work have included The Sundance Channel, Texas A&M, The Texas Lottery, Treviso, Louis Henna Chevrolet, among many others.​     2016 was landmark year for new opportunities and included the release of fusion group Progger's 3rd album, "Scattering", on Ropeadope records, a run of shows with the critically acclaimed Broadway play "Motown! The Musical", headlining the Psycho Las Vegas festival with Arthur Brown, performing weekly with guitar monster David Grissom, and some touring with rock-icon Alejandro Escovedo. A show with the ATL Collective presenting music from James Brown's Funky Christmas presented the opportunity to perform for some of the Brown family and to share the stage with legends Bernard Purdie(Steely Dan, Aretha Franklin) and James' long standing trombonist, Fred Wesley. ​​Mark Gonzalez, Trombone     Grammy award winning Mark Valentino Gonzales, or "Speedy G" as he is often called, has been impressing audiences with his style, versatility and musicality since he arrived in Texas from Philadelphia in 1990. While attending the University of North Texas he had the honor of being a member of the famed One O'Clock Lab Band under the direction of Neil Slater. He received a Bachelors in Music Education and began gigging regularly in the Dallas-Fort Worth area absorbing a vast number of musical styles and genres.     During his time at U.N.T. he joined the Soul/R&B/Funk powerhouse, Mingo Fishtrap which has enjoyed great popularity since the early '90's. Mark and the group moved to Austin in 1999.  Joining Grupo Fantasma in late 2008, his gritty trombone sound has been a welcome addition to the band. Their 2011 album, El Existential which featured many arrangements done by Gonzales won a Grammy for best Latin Rock Alternative/Urban album. Amongst many awards and accolades, they have recently been inducted into the Austin Music Hall of Fame.     When in Austin, Gonzales is very active in the Hot Jazz/Dixie scene, playing with Aunt Ruby's Sweet Jazz Babies, the East Side Dandies and others. He has also become popular among composers, producers and songwriters for his horn arranging abilities.     Throughout his career, Mark as had the honor of playing and/or working with artists such as Erykah Badu, Bonnie Raitt, Justin Timberlake, Questlove, Delbert McClinton, Steve Berlin, GZA (Wu-Tang Clan), Steve Berlin, Los Lobos, Father John Misty, Lila Downs, Kris Kristofferson, Galactic, Greg Boyer, Spoon, DJ Jazzy Jeff, Larry Harlow, Stephen Bruton, The Neville Brothers, Ozomatli, Stanton Moore, Raul Malo, Frankie Valli, The Scabs and Bob Schneider, amongst others.Adrian Ruiz, Trumpet     Dr. Adrian Ruiz serves as the Director of Jazz Studies at the University of Texas at San Antonio. Courses taught at UTSA include: Jazz Ensemble, Jazz Combo, History and Styles of Jazz, and Private Jazz Improvisation.     Dr. Ruiz is active as a freelance trumpeter, performing regularly throughout the state of Texas. Conventions. He has served as an adjudicator at band contests, jazz festivals, and has presented masterclasses at various school districts throughout San Antonio and Austin.     In May 2017, Ruiz made Saxophones     Dr. Bennett Wood is an accomplished music pedagogue and performer living in central Texas.  Wood has served as a member of music faculty at Texas State University since 2013. story:
Short Summary

I have single-handedly recorded all pieces including drums, guitars, horns, orchestra and electronic synthesis.  The finishing step is to have the songs professionally mixed and mastered before submitting the work for publishing. 

My intention is to have a finished product ready to be released early 2019.

Below is a bit more info about myself, the project and it's expenses.

Where the funds go

  1. Post production
    • Mixing, Editing and Mastering
  2. Album Design and Artwork
    • Album art is being designed by: Krista Schiesser http://www.kristaschiesser.com/
  3. Publishing Costs
    • The finished album will be submitted through a publishing company to reach all streaming platforms including, but not limited to:  Apple Music, Spotify, Amazon Music
    • Hard copies will be ordered for distribution and demo/promotional purposes

*If the goal is not met, all funds will still go to the services described above.  

The Impact

This album is important to me because it is the start of my creative portfolio.  I wanted to explore ways in which live instrumentation could be arranged with modern electronic synthesis and sound design while including elements of pop music.  I am currently recruiting other musicians, DJ's and other creatives to help turn these recordings into a live performance!

By finalizing this project, it will open the doors to sharing more of my original music including a succession of hip-hop beats and live arrangements. 

Other Ways You Can Help

To those who are unable to support through donation, you can still help by spreading the word and sharing my campaign with friends, family and coworkers.

  • Share this campaign page on social media:
    • Instagram:  @k.shepardmusic
    • FaceBook:   facebook.com/kshepardmusic
    • Twitter:  @kshepardmusic
  • Email the link to this page to friends and family

story:
Our Project

Since intersecting in 2009 during a choral collaboration, we became enamored with each other’s work – Margot Rood’s soprano voice of "luminosity and grace" (New York Times) and Heather Gilligan’s compositional voice with  “flowing impressionism pared down to pentatonic counterpoint” (New Music Box).  In 2014, we presented a concert of Heather’s vocal music and continue to collaborate on commissions and concerts.  Now, with the help of fantastic musical artists from all around the New England area, we are embarking on an exciting venture to produce a full album of these compositions, including a new work for soprano and percussion which Heather will complete by January 2017. Please take a look at our SoundCloud page to get a better idea of the work we've done so far! https://soundcloud.com/heather-gilligan-1/tracks

What We Need & What You Get

We have completed the recording of two full song cycles, a total of seven tracks, with another cycle scheduled for recording in July 2016.  We were thrilled when Albany Records showed interest in our project and offered to release our CD on its classical music label! With three song cycles still to record, we are seeking funds to pay our nine guest artists a competitive wage, to cover the engineering and editing fees for our engineer Christopher Swist, and to ensure a place on the Albany Records 2017 release list.  

Recording sessions will take place according to this timeline:

August 2016 - record “Winged Reflections,” 3 songs for soprano, saxophone, and piano (texts by Lisa DeSiro and Mimi White); December 2016 - record “Battlegrounds,” 4 songs for soprano and string quartet (texts by E. Ethelbert Miller); January 2017 - record 3 new songs for soprano and percussion (texts by Lisa DeSiro).

We have a plethora of perks and incentives for donating to our campaign, including a copy of our completed CD, a chance to sponsor an individual artist, and an opportunity to underwrite a new piece of music that will be personally dedicated to YOU!

Who We Are

Heather Gilligan, composer and pianist, is Associate Professor of Music at Keene State College where she teaches music theory and composition. She is also a member of the Boston Composers' Coalition, a group of seven composers dedicated to the creation, performance, education, and dissemination of new American music.

Margot Rood is a versatile soprano who specializes in chamber music, oratorio, and music of the 20th and 21st centuries.  She has performed as soloist with some of the United States’ premiere new music ensembles and was a 2015 recipient of the St. Botolph Club Foundation's Emerging Artist Award for her work in new music as well as Emmanuel Music's Lorraine Hunt Lieberson Fellowship.

Christopher Swist, recording engineer, percussionist, and published composer, has produced two albums of his own works, earning critical acclaim for the recording quality on both albums.  He is Artist in Residence at Keene State College where he has taught music technology, percussion, composition, and music theory since 2003.

The artists joining us on this album are nationally-known musicians based in New England:

Damien Francoeur-Krzyzek, piano; Seelan Manickam, trumpet; Patrick Owen, cello; Amy Garapic, percussion; Ken Radnofsky, saxophone; and the Apple Hill String Quartet: Elise Kuder, violin; Colleen Jennings, violin; Mike Kelley, viola; Rupert Thompson, cello. 

The Impact

A successful campaign will help this project in several ways. This campaign will

  • increase opportunities and skills for the artists featured on the recording
  • further expand the contemporary classical music repertoire
  • raise the profile of a female composer with an exciting and relevant voice.

Other Ways You Can Help

If donating is simply not in the cards for you at the moment here's what you can do to help spread the word:

  • Tell a music-loving friend about our campaign by emailing the campaign URL!
  • Share our campaign on Facebook and Twitter and tag anyone who may be interested in our work!

to this timeline:
August 2016 - record “Winged Reflections,” 3 songs
for soprano, saxophone, and piano (texts by Lisa DeSiro and Mimi White); December 2016 - record “Battlegrounds,” 4 songs for
soprano and string quartet (texts by E. Ethelbert Miller); January 2017 - record 3 new songs for soprano and
percussion (texts by Lisa DeSiro).
We have a plethora of perks and incentives for donating to our campaign, including a copy of our completed CD, a chance to sponsor an individual artist, and an opportunity to underwrite a new piece of music that will be personally dedicated to YOU!

Who We Are
Heather Gilligan, composer and pianist, is Associate Professor of Music at Keene State College where she teaches music theory and composition. She is also a member of the Boston Composers' Coalition, a group of seven composers dedicated to the creation, performance, education, and dissemination of new American music.
Margot Rood is a versatile soprano who specializes in chamber music, oratorio, and music of the 20th and 21st centuries.  She has performed as soloist with some of the United States’ premiere new music ensembles and was a 2015 recipient of the St. Botolph Club Foundation's Emerging Artist Award for her work in new music as well as Emmanuel Music's Lorraine Hunt Lieberson Fellowship.
Christopher Swist, recording engineer, percussionist, and published composer, has produced two albums of his own works, earning critical acclaim for the recording quality on both albums.  He is Artist in Residence at Keene State College where he has taught music technology, percussion, composition, and music theory since 2003.
The artists joining us on this album are nationally-known musicians based in New England:
Damien Francoeur-Krzyzek, piano; Seelan Manickam, trumpet; Patrick Owen, cello; Amy Garapic, percussion; Ken Radnofsky, saxophone; and the Apple Hill String Quartet: Elise Kuder, violin; Colleen Jennings, violin; Mike Kelley, viola; Rupert Thompson, cello. 
The Impact

A successful campaign will help this project in several ways. This campaign will  increase opportunities and skills for the artists featured on the recording
 further expand the contemporary classical music repertoire raise the profile of a female composer with an exciting and relevant voice.


    
Other Ways You Can Help
 If donating is simply not in the cards for you at the moment here's what you can do to help spread the word:  Tell a music-loving friend about our campaign by emailing the campaign URL! Share our campaign on Facebook and Twitter and tag anyone who may be interested in our work!

story:
Creating Our First EP

Everyone in Crooked Spines individually takes part in many musical acts based throughout Ohio.  Conor Stratton, former member of Wheels and Speaking Suns, current member of Blond and the Wonderfool, is finally launching a new project of his own supported by a talented group of musicians.   Matt Vinson (Wonderfool) is on Guitar and back up vocals, Rory Papania (Wheels, Gaptooth Grin) is on Bass and back up vocals, and Eric Jordan (Blond) is on Drums.   This outfit has exploded into a pool of creativity, and Crooked Spines has now cultivated their material into a refined EP being recorded in Athens, Ohio on February 20th! 

What We Need & What You Get

  • It is going to cost us $800 to record, mix and master our new EP and, simply put, as a new band we do not have the funds.  We are so very excited to record our music so that everyone can hear our art and enjoy it for themselves. 
  • We will reward every single person who contributes to this fundraiser with unique and personal gifts, such as a mixtape made just for you, thank you letters, a one print custom t shirt just for you, as well as many other gifts to show our gratitude.
  • If we do not reach our entire goal, we will put it towards the record and scrounge what we have to try to cover the difference, if we can't we will at least make shirts and simple tapes to give to those who donated!

The Impact

We, and many other musicians who work on their own without the support of a label, management, or booking agents, care so much about our art and want nothing more than for people to be able to listen to it and appreciate it.   We have been hard at work sifting through dozens of new songs, rehearsing them, revising them and preparing them ultimately to get to this point where we can finally record and release a new EP.   We feel very strongly that with this recording, we will be making a step towards a bigger future for the band, but we will not get there without your support. 

Risks & Challenges

The greatest risk of all is that we won't be able to afford our studio time, which will put us in debt and make it very hard to purchase physical copies of our music to deliver to our fans and to labels that might be interested in support a full length release.  This would be very unfortunate, but we are committed to recording this music and bringing it out into the world for all to enjoy. 

Other Ways You Can Help

PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE spread the word to your friends/family via social media, email, and in person.  It is not only helping us to raise funds, but it is simultaneously raising awareness about our project and music.  

Thank you all so much for your contribution whether it be financial, or through the support of spreading the word and wishing us good luck.  We all appreciate you so much!

story:
Ever since I started writing and recording my own material I've always managed to squeeze in an instrumental or two. My favourites have always been the tunes that were experimental or challenging. I'm especially proud of the alternate stringing I created and used on pieces like Wolfworld.

The music in this collection has rarely been performed. Some of the pieces are from the very start of my career and the CDs have been out of print for years. One tune is a completely re-imagined version of one of my favourites. The highlight is the recently composed "In Deep" which I wrote while working for G Adventures in Svalbard. All the tracks have been brought to brilliant life using the best Landr mastering algorithm.

Your purchase of a digital download or CD supports me on my continuing musical journey!

story:
What's it all about?


In my adult life, I've always had to prioritise playing other people's music and other projects to pay the rent. Then, a tour that I was booked to play on was cancelled and I realised that I needed to think about the way my career was developing. With my new-found time and determination to make the best out of the situation, I realised that now was the time to prioritise my own music and finally make the album!

I'm going to need at least £6k to make this project happen as intended. Those who know me will know that I've never been a rich person (who'd be a musician?), and this amount of money is simply out of my personal reach. I don't see this project as a business venture, it's an artistic one - I'm fully expecting to make a loss - but I'm bursting to make a great album. 

The vast majority of the budget will be spent on musician fees, studio time and mixing and mastering(around £4.5k). I believe in supporting the music community and paying a fair price for the talents and facilities of others while keeping the project tangible. I will be using top musicians on this project, and as such, will be requiring excellent post-production and engineering to do their exceptional performances justice.

The remaining £1.5k will be going on the production of CDs, Artwork, and the fulfilment of perks!

I've enlisted the help of epic rhythm section heroes Dave Marks (bass) and Darby Todd (drums) to get the ball rolling, but expect more announcements about guests and contributors as the campaign progresses...

I will take absolutely none of the money as a wage or to buy equipment. Every penny will be spent on making the album as good as it can possibly be.

I would LOVE to absolutely smash the target amount! If this is achieved, it'll give me the opportunity to create extra perks and potentially create a budget to create more and better content. I'm thinking along the lines of a music video, a big name special guest, or even an orchestral session! 
 

The Story So Far

Since first picking up the guitar, I've been writing music, this eventually led to me earning a PhD in classical composition and creating educational content for guitarists around the world with jamtrackcentral.com. But these two sides of what I do, playing and writing, have remained largely separate, until now...

I'm not messing around with this project: I want to produce the album to a professional standard while featuring world-class musicians. Quite simply, that costs a lot of money. But I've never shied away from a big, ambitious project.

My album will be an expression of my interests in fusion, prog-rock and contemporary classical music (check out the music underneath the campaign video... that kind of thing!). It certainly won't be your typical instrumental guitar album. A record label probably wouldn't go near this kind of thing in an ever more risk-averse industry, but that's why I'm turning straight to the people who are interested in what I do for support. 



 

Risks & Challenges

The campaign runs for 60 days, so please don't delay in your support! Please help me reach as many people as possible by sharing this page!

If we don't reach the target amount, Indiegogo take a significantly bigger cut - depending on the level of shortfall, the album may have to become a long EP/mini album, but will still be produced to a very, very high standard. I would rather deliver a short album that's extremely good, than a long album that's mediocre!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please, please, please, if nothing else, share this page using Indiegogo's share tools.
  • Go over to My Facebook Artist Page and give it a cheeky 'Like'
  • Share or react to any of my Jamtrackcentral.com products!

Thanks for checking out this campaign!
